Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cdvcfc
Reviews.Content: 30 year old couple from uk stayed for 5 nights good points.... comfortable bed ipod dock clean room and bathroom Free coffee well finished quiet staff very friendly and helpful free to use safe in room fridge Room to keep luggage in on last day after checking out. Gym (only realised this as we were leaving) Good shower The best thing is the location. Five minute walk to times square and five minute walk to grand central station Bad points..... Room was dark. Little or no natural light. Small room but we expected this. Big enough for us and i'm 6 foot 5. No soap dish

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: leej321
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother, and I are were in town for a wedding at the Harvard Club. The Mansfield is directly across the street, so we booked a room here. Upon arrival the very pleasant front desk person said, "I'm going to put you in a nice room." Imagine our surprise when we opened the door and it was the penthouse suite! It was tremendously spacious, and not just by midtown standards. It was truly the most finely appointed hotel room I've ever stayed. The impressive photos on the website do not exaggerate; in fact I don't think they do it justice in terms of overall scale. No street noise from our room. Staff was very friendly, personable and helpful. Parking is a piece of cake and surprisingly not as expensive as expected. I would describe the decor as rich and opulent, but still understated. It fits in very well with the local surroundings/atmosphere. There is no place like New York, and in New York, there is no place like the Mansfield. Thanks for providing us an experience that we enjoy sharing with our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Avenue, Fifth Avenue, that is...”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan real estate from 5th Avenue to 6th on 44th Street is a favorite stretch of mine, fine hotels, shops and eateries and many of the structures on the street are designated landmarks (The New York Yacht Club, for one). I have stayed in most of the hotels on Forty Fourth and was always intrigued by The Mansfield Apartments, a lovely building on the south side of the street, ticked it off my list, just last week. Spent two nights in this unusual property and enjoyed my stay. I understand there are a number of jail cell sized rooms in the hotel but I had a sizable room that had character and windows you could open ( a rarity). Comfortable bed, small but more then adequate bathroom. I was in the back part of the hotel so noise was not an issue. There is a stylish bar adjacent to the lobby and across from it, a study with couches and chairs and a cappuccino machine at the ready. As for the Property Vibe;The Mansfield doesn't feel like a hotel and that can appeal to many who are tired of characterless lobbies and rooms that could only be in a hotel. Happy with my Mansfield experience and location,location,Location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Quick Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: jcb1986
Reviews.Content: “Great for a Quick Weekend Trip” 4 of 5 stars Reviewed March 27, 2012 NEW Just got back from a weekend trip (Fri thru Mon) to New York where a friend an I stayed at The Mansfield Hotel. We were in the city with others from our University to celebrate Social Work Day at the United Nations. The Mansfield is a small boutique hotel with all the charm of the Art Deco movement. We each had our own rooms, which were small but clean and allowed plenty of space for 1 person. We each got a very good rate from one of the discount booking site which made it as affordable as anything we could locally in the Chicago area. It was about 1/3 the price that some of our other friends were paying at other hotels and only about $20 more than those who booked over in New Jersey. Location: The hotel was centrally located just 2 blocks from Times Square and Grand Central Station, making it an easy walk to most things. Comfort: The bed was comfortable, with both feather and down pillows. The bathroom was small and the lighting very poor for putting on make-up. Air conditioning is window air, but was okay with me because I have that in my bedroom at home. Food/Services: The hotel offers room service, but it is quite expensive. As is the food and drinks down in the M Bar. (i.e., yogurt/granola and fruit = $12; coffee $5). A martini will run $16.00 and a glass of wine is $12. While I didn't take advantage of the free coffee in the library, I so enjoyed the welcoming aroma each time we entered the hotel. We did find other places nearby that were more reasonable, but overall, New York is very expensive by Midwest standards. Staff: Concierge Robert was very helpful. Someone is always available to help with bags or hail a cab, which are generally plentiful except after shows let out or it's raining. Overall, I have given the hotel a "very good" rating because it more than adequately met my travel needs for my purposes in being in the city. If you are looking for posh and elegant surroundings then this is probably not the place for you. But, if you are looking for a nice place within walking distance of the theatre district or shopping opportunities, then I would say this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience at the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend at the Mansfield Hotel. The location is amazing, so close to Times Square and yet the hotel itself is very quiet, you cannot hear any noise at night. We stayed in a suite, the bed was great and the linens were nice and soft. The only complaint we had were that the bathrooms were on a smaller side. The staff were lovely at this hotel, always helpful and friendly. I would definitely book my next stay there. Thanks Mansfield for a great NYC experience!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mansfield for 4 days and was really disappointed. We stayed in a double double parlour room (one of the more expensive) and it was pokey and very dark - more importantly it wasn't clean. The bedside table and desk were covered in dust and the counterpanes on the beds were filthy. Twice the sheets on my bed had big rips in them. The room also looked out on to the street and was incredibly noisy. We really struggled with the internet here when we critically needed to get on so would not recommend for anyone on business. The staff were very little help when we asked for help to get on the internet or to move rooms with one notable exception (F&B manager). Throughout the stay staff would look at you blankly when you asked for help and we needed to follow up two or three times for anything to happen. There are much better hotels in NY at this price bracket - would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped without Notice”
Reviews.Author: dgthe3rd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a reservation for Friday and Saturday night. Unfortunately I can't adequately review the hotel because when we arrived we were immediately told there was no room and they moved us to a sister hotel. We weren't informed in advance, even though they had our contact information. Although it's appreciated that we were moved to an adequate hotel, it would have been much nicer to know in advance, in case we wanted to adjust our plans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: swagworldchicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend. I knew through research and reviews that the room would be small and it was. That said, it served our needs perfectly. We wanted a place to sleep after running around the city for hours. Our room was clean, modern and quiet. The staff was courteous and helpful. Loved the 24 hour cappucino/latte bar. I have stayed in bigger places that are not nearly as nice. It has a more European feel to it. The location is fantastic! 2 blocks from Grand Central Station and Times Square. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I have never had a problem with this place---”
Reviews.Author: Tom2002a
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times on business. At this price point The Mansfield is as good as it gets in NYC. My experience is all of the 44th Street hotels are at about this caliber. A competitor in this price range with larger but not nicer rooms would be The Dylan. I have never had a problem with this place---you'll need to pay over $500US a night to get into a larger room in midtown. One plus for The Mansfield is that the interior (small) rooms look out into a light shaft - no view but quiet. You will appreciate this at 3am on trash night in NYC where the constant beeping and loading noise from trash trucks working the street below have kept me awake more nights than I'd care to remember. I think this place is perfect for business travelers as it is in the heart of midtown and will not raise eyebrows on the expense report. For tourists be forewarned that if you booked one of the cheaper rooms its going to be small. Fine for a night but it could be an issue if you go for a week. That said it is not a major tourist or convention hotel which I am sure is a plus for some. The location is in the business district on 44th which has several really cool old hotels on the block.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise: great service but disappointing value”
Reviews.Author: Wintberg53
Reviews.Content: We had the total reverse experience of Patty N who qualified the Mansfield as great value but disappointing service. Staff was very welcoming and supportive, helped us change rooms when we found traces of smoke in our room, and were very courteous during our stay. The rooms were not as advertised - in our case we had rooms that were rundown and looked like they desperately needed another refurbishment. The shades would not close properly and we slept in glaring lights of office rooms of the opposite building. There was a lot of noise from what was probably a heater or air flow mechanism from another building as well. Everything looked rundown and the shaving mirror in the bathroom was kaput. We thought the hotel was more or less like this - the other reviews show that at least some rooms are still up to standards. A more personal problem is that we did not really like the lights in the rooms and in the hotel in general - it seems to be a design issue to make reading more difficult and to turn pushing the buttons in the elevator into a guessing game. But symbolic for our stay: this was the case in one elevator, whereas the other had sufficient lightning! I would recommend checking your room before accepting it and looking at the shades in particular, as well as the general state of the room. Noise is always available in generous quantities in New York, so that should probably not be a deciding factor. Location is great - very central, just a short walk from Grand Central and from Time Square. Again, compliments to the staff - I witnessed a medical emergency of a guest and how staff went out of their way to help - so either the previous review did wonders or the disappointing experience was due to other factors...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Patty N
Reviews.Content: Got a very great deal for staying in this stately hotel in a great location. Cannot say anything bad about the room quality - everything was as presented on the web and our stay was very comfortable. One thing of note was the callous, nearly indifferent service received. Once in the room I realized that I haven't packed a toothbrush, I dialled the Room Service and after about 15 rings I got a response. When I asked if it was possible to get a tooth-brush, an iron and board and per chance, a shoe shine kit- I was cursed at in Italian and hung up on. I was later informed by the Front Desk that I should have called Housekeeping for such items (which aside from the iron and board were not available). However upon informing them of the inappropriate telephone 'etiquette' of their Room Service staff, the Concierge seemed quite unmoved and not at all apologetic. I would return here as I stay in hotels out of necessity and not to be pampered but those who like to feel like valued guests, please lower your expectations when booking a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Modern...Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jock C
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at The Mansfield for a long weekend in Feb 2012 and was glad I did. There is no shortage of hotels in the area but The Mansfield was great value for money. The location is unbelievably awesome...turn right out of the hotel and walk for 30 seconds and you'll be on the famous 5th Avenue...home of all the great shops and lets face it, people heading to NYC for a long weekend are probably there for the shopping and the sights. From 5th Avenue, you can hit the Rockefeller Center and do the Top of the Rock tour, walk down to the Empire State Building or go for a walk around Central Park. Turn left out of the hotel and walk for 5 mins and you're on Times Square...and I mean right on Times Square...right in the middle...fantastic during the day and even better at night when it's lit up. The room I was given was on the 4th floor facing out the front and onto W44 Street...I wasn't expecting a view because the city is all highrise so bear that in mind, but there was nothing wrong with my view. The room comes with a mini bar (price list is in the room) flatscreen TV, comfortable double bed and a nice bathroom with plenty of towels. Maid service was offered everyday and the staff are fantastic throughout. The hotel has a reading room with free tea and coffee and the wi-fi signal is all over the building and is fast enough for any use. You can come and go as and when you please and staff are always on hand to assist. I would highly recommend The Mansfield hotel to anyone visiting the city on New York.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAAH24
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is charming and full of character. The rooms are small, but for a couple just in town to explore the city for a weekend, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: mseera
Reviews.Content: Reached NYC on the hottest day ever. Had some trouble getting to the hotel by car, as most roads won't allow to turn in, finally after a few tried managed to get there. Receptionist was very friendly, and the room was excellent. Best part of the hotel is the superb location, right in the heart of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Trini1Uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on business. The rooms were large for NY but the bathroom was tiny. This was not a challenge for me as I was only there to sleep. The location was fantastic with 5th Ave shopping a few yards from your door. As you would expect breakfast was bit pricy (25 use for an eggs Benedict and coffee) but good. If one was on a budget there is a good diner just a few yard at the end if the street. I would also reccomend the Kalahari across the street for dinner and drinks. All in all a great boutique with a fabulous central location.

Reviews.Title: “Get shower room”
Reviews.Author: Cc9fcb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012 for 4 nights, saw from reviews that the rooms were small so I upgraded to a bigger room before I got to New York, but even still found the queen size room to be very very small, loved the shower room it was almost as big as the bed room which does not say much for the size of the room. But found it to be very clean, and loved the decor. Great location. Had a great time and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, lovely staff, BUT very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jack M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband in November 2011, found the hotel clean,warm, great shower,lovely staff, free coffee any time of the day or night, fab location right off 5th ave. however the room was very very small so small what were we ment to do with our suitcases??????and this was the upgraded room I would hate to see the smallest double room. But all in all lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Becky B
Reviews.Content: Last weekend marked my first visit to NYC. I stayed at the Mansfield and had a great experience! Beautiful building and great location. I read many of the reviews before booking my reservations at the hotel and found some complaints about the room size and staff. Yes, the room was on the small side (it's NYC people!), but it was perfectly cozy, clean and adequate for a short stay. The staff was lovely and I would definitely stay here again. I was looking for a perfect little NYC boutique hotel and found one in the Mansfield.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: cheesecakeguru
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last Nov/Dec 2011 and was amazing. Excellent location, spotlessly clean and very helpful staff. The decor and feel of the hotel, especially the foyer was typically Manhattan and only added to the enjoyment of our first visit to New York. Free coffee and tea available at all times, along with access to computers and printers if needed. This was ideal for airport on-line check-in. The 'M Bar' was a lovely place to wind down and have a cocktail at the end of the evening. On our last day there, the staff held our luggage for us free of charge and also booked a town car for us for our journey to the airport, and this was a perfect end to a perfect stay. Despite it's central location, we were pleasantly suprised that the street was fairly quiet at night. We are already looking to go back this year and The Mansfield would be our first choice. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Well handling of an inconvenience...”
Reviews.Author: bayimc
Reviews.Content: We booked for a three night stay at the Mansfield beginning of November 2011. There was a neat deal going on, where you book for two nights, and the third night was complimentary; so the price came up to something rather affordable, in New York City standards that is... The first night was absolutely horrible. The room was extremely tiny, but that was not what bothered us. The A/C was not working at all! Although we called the reception a couple of times throughout the night, the handy-man that came up could not fix it, though he said he did. We practically stayed up until the morning, and once it was 6AM, went down to the reception desk to complain once again, ready to switch hotels to the Sofitel across the street! Although we were partially frozen by then, the gentleman at the reception desk was helpful and kind. He said he did not have the authority, but that he would pass the information onto his manager, and make sure we switch rooms. They upgraded us to one of the better rooms in the Hotel, called 'The Jennings Room', which was a very roomy suite with a working A/C an impressive decor. We stayed there for the other two nights; it did not make us forget the misery of the first night, but surely left a better taste in our mouth about the management of the hotel. Overall, the location was very convenient; it was a quiet street in the vibrant heart of midtown Manhattan. Close to shopping, entertainment, and sight-seeing; also had access to Metro easily. One bitter part was that the lobby seating did not exist at all; once we made the reservation we saw these cute pictures of a reading room/library-looking lobby; though it was under construction throughout our stay... So there wasn't much of a hangout place in the Hotel, to be honest, none at all. Regardless of all, I liked this hotel, and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, Great Location, Classy”
Reviews.Author: mexicanmadeline
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great service, well-appointed and stylish room, beautiful lobby, perfect downtown location a couple of blocks from time's square. it was pretty quiet at night, i was surprised given downtown location. the bathroom was very nice, the bed was a bit squeaky, but very comfortable. i especially loved the library with 24 hour capaccino and tea service (for free!) as well as plenty of newspapers - it was better than any coffee shop! also the business center was very useful and came in handy for a print out we needed. really a top notch hotel. i'd stay again and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca B
Reviews.Content: Good service, great location, ok room. We stayed during New Year's and this was the best price and location for a "4 star hotel". The room was larger than I expected based on the reviews and the place was nice and clean. Compaints: no area to put clothes or toiletries. No way to really control the radiator heat (we opened the window, but if you're a light sleeper that won't work). The bathroom has no fan and doesn't have a real door (2 swinging doors that come together) so don't count on too much privacy!). All in all, not too bad, but I wouldn't consider it 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: DartonProf
Reviews.Content: This is an adorable hotel but people who stay here need to know (up front) the rooms are small and darker than most people are used to. However, we do not go on holiday to stay in our room, so we really enjoy the hotel. I think it should share, and play up, its history! The coffee is always good, the rooms clean, the personnel very nice. The breakfast, which is included in our rate,, is great - not limited to rolls and coffee but anything on the breakfast menu. This trip I tried each breakfast item and all were good with the brioche the best! The fruits is fresh and the service very nicely done. Everything is near to the hotel and the walking was wonderful. Both my husband and I really enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for holiday.”
Reviews.Author: PNWAsia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel if visiting for holiday.. I was there on business and would not recommend for a business stay but would return under such sojourn. I did move rooms two times, first one as it was a handicapped room and second room was very noisy and dark. 3rd room was a corner and it was very nice. At all times, the service was very good and staff accommodating to the moves. Wireless and phone cover rage not always available in the room which is why not good for business. Fine in common area but then not able to have private phone conservation. On holiday return, I would specify the room which would be a king .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: manu070
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well located, on 44th between 5th and 6th, two or three blocks from Times Square. There´s a nice bar on the lobby and free wifi internet in the rooms and all over the hotel. I stayed at a Chambre Queen Room, and it´s really small... Bathroom even smaller... Just ok, stayed for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Only if location is almost everything...”
Reviews.Author: Handyman301
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for location right off 5th Ave and a few feet from all transportation and great Killari restaurant accross the street. Mansfield's liberal use of shiny black paint fails to hide puny corridors, rooms, toilets and sinks. And forget city views. Staff is courteous. Breakfast was included, but incredibly, toast is extra. That's not NYC, it's a Mansfield attitude problem. It's too obvious that the hotel is into guest cash extraction much more than providing high value. You'll find $10 bottled water in your room if you need more clues.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...just ok everything else”
Reviews.Author: spls76
Reviews.Content: Super Amazing location. Very reasonable price. Smaller than average Manahttan rooms. Hard to control room temps. Uncomfortable beds. Did the trick for a quick in and out trip to the city

Reviews.Title: “location is the best”
Reviews.Author: wideworld99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the very busy holiday season so paid a lot. As others have said, the queen room is small and dark, but decorated in high style. I really would have liked a comfortable chair to sit in, even though we only were there at night. We asked for a quiet room so got the back, looking onto a light well. It was indeed quiet. Bed was very comfortable. The location is fantastic - great walking in all directions. In future I probably would stay elsewhere unless they were offering a very good rate here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay - Little bit of give and take. (Room size for location)”
Reviews.Author: OKCgolfguide
Reviews.Content: Bottom line first - Solid hotel, great location on a great looking NYC street, smaller size rooms & bathrooms. Would recommend for someone who hasn't stayed here before, but would probably stay somewhere else on my next trip. Recently stayed at The Mainsfield for a holiday weekend in NYC. Location is the biggest selling point of this hotel being only very short walks to Grand Central, Bryant Park and Times Square. Decided on the Mansfield as a change from one of the larger chain hotels and to take advantage of 3rd night free promotion. The Mansfield is smaller boutique hotel that has been renovated from an older, architectural beauty. This is where the give and take comes in. Having been restored from it's rich history, the hotel's size is dictated by the original rooms and layouts. It is smaller than most hotels in both lobby and rooms, but and effort has been made to preserve some of the charm of the original. If you are hunting for maximum square feet and an expansive bathroom, look elsewhere. If you are in NYC to see the city and will appreciate some architectural character this will work nicely. Pros -Great location for sightseeing - Easy walking to Grand Central, Times Square, Bryan Park & 5th Ave. -Renovated - hotel has undergone renovation with more modern style rooms, beds, fixtures, ipod clocks, etc. -Free wifi (although not lightning speed - speed tested at between 1-2MB down) -Free cappucino & coffee in lobby -Architectural charm -Nice lounge & M bar -Helpful housekeeping staff -Beds are solid -Street has nice charm and upscale feel Cons -Front desk staff seems indifferent most of the time -Rooms are much smaller than most hotel chains (but remember it is a renovation of an older building, rather than dozing it down and building new) -Bathrooms are exceptionally small (Rm. 902) - minimal counter space, small shower, etc. -No luggage racks -No table for eating or reading -AC units in windows (allows some sound in from the street - but you are in NYC!) -Beds are on rollers so move around a bit unexpectedly. -Plasma tv on wall is way to small. -Wifi a little slow, but free.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: evi z
Reviews.Content: we were two friends sharing a room, as we arrived we were offered an upgrade and the room was ready for us as early as 10:00am. the room was great, clean, quiet, convenient for us. the hotel stuff were helpfull ,very patient and pleasent, made it possible for us to make a late checkout on the checkout day. the location is superb, we couldn't ask for more..defenetly a hotel to go back to

Reviews.Title: “Mansfield in New York, Tiny, but great”
Reviews.Author: chucker999
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a five day NY vacation. The Mansfield was perfectly located and a well appointed building. Rooms are definitely small, but rooms were very comfortable and the staff was really good. I enjoyed this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lemonysnickets
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Mansfield on business on and off over the past 5 or 6 years probably 10 times (we switch around a lot). The rooms vary in size quite a bit, but are generally smallish. They are well appointed and comfortable. A lot of them are a little dark, but if your only in them when it's dark.... what does it matter? Favorite things: Location- centrally located on a great street with lots of European influence, good restaurants and bars The library waiting area with the espresso bar has an old New York Charm The restaurant is very comfortable atmosphere, and the food is good. great live music on some nights. The Gym- I usually have it all to myself! It is good to get some exercise in between all the working, eating & drinking! The overall warmth and atmosphere. Very courteous and helpful staff. Dislikes: The breakfast used to be included in the room price, now it is not. That is disappointing. It's a bit pricey , so if my job isn't paying, I don't always opt for it. it is very yummy though. Small closets I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous365
Reviews.Content: This review is based on my experience in a King room, which I got during a recent promotion. I was leery based on other iffy reviews but, having stayed here many years ago, I wanted to see for myself how fair these criticisms were. The hotel is scaled from a different time: narrower hallways, smaller elevator, smaller rooms. But there's marble and ironwork and hex tile flooring, and overall a feeling of architectural charm absent from many other NYC hotels. The room was immaculate. Nicely appointed, with a sleek modern vibe. Fabulous sheets and bedding. The bed itself was fantastic. Clearly management has spent money since the last time I was here. This includes upgraded lighting: the room had nice bright halogens over the window box (great place for luggage) and bright spots for bed reading. I asked for a quiet room, and got one. The bathroom was a little underlit and also tiny -- the sink, practically something from a sailboat -- but the shower (no tub) was spacious, with fabulous water pressure, gorgeous tile, and bright lighting. Thick, fantastic, white towels, replenished daily. No funky smells or scents. Didn't use the TV, so can't comment, but it's a newer flat screen mounted on the opposite wall from the bed. Housekeeping: fantastic. Front desk staff ranged from good to excellent. I witnessed one incident where the clerk showed an uncommon level of patience to a very, very trying customer. It exceeded what I'd expect in a psychiatric nurse, and reminded me how very hard their jobs can be. The restaurant is comfy; ate only breakfast there. Asked for simple toast and fruit (not on the rather elaborate menu) and was accommodated graciously. The only serious gripe: wifi essentially was useless. I was able to limp along with a 3G iPad, but anyone who absolutely has to have a reliable wifi - computer connection would be advised either to ask for a room with a stronger signal, or look elsewhere. But as others have said, the location is unbelievable and, especially with any promotions the hotel is running, the place is a great value. Saved at least $500 over the next choice. If just off 5th on 44th is the place you need to be, this is an easy pick.

Reviews.Title: “Might as well have been sleeping outside”
Reviews.Author: Busyguy5
Reviews.Content: AC window unit let in all the street noise and cold air. Couldn't believe a 4 star hotel would think this is acceptable. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: joancrounse
Reviews.Content: Hotel was built in the early 1900s and has all the charm of that era. Rooms have been recently renovated. We had the smallest type of room with 1 double bed, desk and chair, 1 nightstand (no dresser), and a lovely bay window seat that looked out on an airshaft. OK, the view wasn't great but the windows opened for fresh air and we couldn't hear a sound from the street or from other rooms. The bed was comfy with lovely linens. Our room had dark hardwood flooring and dark tan walls that looked great with the black furniture. The room was small but fine for us on a weekend visit to the city with just 2 overnight bags. Someone with a great deal of luggage would be cramped unless they sprung for one of the bigger rooms.The bathroom was large enough with a full tiled shower. Sink was very small and there is little counter space. I was surprised to see there wasn't a hair dryer in the room. The closet contains a safe and a minibar- boxes of candy were $4, bottles of beer were $8, wine $20. Great location on 44th, near many of the Broadway theaters. There's a DoaneReade 24 Hr drugstore around the corner as well as a number of restaurants in the immediate area. It's a pet-friendly hotel for animals up to 50 lbs. and you need to have the animal crated when you are not in the room. We checked in very early and dropped off our bags. There's no checkout except to give them your room keys and they will store you luggage all day while you explore the city. There's a coffee machine in the lobby for free coffee/lattes/hot chocolate. We absolutely enjoyed our stay and will return to the Mansfield on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hineconsult
Reviews.Content: Right on 44th street across the street from the Harvard Club and New York Yacht Club the Mansfield is an 100 year old gem. Our room was small but well appointed and updated with a very modern touch. For the price, it was a great value in New York City where the lower priced hotels are often dog eared. The bed could have been better but overall the experience was good for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: kelly186338
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple nights at The Mansfield and I thought it was a nice hotel. Like the other hotels on that same street, it is small and fashionable. The Mansfield hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Also the rooms were very clean and stylish however, they were also very small. There was a nicely stocked minibar though and the rooms were comfortable although they were small. And looking at the map, I got one of the smallest rooms, the sink was actually in the room! However, it was so stylish and since I was only going to be there for a couple of nights, it was fine. I usually stay at the Iroquios which is the same deal (although I don't think they have any sinks in their rooms, just in the bathrooms), a couple doors down, except it is not nearly as fashionably decorated and the rooms are slightly larger. Also, looking at some of the other reviews, I would like to point out that if you are staying in a mid-town boutique hotel, you are porbably not the same kind of person who takes the airport shuttle and who is worried about an extra $8. I would recommend that if you even consider the airport shuttle or the bus into the city, you would be happier at a hotel like The New Yorker. The Mansfield is very close to 5th Avenue. Saks, etc. is about a ten minute walk and taxis seemed abundant outside the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and over-proced”
Reviews.Author: MetalPigeon
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights on business in The Mansfield. On the positive side the staff are fine and the rooms are clean and the bed is comfortable. Location is good being just off 5th Avenue. However: - the rooms are tiny and very dark. During the middle of the day you need to have all the lights on to see anything. - the desk in the room is so small and the room so cramped that there is no way you can work there. - the bathrooms are similarly constrained making some essential acts almost impossible - we had breakfast included in our package which consisted of one drink plus one single item from the menu. If you have a cup of coffee you then get charge 5 dollars for an orange juice. - breakfast selection was limited. No buffet. But really it all comes down to the rooms. Yes, they have some character with it being an older building but for the price you should get a whole lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Def pros and cons, but would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, building is amazing if you like older architecture with a more historical feel (if you're looking for modern and spacious this place isn't for you unless you've got the cash for their penthouse). Don't stay here if you're a larger person or want brighter lighting; pretty much everything about the room was small and dimly lit (we had originally booked a standard room but they upgraded us to a club suite for free) and kind of awkwardly placed (especially the bathroom that looked like a cupboard and a toilet so close to the wall you have to sit on it slightly sideways). Room was very clean, and we had a fantastic evening at their M Lounge. The food was really good and well priced, drinks were very good but obviously pricey. Sheri Miller was their live music for the evening and we loved her. Staff were all very nice and helpful, and the general manager was gracious and accommodating. We had called ahead a few days prior asking about a promotion they had on their website; he informed me we weren't eligible for it because we had booked through Hotwire BUT to compensate he upgraded us to a suite free of charge and included drink and breakfast vouchers without my even having to ask. We would absolutely stay their again. Overall, it was a perfect place to stay for a weekend trip and for going through Hotwire we were pleased with what was selected.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Juneau67
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Mansfield. The hotel has a boutique-style feel to it. True, the rooms are small, but we went to New York for a long week-end gateway, so we wanted to be near many of the main attractions. In spite of the size, the rooms are nicely appointed - we particularly liked the ebony wood floor. It was also possible to slightly open the window. No complaint either about the cleanliness, our maid did a perfect job each day. The complimentary Espresso machine in the lobby is another plus. Again, the hotel is perfectly located in Midtown Manhattan just a few blocks from Times Square, the Rockfeller Center and Grand Central station. Multiple subway routes are stopping nearby. We travelled for Neward Airport and used the Newark Airport Express which dropped us off 2 blocks away at Bryant Park - an economical and conveniant way to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use Alpharooms to book a holiday”
Reviews.Author: jshampson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Alpharooms.com. We booked a twin and a double room, but when we arrived there was no twin available so we were 'upgraded' to a suite which meant one person could have the lovely double bed but the other was on a bed settee. Also Alpharooms told me explicitly when I phoned them before booking that ALL taxes were included in the price. This was not the case, and the hotel charged me extra occupancy taxes.So BEWARE before you book. The hotel was clean, close to Times Square and quiet, apart from the air con which we switched off. If I went back to New York (which was fabulous) I would look for a different hotel, and would certainly NOT use Alpharooms.

Reviews.Title: “Run...Run... Run...”
Reviews.Author: Rodney1988
Reviews.Content: What a dump. The photos online are very misleading. The room was nasty. The woodfloors looked like they hadn't been cleaned or finished in 50 years. The window would have been nice if a walmart window air conditioner hadn't taken up most of it. There was a lovely fabric bench in the window that was cover with stains and the seat was broken away from the frame. When they dropped our bags we asked I'd this was the upgrade... The bag guy said there were 'worse'. We checked out without staying more than an hour. Dont stay here unless your other option is a shared bathroom hostel on 95th street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Staff could be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: claire_lomaine
Reviews.Content: Myself, boyfriend, Mum and Dad just returned from a short stay in NYC. We booked two rooms (double and a twin) online. When we arrived the hotel staff explained to us they do not have twin rooms. They did however upgrade both our rooms to a suite which had a double bed and a separate bed settee. The suites were lovely! Two rooms, one with the bed and bathroom and a separate living room area with tv, desk, settee etc. The only thing that disappointed me about this hotel was the staff's attitude. They were not welcoming, in fact it seemed like we were inconveniencing them. The keycard for our room would not work and I had to ask for this to be fixed on three occasions. There is complimentary coffee/tea in the entrance hall which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Small, dark and mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Catmindu
Reviews.Content: As others have said, what is it with the dark rooms? I can live with small room although mine was so small I couldn't close in the bathroom door when in the bathroom (too much details but makes the point). Small is what you get for reasonable price in NYC and London but dark? My room (facing 44th) was very noisy and silicon earplugs didn't help block out road clearing / sweeping/partying at 2:00 in the morning. Breakfast is underwhelming and staff were indifferent. More interested in chatting to each other than service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location/Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: cmpdavid
Reviews.Content: Just east of 44th, The Mansfield is very close and within easy walking distance of shops/theatres/subways/good restaurants. We had a "suite"--two very small rooms but allowed us the option of two beds, which we needed. The pullout was acceptable, not great. However, that was overshadowed by the fact that there were NO creaks or noises when trying to use the bathroom in the bedroom. The room was VERY quiet - could not hear any other noise in the hotel at all (we were facing the "courtyard" area. I could shower and easily go about my business without waking my travel buddy sleeping soundly in the bedroom. The rooms are VERY small; the bedroom was about 10x10' and a very small but efficient bathroom. The room was also VERY dark - all the lights had to be on all the time. A definite plus was the gratis coffee machine downstairs where one could get a latte/cappuccino, etc. and go into the bar area and snag a free NYTimes. Wireless internet in the room wasn't strong at all, but if you had an iPhone (Verizon--not AT&T) you got a decent signal most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NYCSPOON
Reviews.Content: I must like this "Willow Group" of hotels as I'm drawn to The Franklin and now The Mansfield in NYC. Both have great charm. The Mansfield is much more located in the hustle and bustle of NYC but the rooms are solid and quiet and peaceful. The prices at The Mansfield were surprisingly affordable compared to many other Manhattan hotels. Again, like the Franklin, the rooms are small but the rooms and the hotel are all loaded with character and EXCELLENT service. They make a great cheeseburger. Try this one instead of some of those cookie cutter chains in midtown - chances are, it's more affordable than the competition and I can practically guarantee you - much more charming.

Reviews.Title: “i wouldn't go again”
Reviews.Author: evisupergirl
Reviews.Content: not very good cleanliness, very dark and small rooms.But the worst thing was the ventilation system. there wasn't an air condition but something like a fan that was located right next to the bed and the cold air was coming on your face and body so it was very disturbing.plus, the noise of the fan was so annoying that you couldn't get calm and sleep.really awful circumstances... NEEDS ROOMS' RENOVATION

Reviews.Title: “Mansfield Man-Cave”
Reviews.Author: cmosinski
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nice. The staff was friendly but the rooms were DARK. Dark floors, dark shutters, dim lights. This is not a lady friendly hotel, since the lighting is so poor.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Mansfield - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: 404_pagenotfound
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Mansfield. Planned to stay three days, stayed four (but more about that later). My only complaint is the lack of lighting in the room - they are way too dark. The staff and management of the hotel are excellent. Here are a couple of examples. I was careless and left my blackberry on the bed - when the maid came in and changed the sheets, the blackberry went with the dirty linen. When we realized what had happened, the staff went through all the dirty linen until they found the blackberry. What astounded me was how cheerful they were in dealing with me. The second example is how they handled Hurricane Irene. They were ready. They checked on every guest to make sure everything was ok. They had emergency supplies available - lanterns, etc, just in case there was an extended power failure. And they handled everyone's changed travel plans (including my own need for any extra night) with professionalism and a smile. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “weekend out”
Reviews.Author: Yulichka
Reviews.Content: Just went with friends for the weekend. old but very updated hotel. Got double beds one room but still extra cost. But there was plenty of room. The floors are hardwood, which was a bit cold but nice. Recommend slippers. Great great location. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “small room and smaller bathroom”
Reviews.Author: kathie l
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I booked to stay at the Mansfield for 1 week through Magellan vacations. The room that was booked was a superior King that was advertised as 275sq. however the room was so tiny with very very little cupboard space and no drawers to put our clothes in, that it was uncomfortable to be in, We had to live out of our suitcases for the whole week. The bathroom was so tiny that even for one person it was hard to move around. There was no bath. The amenities they supply (aveda) and bathrobe and slippers are good, but a poor attempt to get a higher rating for the hotel. The breakfast downstairs was good. I wouldnt stay here again as the rooms were too small for my liking. Central locations for shows. but only worth if you get a cheap deal to stay here.. definetely dont pay more than 200 a night. staff were friendly. Stayed at the Soho grand the following week, and that was fantastic and would highly recommend if you are interested in staying in the Soho area (which is much more interesting than midtown).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all we needed.”
Reviews.Author: dpal70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to New York. The staff was great. The room was spotless (we even checked under the bed/behind the desk). Yes, the room was smallish, but we weren't spending a lot of time in it. The location is great (2 blocks to Times Square, 1 block from 5th Ave.). Our price included breakfast...it was handy to be able to eat before we headed out every day. Our air conditioner worked fine. The only negative is the lighting, but it isn't really a show stopper. It is very dark in the rooms as all the lighting is lamps. We found the bed, pillows, and duvet very comfortable. The day we left it was raining very hard and there were quite a few leaks in the lobby/restuarant etc. but it didn't bother us. They do have umbrellas to use, which was great. The complimentary coffee is a nice touch, but they never had cream?

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel! But DON'T stay here if you need high-speed internet!”
Reviews.Author: MMGLA
Reviews.Content: Overall, I loved this hotel. From the minute we stepped out of our cab with incredibly heavy suitcases and the concierge came out, grabbed our bags, brought them to the front, then offered us both bottled water, I knew we would be happy with the service. The concierge then gave us a brief tour of our room and showed us where all the hotel facilities were. The room itself was larger than I expected (Parlour King), given that we were in Manhattan. It wasn't huge, but again, we were in Manhattan. The bed was almost too comfortable--we never wanted to get up in the morning!! The M Bar was beautiful. It wasn't overdone with crazy trendy decor, but was timelessly decorated. Free espresso and/or tea at any time of the day was also a wonderful touch. We also had free breakfast in the M Bar--also delicious. I do have two complaints. 1. During our last two nights, we woke up sweating even though our AC was set at 60 degrees. Neither my boyfriend nor myself are abnormal sweaters, so it was clear that the AC was not properly working! Both times we had to completely turn off the AC and restart it. Not something we enjoyed doing considering we were woken up in the middle of the night. I don't think is indicative of the service or quality of the hotel, just something that disrupted our nice stay. 2. Although I loved this hotel, I do want to warn anybody that relies on having internet when they travel to either avoid this hotel or practice their patience. The internet speed was terrible. There were two Mansfield connections. One had two bars and one had three bars from our room. We tried them both and literally waited 5-10 minutes to load websites. One time, we left our room for the day while a page was loading, came back hours later, and it never loaded. We asked the front desk if there were better connection options and he just said that they had two connections. So again, do not stay here if you need the internet. It's unfortunate that such a wonderful hotel has this horrible flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great service, international flavor, small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: sawtom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family 5 nights at this hotel. Location was great. Very close to theater district and Times Square. Hotel staff was great. The restaurant staff not so good. We had a one bedroom suite. The bathroom was VERY small. There is no central air, just window units. Weather was very hot when we were there but the AC units worked well. Hardood floors and french doors added to the charm of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rollonthehols
Reviews.Content: Having spent a long time researching NY hotels we were pleasantly relieved when we arrived at our hotel room. We had a room only package and spent little time in our room as we wanted to make the most of being in NY. Staff were friendly. Complimentary tea/coffee available in a spacious lounge. The bedroom might be small for some people's taste. But it was clean. (We checked) There was a locker on one side & a large window ledge on the other which served the same purpose. There was enough room on both sides of the bed for our large suitcases. There was a small dressing table, tv, hair dryer and safe. The closet was small which contained the mini bar. The bathroom was spacious, immaculate and was restocked daily however the doors of the bathroom were like closet doors and didnt provide 100% privacy. The room was a bit dark but that didnt bother us. The AC was noisey so bring ear plugs for a good nights sleep. The location was the best thing for us, only a few minutes walk from Times Square & 5th ave and many cafes, diners etc nearby. Avoid eating in Times Sq for more reasonable deals and check out Juniors restaurant/ bakery for amazing cheesecake! We got a good deal when booking the hotel so that plus the location really made our trip! We didnt go to NY to stay inside!!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaleneAsheville_NC
Reviews.Content: Very close to everything and the staff was exceptionally cordial and went out of their way to offer excellent customer service. I will recommend this to all of my friends who are headed to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy-the-Spherical
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is a charming, Beaux Arts hotel. The staff was consistently friendly & helpful. Our room was about 60% the size of the average middle-of-the-road national chain overlooking the suburban freeway. In other words: really big for Midtown Manhattan on a budget. Our room was immaculate with no signs of infestation (we checked). The bed was comfy. The view of the air shaft was less than spectacular ~ but, it was very quiet, no one could see in and that room runs around only $150 a night. Again, remember this is Midtown Manhattan ~ a five minute walk to Grand Central Terminal and Times Square. It is convenient to everything. The only issues we had we that the cappuccino machine & wi-fi were unreliable and the elevators were slow. All-in-all I would absolutely recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique place, nice charm - best for business”
Reviews.Author: Mattburrow
Reviews.Content: I just got done staying here for a 3 day business trip, and was very pleased with the hotel. This is my first time here, and I read the reviews about the small elevators (true), the street noise (true,..so I requested a room high up, and got one on the 6th floor), and that if you didn't face the street, your window looked out at a wall (I got a street view, which was great.). Overall, very nice remodel on this hotel, travertine wall and shower in the bath, hardwood floors and 8" baseboards, and

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money, could try harder”
Reviews.Author: solarize_uk
Reviews.Content: I don't mind the small room, which you expect in New York. But for $260 I found it a little tatty in places, with not enough attention to detail. My main complaint was the window-mounted aircon unit, which was very noisy - but with the summer heat there was no alternative. There are better options - e.g. The Pod Hotel down the road, which is also small but much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Raine8686
Reviews.Content: It was older than we had expected but it was clean and neat; though the heater did make quite a bit of noise the whole night, or it could just have been the room. Staff were friendly, loved the breakfast, and great great location! 5th Avenue just at the door and the Rockefeller a breeze away

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband last week. The hotel is nice and has a boutique feel. There is complimentary internet and a coffee machine in the lobby. We were upgraded to a king room so I assume this room may be bigger than the regular room we had booked. The bed is comfortable and the amenities were nice. The room is a little dark. The air conditioning was noisy but blocked out the street noise. There was very little noise between rooms. The bathroom is very small but functional. I got an amazing rate on this hotel and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “In a word: adequate”
Reviews.Author: SuzyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with my husband while we were exhibiting at Javits. Pluses were the good A/C (daytime highs were in the high 90's) and the exceptionally quiet room. Minuses were wireless signal was weak, room was clean but finishes could be better, and service was minimal. I might stay again if I got a great rate, but otherwise I will probably look for somewhere with a bit more panache'.

Reviews.Title: “My honeymoon in US”
Reviews.Author: Simo_1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel is big. I suppose with more that 100 rooms. Our rooms was very small, but clean. The style was tipical in brown colour. In our opinion, was very interesting the position on this hotel: only 3 minutes by walk to Times Square and to the 5th avenue! If I will come again in NY I will stay again in this hotel. Note: we found very good the shuttle service which movies from JFK airport to Manhattan. It was very cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: Margate-sunseekers
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for visiting the sights of New York, and aside from the small rooms, it's a great choice for somewhere to stay if you want to be walking distance from Times Sq, Roc Centre etc. Room although small was very clean, had a room safe, nice bathroom etc. The bed was on wheels which we did have to move around a bit to get to the other side of the bed, but a minor thing and for the amount of time we spent in the hotel during our four night stay not a problem. Having spent months looking for "that hotel" that combined price with location we decided on this one, and although now we've been to NY we've realised that staying further afield from Midtown would not be as such a disadvantage as we thought it might be, we'd be happy to recommed this hotel to anyone, although if we visit NY again we'd most likely to stay in a different part of the city. Lots of bars, deli's, cafes and restaurants on the doorstep and a nice feeling about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find for a midtown NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: YJCDenver
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, comfortable and excellent lounge (the M Bar). Rooms were typical NYC - small but at least not dark and very comfortable. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelMaven2
Reviews.Content: This was a very good deal for us and given that we had a 7-day stay in midtown Manhattan budget was a consideration. Strengths: Location -- it doesn't get much better than 44th off 5th. Value-- we found a great Internet rate (on what was probably an off week in terms of NYC tourism) and our dollar went even farther because wireless is free throughout the hotel. Cleanliness-- we had a problem with the first room because the floor had recently been varnished, but the second room was fine if sparsely appointed and immaculate. Service- quite responsive. Coffee/tea- available in a gracious lounge off the lobby 24/7. Quiet- 44th is a quiet street by Manhattan standards and in our back room you would never know you were in the city. Clientele- mostly foreign tourists, very polite. Weaknesses: The bed was a smallish queen with a (too) soft mattress, the free wireless was slow at times (though there was a business center available in the lobby), and there were not a lot of surfaces on which to put things in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun in the city that never sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: Markamp
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation in New York. The Mansfield is perfectly located a couple of blocks from Times Square action and far enough away that it's quiet. Very central to everything - we walked virtually everywhere we went - Chinatown, Ground Zero, Central Park, Little Italy, etc, etc, etc. Took train out of Syracuse - highly recommended - whereever you are coming from. Amtrak takes you right into Penn Station and you don't need or want a car in NYC. Train costs the same as parking and fuel (if not cheaper) - anyways, would go back again this weekend - still lots to see. Hotel staff is great, room is smallish but perfect for a tript o NYC. Didn't eat there but did take advantage of free coffee. Again, would go back to NYC in a minute and stay at this hotel - very good value!!! Thanks Again.

Reviews.Title: “The Mansfield is a classic hotel with an attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: odesStLouis_Mo
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield Hotel more than met my expectations of a classic club-style hotel. The staff were gratious and attentive. The room was spotless and well updated. The location was perfect for our needs visiting our 2 daughters who live in midtown NYC. It is close to great dining, theaters, and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty fabulous”
Reviews.Author: 45thParallel
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to celebrate our 25th anniversary. The hotel is ideally situated if you want to be near theaters. Right off Fifth Ave, and a very short walk from Grand Central. The bedroom and sitting room were quite lovely and comfortable. After reading reviews here, I was prepared for the dim light - I brought a small flashlight and even a headlamp. Yes, the elevators are small. If we'd encountered someone dealing with large luggage, we'd have waited for the next elevator. The teeny tiny pedestal sink in the bathroom has a faucet that's far too large. It extends out over the entire sink, so I had trouble washing my face. Also, it was too warm at night, although you are provided with two remote control thermostats if you have a sitting room. Maybe we weren't using it properly. We were given a couple of drink tickets, since they knew it was our anniversary, and we also had breakfast there each morning, because in our case it was included. It was great, very gourmet kind of breakfast offerings, although the second morning the "fresh spring mix" was a little bit tired looking. Very good service in the bar/breakfast dining room. If you don't want to pay for a $30 plus breakfast, there is a diner further down 44th. We were in Room 707. It's right across from the elevator. There was a tiny bit of noise but nothing of note. There is no view in that room (we didn't expect one), and you can't really tell the weather outside because you can't see the sky when you look out the window.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: pdx2006
Reviews.Content: Hm. Where to begin. Upon arriving after a cross-country flight, I was left alone to haul my rather large and heavy luggage up the steps into the lobby all by my lonesome. The front desk is tiny, and rather informal. Certainly a very European style hotel, and the majority of the guests are indeed Euro. I squeezed into one of the two teeny tiny elevators with my huge luggage, along with two other guests who were quick to point out that I'd have little space to place that bag in my room. I mentioned that I'd booked a suite, and they both breathed a sigh of relief. Hm. Not a good start my my stay. Oddly, there are only two suites on each floor, which are adjacent and located directly outside of the elevators which can be noisy if you're sitting in your living room. Fortunately, the bedroom is located in the back of the suite, so it's nice and quiet, particularly if you close the beautiful glass doors that separate the two rooms. I was impressed by the size of the suite, which was thoughtfully laid out and well stocked. The sitting area had a comfy sofa and wing chair, a large desk with chair, a huge window seat, a full wardrobe, and a flat-screen TV. The beautiful doors open to a smallish bedroom and the tiny bathroom, which at least had a tub. While I was hesitant after the bizarre arrival, I ended up really enjoying my stay. It felt very residential and my suite was top notch. Amazing linens, incredibly comfy furniture and bed, and everything I needed to enjoy my stay. It's also super easy to grab a taxi, as 44th has multiple hotels, including The Royalton. I'd definitely stay here again, but I'd never stay in anything but a suite.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: elguapo2011
Reviews.Content: My wife recently stayed at the Mansfield as part of a wedding anniversary trip to NYC. We stayed three nights over a long weekend. The hotel is "old" New York. Lots of dark wood and marble. Tiny elevators. We stayed in a "Club Row" suite on the second floor, and frequently took a very narrow staircase from the lobby to our floor. It was like having a quaint secret passage to get in and out of the place. The folks at the front desk were very accomodating. We had some magnetic key issues that they had to doggedly pursue to get fixed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They even hooked us up with umbrellas when the weather turned biblically rainy. The room had hardwood floors and smelled a little strongly of lacquer or varnish. We gave a little thought to getting moved, but we seemed to get used to the smell after a while and stayed put. The room was nicely appointed and of decent size for NYC. The bedroom was separated by beautiful frosted cut-glass doors --- a cool touch. The bed was very comfortable. There was a flat screen in both the bedroom and living area, but when will these hotels start to deliver an HD picture? It makes no sense to have a nice TV and a crappy low-def picture. The heat came from a radiator and boy did it work. The thermostat remote didn't do anything. The windows do open and we'd crack one occasionally to moderate the temperature. The view was unfortunately pretty ugly out the windows. It looked into a courtyard to nowhere and we were essentially staring at brick walls. It made the room very, very dark, even in the middle of the day. The bathroom is tiny. Great showerhead and solid water pressure. The toilet was crammed next to two walls and neither my wife, who is 5'2", or myself (6'4") could actually sit normally on it. We sort of had to ride it side-saddle. We had more than a few laughs, but the engineering was pretty lame. The property is in a phenomenal location,a bout two blocks from Times Square. However, it's just far enough away that the street outside is quiet at night. Our package included breakfast, served in the hotel bar, and it was pretty decent every morning. The bar is very turn-of-the-century and a pretty neat place to have a drink. There is also an old-fashioned walnut-lined library on the property that's a great place to sit and read the paper or have a cup of coffee. It's a quirky hotel that is probably not for everyone, but for the money ($233/night) it was competitive and a little more fun than staying at a newer hotel. We booked through nycluxuryhotels.com and got a rate lower than anything I could find online elsewhere. I would recommend it for anyone wanting to stay in Midtown Manhattan who wants an out-of-the-ordinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this part of history”
Reviews.Author: scienceprof2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is darling! It was a former boarding house for men and had the best (!!) library with 24/7 coffee maker. I could get expresso day or night! The restaurant was really nice - we had both breakfast and light dinners there and enjoyed everything - We especially appreciated the staff was willing to share recommendations on menu selections. Wine list very nice and my husband's drink was really good (he said). While the rooms are not well lit, there is plenty of light for reading, enjoying the room , and sitting and chatting in the room. We had a lovely room on the 4th floor and LOVED walking up and down the stairs (maybe servant staircase in the old days ??) because of the history we added to the trips. The location is the best! Not too much traffic on the street but steps away from all the major attractions in the city. The street reeks of old NYC and that was great! Each evening we went to the restaurant for drinks and the place was filled with young professionals - but was not obnoxiously loud. The hotel felt very European so if you want run of the mill try another hotel. However, if you want friendly, warm and cozy, and elegant rather than brassy, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money - watch out for parking - so-so service”
Reviews.Author: RenaTT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a pretty nice, clean NYC hotel in a great location. Pros: As soon as you open the door, you see the bed directly in front of you - no small entryway/hallway, etc., The bathroom was nice, clean, and a decent size. There is a decent room service menu, nice bar, nice restaurant, cappuccino bar, etc. The bed was comfortable and there was a nice-sized flat screen TV and mini bar in the room. The hotel is overall very clean. The rooms also had great hard wood floors. Cons: The rooms are tiny, but probably a decent size for a NYC hotel. The rooms are also very dark and a little cramped. It's a city hotel, so expect noise to drift in from outside. We were on the 9th floor and could hear construction workers using a saw at 9 in the morning. Parking: BEWARE of the parking situation. We called the hotel two separate times and spoke to two separate people who confirmed that the hotel validated parking. I even asked the first woman to provide me with the address of the nearest parking garage that validated parking and she gave me "Quick Park". Needless to say, when it came time to pay for parking, we ended up paying $40 for 1 night of parking anyway (after the lady at the front desk stamped the ticket). The garage only offers a $3 discount. I'm not sure if the two women I spoke with were misinformed or just confused, but we will never stay there again myself because of this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KHMpls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and had a wonderful experience. We got a great deal through Travelzoo, so we didn't pay the going rate for a room, but in any case I think this hotel is worth it. The location is fantastic, the staff was great, and the free breakfast was a great bonus. We had a one bedroom suite, which was actually really large by NY standards. We found the rest of the hotel to be cozy and inviting, and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jinglebts
Reviews.Content: Agents at the reservations desk couldn't have been nicer -- I'd lost my credit card and received wonderful service -- allowed me to pay be certified cheque and then waited for my other credit cards to be couriered. Location was great -- never stayed on the west side before but will do so again (W44th Street -- theatres and restaurants galore. In-room bar, percale sheets, pillowtop mattress, h'wood floors that can be (and were) mopped. All the old charm -- marble floors, carved plaster mouldings, and a bannister to die for. Best: the attitude of the staff -- and the bannister. And the crown mouldings. Least: the room was a bit dark, altho' I could have asked for a brighter one. But in all the kafuffle of my lost CC, I didn't think of it.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: cb107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for a long weekend with friends. We got a great deal on the room through Magellan. The rooms were nice but very tight. The lighting was very dim, had a hard time seeing what was in the suitcase. I had requested 2 luggage racks, but only got 1. The closet could not accomadate a heavy coat and clothes, they needed coat hooks on the wall. The breakfast was a nice touch, and good. The coffee in the library was good. I would stay again if I was able to get a great rate like I got this time. Can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: aradd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mansfield on an overnight trip into NYC. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel -- just a few blocks to Grand Central and central to many other landmarks. The staff at the hotel were all very helpful and pleasant. The library, which featured a coffee/latte machine, was cozy and warm. Our room, a Parlour Queen, was decently sized, at least by New York standards. The hardwood floors were a lovely touch and the floor to ceiling windows were very nice. However, the room also had some negative points -- peeling wallpaper, a strange smell in the bathroom, and an uncomfortable bed. We got a great price on this room and its wonderful location made staying here a super choice. However, I'm not sure that, given other circumstances, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Taste of Old New York Living”
Reviews.Author: windycitygal73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bursting with charm and personality. It was a "Gentlemen's Rooming House" in it's hayday, a century ago. It is a rare treat to be able to stay in a building like this, with it's interesting staircase and hardwood floors. The beautiful library and 24 hour coffee service is a delight. It was a nice touch, and much appreciated, to be handed a bottle of water upon check-in. The bedding was of a nice quality and it was changed everyday (many hotels are now cutting corners on this service). The room was clean and adequate, but there is no place for coats or dresses, as the closet is only half length due to the (un-needed) minibar. A couple of hooks on the wall would be a very welcome and inexpensive addition. My only other complaint is that the lighting in the room was extremely inadequate. Again, this would seem to be an easy and inexpensive fix. There are lamps, which provide direct lighting, but there is no indirect lighting, which gives the room a depressing and "cheap" feel. It appears that they probably paid big bucks for a professional designer to pull everything together. I always think it would be a great idea for a designer of a space to actually live in it for a night or two, to get a perspective. If that were the case, there would probably be much better lighting in the room. The staff seem professional, but unlike most NY Hotels I have stayed, they do not acknowledge guests with the niceties of "Good Mornings" or "Welcome Back". As I write this, it seems a bit petty on my part, but it was something I noticed at the time. I think "detached" is the word I would use. Be prepared to hoist your baggage up the 4 or 5 steps at the front entrace, as the doorman is not always there (to be fair, they are hard-working and are usually helping other guests to their rooms). I think it may just be a shortage of help. Overall, for the location and the price, this is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: monla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 19 yo daughter for one night. The location in perfect. We were in town do shop and see a show. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The front desk manager was nice enough to upgrade us to a suite which was so appreciated. Our room was perfect for three, it had ample space especially for a party of three. We had a nice breakfast in the morning and will definetly stay here again on our next trip to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very small/poky rooms”
Reviews.Author: australianlawyer
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very disappointing compared to others I have stayed with in New York. One of my colleagues described the rooms as "windowless shoeboxes", and I could see what he means (my room has a window, but with no light coming in). The space is quite depressing, not somewhere you'd want to spend time during the day. I also found the check-in staff unfriendly (although the housekeeping staff were friendly). The public areas are nice, though. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Chachachingching
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay - 17-24 April 2009 My friend and I stayed at the Mansfield Hotel on the aofrementioned dates. The trip itself was expensive but we expected this given the location i.e. New York, Manhattan specifically. The staff on the front desk were very polite and helpful, but the same couldn't be said for some of the staff who served in the breakfast room who were less than polite. The rooms were quite spacious considering I was expecting small rooms. The only downside was the airconditioning unit in the room which was directly attached to the outside wall so let in the smells (chips mainly) and noises from outside. My room had no view and all I could see was an industrial generator underneath my window. As a result my room was noisy and a little smelly at times. The TV in the room was large and had plenty of channels on it for watching late at night. The room was very clean and was services excellently everyday. The bathroom was also clean and had a lot of space with provisions such as shower gel etc. The cost of the rooms came with a complimentary breakfast (vouchers were handed to us upon check-in) - however breakfast was really poor and not at all filling. You were given a choice of food and one drink only anything else was charged and no variations were allowed without charge. I asked for a little dollop of yoghurt to go with some fruit .. I was charged $2 for the privilege! Luckily there were plenty of diners nearby that one could go to for a decent authentic New York diner experience. When we discovered the diners we totally dispensed with bothering with the breakfast. On the lower floor the hotel has a gym, small but adequate, and two PC's for FREE internet access which was wonderful ... (in this day and age internet use in hotels should be free - especially wi-fi). Overall the hotel felt very boutique and cosy with a drawing room for guests to sit and read newspapers in front of a real log fire which was a nice touch. The location is excellent and a few minutes walk away from all the major attractions - Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Times Square etc. I would definately use the Mansfield hotel again - an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel value I have ever experienced in New York City.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAGoldberg
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is a wonderful surprise. I was initially quite concerned about what awaited me because the price was so low for a New York hotel. However, the room cwas spotless with a large flat panel TV and free wireless internet. There is a small but excellently equipped gym and the breakfasts, which were also included, terrific. In addition to the wonderful dining room/bar, there is a wonderful cozy library where you can read newspapers and have a drink. The New York Times is also free in the breakfast room. In addition, the staff are terrifically helpful and friendly. I will certainly recommend The Mansfield Hotel to all and above all look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bidcodurham
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel, the location is perfect, the staff were great and could not do enough. We especially loved M Bar, lovely for breakfast and even better for drinks on a night - the wine was expensive but as to be expected in a Hotel so central to Times Sqare - would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but service not good”
Reviews.Author: Mooky9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansifeld Hotel for a break in NYC before moving on to another location. It was my second time in NY and my wife's first and we decided to book this hotel rather than a chain hotel as we fancied something off the beaten track... Upon arrival we walked into the lovely reception area, very quirkey and clean and I was impressed, however having to bring in 2 large suitcases on my own as my wife is six months pregnant did not impress me. Check in was swift and efficiant and the receptionist was polite and pleasent. We were shown up to our rooms by the porter. Once we got in the rooms we could see what people meant by the fact the rooms are dark, the main light really is useless! But that said its a minimum of effort to turn on a spot light which lights up the room totally. The room was quite small but the whole point of our trip was to see the sights and get out so that was no issue at all. The bathroom is not big but by no means small, I found it perfect for us and always clean. The only issue I felt was storage, there were no drawers so my wife was living out of a suitcase (it doesn't bother me!) The housekeeper was brilliant throughout the week and our room was always clean and topped up with soap etc. She is the only reason they got one star for service. We popped out and when we came back I wanted a map for the next day, I went to reception as the concierge was not manned and had to wait while the receptionist chatted to a colleague who was clearly leaving after work before I was spoken to, but I got my map. The following morning I made use of the gym, it is small and basic but as long as your targets are C.V then it's fine and well maintained, the C.V stuff has TV's on them to listen to any of the hotels channels. On the third day however it had run out of towels and the water bottle was empty by 8 am, I left it for 30 mins before asking the receptionist to sort it out, they did so within 20 minutes.
