However when I asked for this the male receptionist was quite blunt and rude, not what I'm used in the U.S. The night before we were leaving I needed to arrange our pick up in the morning, I spoke to the concierge when we got back and he said it was no problem and to get our pick up voucher, bring it down and he could help me. I did this straight away and was back down within 2 minutes, he directed me to the other concierge member on the desk as he was now talking to someone, the other staff member looked at me like I was insulting him and told me to speak to the male receptionist who would sort it. So I went over to him and again asked for some help, however he also looked at me like I was insulting him and whilst still looking at me called out to one of the girls and shouted could she come over here to deal with this as he was due off half an hour ago and wanted to go home. The girl receptionist then came over and had no idea what I was asking help for, so she dialled a number and thrust the phone into my hand. thankfully the lady on the phone was brilliant and helped me loads, but this left me very disappointed with the staff. We had a drink in he bar that night, nice buzz for the after work crowd but dies after that and it really is not cheap! The next day when we checked out I was in the rest room when the transfer bus arrived and 3 members of staff stood by watching my six months pregnant wife struggle trying to take the suitcases to the bus, not one moved to help her. Thankfully I came out prior to her hurting herself. All in all the location is perfect, easy reach of most things, Times Square, 5th Av, Empire state building etc and for a boutique hotel it looks great. But it is massively let down by poor staff with a poor attitude.

Reviews.Title: “a romantic treat for our first anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Bluemountain69
Reviews.Content: The softly lit lobby was a welcoming sight as we arrived at the Mansfield, after our journey from England. The staff were friendly and helpful upon arrival and very efficient. We found that the room and the hotel was exactly as they describe on their website. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room size was adequate for 2 adults however we did have to keep some clothes in the suitcase due to minimal storage space, which wasn't really much of a problem. The cleanliness of the room & hotel was to a very high standard. The air conditioner was very effective although a bit noisy. The 24hr self-serve, complimentary coffee machine in the library room was just what you needed after a day of shopping. The Mansfield is a 5min walk to Times Square, and 5 minutes in the opposite direction to Grand Central Station so an absolute perfect location. We couldn't have wished for anything better to celebrate our first wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: junkie_travel
Reviews.Content: A very clean room, comfortable bed, spotlessly clean bathroom makes a picky traveler like me happy. A couple of blocks from Bryant Park, Mansfield has perfect location. It is close to everything but tucked away from the tourist rush of Times Square. Complementary breakfast has a good choice of entrees. I loved the hardwood floors in the room. Overall a very good hotel, clean, excellent service and perfect location. The hotel has free wifi. The only con - the rooms facing the street can get a bit too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly quirky, very New York, a "real" experience”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedUnderpaid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mansfield on my own for a long weekend. I had booked a petit chambre. But on my arrival the reception noticed that it was my birthday the next day... they upgraded me to a Queen (they wanted to give me a King but it would have been another hour to prepare), and I think just about every member of staff wished me happy birthday over the next few hours!! Very nice touch. The building has a real old New York charm. They have managed to retain the original features and a real feel of a genuine experience.. whilst adding modern twists and modern standards of luxury. The stairwells and corridors themselves are beautiful as they are full of character... not often I feel compelled to include stairwells in a review! Room was on the small side but definitely not shockingly so, and there was plenty of room to move about.. All very well appointed and lovely furniture. The bed... I can't say enough.. it was very very comfortable. Loads of power points. Air con was efficient but as per other reviewers it was pretty noisy. I wore ear plugs at night so that I could keep it on. It was very hot the weekend I was there. Lighting was muted to say the least. Not good for the application of make up! Bathroom was small but well laid out and luxuriously presented with a big shower. Aveda products are lovely touch. There is a well appointed gym with well maintained equipment (2 running machines, bike, cross trainer, plenty of freeweights and a stretch/abs area on a mezzanine level. This is a really good facility which you might not normally get in a non-chain hotel so I was pretty impressed. There is also a business centre - just 2 pc's but internet is free and printing is free and on demand (no need to request at reception). The other nice touch is the club room where you can get a free coffee (from machine) at any time of day. This is a library setting and feels very relaxing. Location is second to none and I would definitely stay there again. 1 minute from 5th Avenue and the M1 bus heading downtown. 3 minutes from Broadway and Times Square. 5 minutes from the Rockefeller centre and the cathedral. 10 minutes walk from Hells Kitchen and some lovely bars and restaurants (try the Marseille). 44th street is relatively quiet for a crosstown street in this part of New York. Plenty of good dining/drinking options right on the doorstep, including the historic literary Alonquin hotel. I had a couple of fab cocktails there. Felt very refined! Well, I am worth it! Yes I would go back and yes I would definitely recommend it. I actually can't think of anything I would want to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location PLUS CHARM! oh~and free lattes!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBest
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to NYC with my sister and our daughters (teens). Trip started a little bit on a downer as my sister and her daughter's flight was screwed up (Air Tran loves to over-book) but definitely took a positive turn when my daughter and I arrived at our chosen hotel-The Mansfield. Since I have limited words I will sum it up by saying that this hotel is charming, clean, has beautifully decorated rooms with the 'feel' of NY, has a fantastic location-close to Times Square/5th Ave/possible to walk to Central park/near Grand Central/NY Public library/Bryant park etc etc. Helpful and friendly staff (Henry!~Edward~cleaning woman who was sweet when we interrupted her by coming back to the room unexpectedly~curly haired woman at desk) they upgraded our room due to the flight mess which we appreciated VERY much. I recall seeing a few reviews here before booking that said staff was not friendly...I can only imagine that these reviewers are not terribly friendly themselves~you get what you give! In fact, we met so many friendly, funny, helpful and interesting people~LOVE NYC!!! And will definitely book at this hotel on return trips. And did I mention...FREE (and actually good) specialty coffee that you can get for yourself any time in the charming library. Sadly didn't get the chance to sample the blueberry martini in the M bar due to our quest to cover all of Manhattan in 5 days...but, bar was quaint and peaceful...next time! Also must be said that the beds were extremely comfortable, the Aveda bath products appreciated and amazingly our room (a suite on the 12th floor) was so restful, cool and quiet! This is NY-honk honk. For anyone who hasn't been to NY you should be reminded that the rooms over all are not large...but, bigger is not always better. Our suite had everything we needed and despite our bathroom fitting 1 at a time we managed beautifully. It was such a cute little bathroom that had little double doors that opened out and you stepped up to the tile floored space that even had a tiny little window...and it couldn't have been cleaner! Great job Mansfield! Hope to see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Damn good hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: nyujay2010
Reviews.Content: Sleeping in this hotel was like living in a classy 1950's movie! The rooms were elegant, classy, classical, with a touch of modern design. And the room was absolutely huge!! I was very impressed with this hotel and I remember if you book in advance you can land a great deal - relative to Manhattan prices that is. The location was also very close to Times Square and the staff were incredibly friendly, unlike some other NYC hotels. I would recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jjames604
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of reviews prior to staying @ the Mansfield. Most negatives focused on two things...room size, and noise of the window AC units. Well, the rooms aren't huge, but it is NYC after all. For two people the standard room is more than enough space. As far as the AC unit is concerned, most reviewers complained about the noise it made, how it opened the room to street noise, or it didn't work well enough. Well, in our experience it wasn't loud, it worked perfectly, and didn't allow street noise to leak in to the room. All in all, nice hotel and good location between 5th and 6th (walking distance to a lot of things, and subway - Grand Central). Staff were friendly and very helpful. Note: Found our rate on Kayak.com 2 months prior to travelling. Lets just say it was 50% less than the advertised rate prior to leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, cosy, quirky and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: wme79736
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel is like staying in a private townhouse whose owner has gone away. Exceptionally well located on 42nd Street between 5th and 6th Avenue, this small and charming hotel has a lobby which is functional and stylish with a cosy bar and restaurant on one side and a panelled library on the other filled with large chairs, books, newspapers and a coffee machine. Hidden behind the reception desk is a small but very well designed and equipped exercise room which is easy and pleasant to use My ‘petite chambre’ (sic) was extremely petite indeed, one of the smallest hotel rooms II have ever seen in New York. A suitcase larger than my overnight bag would not have fitted into the room without occupying essential floor space. The bathroom was the width of an aircraft lavatory but the toiletries and appointments were elegant and well maintained. This ‘petite chambre’ overlooked a grim light-well which produced no light whatsoever so I kept the shutters drawn to avoid the view and whenever I was in the room I switched the directional lighting on. The ensuing gloom was quite pleasant, though it was inconvenient when had to locate important items quickly, such as my pen, notebooks, brief case and shoes, all of which merged with the shadows. A flashlight would have helped. The best feature about the room was the bed which was splendidly made up, beautiful to look at and very comfortable indeed. The combination of this bed, the small size of the room and the pitch black darkness when the lights were out meant that I slept very well. In fact, I would say that the room induced narcolepsy. The members of the front desk staff are all good looking, friendly, charming and almost entirely inattentive. The housekeepers are as friendly and as charming as the front desk staff but they also perform self evidently useful tasks. The hotel was comfortable and interesting but not worth the prices published on the hotel’s website, which are probably as high as they are because of the hotel’s particularly central location. Other hotels offer charm, attentive staff and bigger rooms at cheaper rates.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SammyGroves
Reviews.Content: great for shopping as it was at the end of fith avenue, close to everthing

Reviews.Title: “Mansfield is great !”
Reviews.Author: eclipse59
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is a great small hotel with a great location.... 2 blocks to Times Square and 3 blocks to GCT. Staff was friendly and the room was very clean. Chamber queen room was small but convenience of location and the price made everything OK. Full breakfast included for all six days was a great added bonus. I recommend the Mansfield Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NO VAYAS NI HARTO DE WISKY, DO NOT GO NEITHER COMPLETELY DRUNK”
Reviews.Author: xxccvv
Reviews.Content: They charged 179 euros Night for a room without a WINDOW. and with a huge noise of the AC !! They changed me the room to another one and the sound of the AC of the building next to it was impossible to sleep. There was very POOR of light in the room. The man in the afternoon in the reception was always smiling but when you asked something he said I will bring it to your room and the plug never came. If they charged me 80euros would be acceptable, otherwise NOT. A hotel NOT TO GO BACK EVER AGAIN !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Great Hotel , just perfect”
Reviews.Author: PaulWhiting
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from NYC once again and this time we were looking for a well situated hotel for sightseeing for my parents wedding anniversary. We were also looking for a smaller quiet hotel so we could relax in the evenings. We would like you to know we have found the gem of the city. THE MANSFIELD HOTEL 12 WEST 44TH NYC. The hotel is in an excellent position just 2 blocks from Times Square. It’s so close to everything you want to see but also just far enough away to be quiet and relaxing. A factor we were amazed about is what you see on their website is what you get; there are no glossy misleading pictures. All the rooms are just perfect. Upon arrival you immediately get the welcoming smile from each and every staff member at that remains the same to the day you depart. The door staff and concierge were exceptionally helpful and friendly throughout and the reception staff was Excellent. The boss of reception was Henry McLauren and if nothing is too much to ask. The rooms as you will see are in fantastic condition and are exactly what you see on the website. They don’t hide the fact this is a boutique Hotel and the rooms are smaller than others but everything you need is in there. The rooms have A/C and a safe and the bathrooms are fantastic. All fitted out to a high modern standard and very clean. Admittedly being a smaller hotel consisting of 12 floors it does not have fantastic views from the rooms however any traveller going to see NYC will know you need to get out and about to see the city so this is in no way a disadvantage. The hotel has the full range of amenities available to you with a fantastic fully equipped Gym, Free internet access , Fantastic menu , Room service , Excellent selection of drinks at the bar , Fantastic Staff , The bar at night is lovely and relaxed and drinks are very reasonable pricing. I will have uploaded pictures of all levels of rooms from the smaller Chamber Queens through to the Penthouse and you will be able to see the fantastic standards are consistent throughout. I was informed that there are seasonal price variations and that like all New York Hotels shopping around for your price is recommended. We used a company called Magellan Vacations and they were also excellent. Do your shopping around then go to them we paid $149.25 per night plus the usual taxes and fees. This made the hotel very affordable and EXCELLENT value for money. I will include pictures of various rooms and did enquire about the pricing of the Penthouse as it was amazing the price again was dependant on season and was from $800 - $1200 per night. If you are going for a very special event (Honeymoon etc) don’t miss this you will love it. All in All in this has been the best hotel we have found in NYC, Highly recommended and we will be staying there again. Please feel free to email me in relation to any information you may need as I am more than willing to help you. Or email the manager his name is John David Agosto (-----) once again a very helpful & positive person, guess that’s where the staff at The Mansfield get it from. LEAD BY EXAMPLE My email is: [----] if you have any questions Thanks very much for reading this review I am sure you will love the Mansfiled if you choose to visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, classic style New York City.”
Reviews.Author: bettina48
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel, very clean, small but perfectly functional, great service and excellent location with interesting history, staff was very helpful which it was nice since some people in the city were very cranky; We would definitly go back. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Low lights, low sound, low service”
Reviews.Author: beadshop1
Reviews.Content: The room was small-very small, but that was expected. I've never been in a room with such poor lighting however, so if you need to work, it is a real problem. Applying cosmetics is a bigger problem. The television volume has a governor, so it is really hard to hear, even at full volume. The A/C also has a governor, so even if you set it at 60, it won't get any cooler. The staff was rude and there was no service.

Reviews.Title: “Above & beyond customer service”
Reviews.Author: LonghornFan73
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying at this hotel after reading the mixed reviews. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel has character, the hotel staff customer service went above and beyond to help me out, the room was clean and comfortable and the hotel is a few blocks from Times Square and Grand Central Station...wow, what a great hotel. I arrived and was instantly greeted , upgraded to a king size room, and given vouchers for free breakfast every morning. The room is small, but there was plenty of room to walk around, the bed was comfortable, and I loved the hard wood floors. I am a bit technically challenged so the a member of the mainteance team arrived within minutes of calling to show me how to work the A/C and A/C remote. Now to the wonderful customer service. The team at reception and housekeeping were so prompt with my request for ice, places to eat around the hotel, and any questions I had while I was there. However, the best moment was at checkout. Sunday morning (6/13/10), I was leaving at 4am to catch my flight. Unfortunately, the Puerto Rican parade was that day and started in front of the hotel so the street was blocked off. The hotel had notified the guest the prior day to let us know. Gina, at reception, said she would take care of me. She called me at taxi to pick me up at the corner of 5th & 44th. I was a bit nervous to walk to the corner by myself since it was 4am, I'm 3 1/2 months pregnant, and my traveling bags in tow would be a sure sign that I was an easy target for anyone. Gina assured me that even though it was a very safe neighborhood, she would personally walk me to my taxi so I would feel comfortable. WOW - she was wonderful. I will be staying at this hotel over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Slept with a chair behind the door”
Reviews.Author: msmccorm
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks to be under renovation. The two elevators are quite small, one was extremely dark and made me nervous. The hotel room itself had no security latch, only the one deadbold, which left me feeling insecure, I slept with a chair behind the door. The room was an interesting, old style design, but with that comes no central air or heat. The a/c was provided through a window unit. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall I really enjoyed my stay at The...”
Reviews.Author: Yujicatso
Reviews.Content: Overall I really enjoyed my stay at The Mansfield. It was a good location, close to Times Square and 5th Ave, so exactly where you would want to be. The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean but a little small, but it was ok for me as I was on my honeymoon, but if you are friends sharing I wouldn't recommed it as they is no lock on the bathroom and it is SMALL. Double check your bill as we were charged something from the mini bar that we never had but they sorted it with no fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Zeynobb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days in June in Mansfield hotel with my husband. Since I read the reviews mentioning that the rooms are very small during check in I especially requested from the front desk a decent size room since we are two persons with two luggages each and we are gonna stay 10 days. He said all the bigger rooms are reserved so there is nothing he can do and he gave us one room which we entered and ran back immediately. It was tiny tiny with no light and a horrible air ventilation noise. The same guy who couldnt do anything suddenly could do something when we started claiming and gave us a bigger room!!?? I dont like this kind of approach which to get something you need to claim and cry etc. since it doesnt happen when you decently and logically request. Anyway the final room was ok. However I should mention that air ventilation was still noisy and the lighting of the room is very bad. Also the 24 hour free wi fi which was one of our attractions for the hotel was not working properly and when it worked it really only worked in the toilet (no kidding). There was 24 hours complimentary coffee tea which was nice. Location is very good. The bar and the staff in the bar was very nice. Front desk was never even saying hello good morning good bye nothing except for one lady whom I saw only in the last day. Housekeeping was very good room was always very clean and taken care of. One more negative thing is that when we were checking out I saw that many minibar costs were charged which was not correct. However when I mentioned they corrected. Overall recommendable considering the NYC options.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, but a good value and location”
Reviews.Author: rmoore34
Reviews.Content: The location and the price that we paid for the hotel were very good. Unfortunately, there was construction in the lobby during our stay, which was not communicated upfront. In addition, the service from everyone (especially the front desk) was very bad. It was typical for the front desk people to be on personal phone calls while we tried to get some assistance from them. Overall, if you are traveling on a budget, it is good.

Reviews.Title: “a B&B&H - BAD Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joshbos
Reviews.Content: Lobby under construction. I purchased ahead of time a room with sunlight and perhaps a view. I received a room on a light well .. with a broken air conditioner which felt like a tomb. FInally given the "only room left" - same room only 4 floors higher. The AC was essential, as one could not open a window, but it was so loud - the sleep quality was poor. Guest brochure in room stated complimentary continental breakfast in the bar. Once seated there at 8am , i was told they did not have a continental breakfast and nothing was complimentary. Staff was less than professional. It took 3 phone calls to get an extra lamp in the room -- lighting was so bad, you could not see in the dark room. Also a housekeeper, brought bags of dirty laundry onto the elevator, rather than waiting for an empty elevator. Location great between Grand Central and Times Square ... but there are lots of hotels in this area. this is a BAD boutique hotel, which should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....”
Reviews.Author: Blackburn1980
Reviews.Content: But, there were a few niggles, but only niggles. We stayed in a chambre petite room, which was essentially fine, as we did not intend on staying in the room very much, which we didn't, however, when we did, it was a bit of a tight squeeze with 2 suitcases and after a days' shopping, we were struggling to make our way around the bed. The room comprised of a very comfortable double bed, a single wardrobe of which most of the space was taken up by the mini bar fridge and the safe. The safe was far too high for me to reach and it was difficult to check it was empty when we left even for my 6ft husband. The room also had a lovely window seat, but being only 5 floors up, we looked out to nothing but other rooms, so the blinds remained permanantely closed! Shame really. The bathroom, on the other hand was huge with a walk-in double shower and Aveda products to boot. Another hook to hang stuff on would've been useful, particularly as there were two people in the room. The room was generally clean, but the floor was in need of a good clean as there were a good few inches of dust at the edges. The hotel also had a very convenient library, which of course housed books and a chess board, but more importantly, it provided complimentary tea and coffee (tea drinkers who have milk like me need to request milk from the M Bar). There was an intermittent wifi connection for the hotel, although there were computers available for your use. There was also a gym in the hotel, but we never used it nor looked in. The M Bar was on site, adjacent to reception, but we only wnet in to get milk for tea! Staff were acconmadating and polite enough when we needed assistance. On departure, we had to vacate the room at midday, but our flight was not till the evening, so we were able to leave our luggage in a safe room whilst we continued exploring NYC. The hotel is conveniently placed, being 2 blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from Grand Central Station. There's a good Italian restaurant next door and breakfast can be found everywhere! You won't be far from the Rockefeller and Chrysler buildings as well as Broadway. All in all a great stay at The Mansfield, with a few niggles that could easily be sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Both good and bad points.”
Reviews.Author: meklof
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many good and bad points so it is up to you to decide which ones are more important to you. From our stay on 24-25 April. 2010 Good - location, libary with free espresso machine, free NY times daily. Free lobby computers, renovated bed, showers, hardwood floors. Bad - Don't care attitude among all staff and shifts. Rooms ending with 07-12 as these face the airducts on roof of the building next door. It is like sleeping in a subway station. Room 611 - great beds, shower - very noisy poorly constructed air condition in window, very noisy due to air ducts outside windows - earplugs were not enough. Room 809 - lower noisy volume, but saging bed, very small bathroom. The door is actualluy the same size as the room closet. BTW, this is the 3rd and last time at this hotel. staff has always been bland, but we dealt with that when the rooms were better pre-renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, but likely would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LT55
Reviews.Content: The room rate was quite reasonable, and the hotel is clean and in good condition and there is a nice restaurant/bar area with reasonably-priced food. The reasons that I would personally not stay here again are as follows: Very small room No carpeting in the room - looks nice, but I like to stretch and do sit-ups, etc. and it is not comfortable on the hardwood floor. My 3rd floor street-facing room was very noisy - I could hear every street noise. I live in the city of Chicago, so I am used to some noise, but this was bad. Even with the window closed, which leads me to the next issue. No A/C in my room (I think some rooms do have A/C). My room got very stuffy...with the window open, the noise was unbearable (one of the two nights I was there, there was some street construction going on all night). With the windows closed, the room was hot and stuffy. No Fox News. Probably not a concern for a lot of you, but I really like my Fox and Friends in the morning and the 6:00 news on this network. Seems like a relataively inexpensive fix to have a diverse set of news channels (they had MSNBC, CNN) Overall...just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: holly267
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 24th to 28th March. The hotel is virtually opposite the Sofitel. I’d purposely booked 2 rooms as I knew how small the rooms in these boutique hotels can be. We were not offered any upgrades, I made the booking via the hotel. We had rooms at each end of the 8th floor, away from the lifts so no “pinging” noise to annoy us! Initially the rooms seemed fine, although both were incredibly hot with small radiators on full blast, despite the temperature being around 16c when we arrived. Fortunately we managed to turn them off completely and the windows opened. My room was the smallest, with a toilet and shower cubicle in the tiniest of bathrooms! Too small for a sink which was outside and in the bedroom itself. The saloon type doors did close but had a gap down the middle and any taller than me and your knees wouldn’t fit inside the little bathroom itself! Fine for me on my own but not if you like privacy! My husband’s bathroom was bigger with a bath and shower combined. The rooms are very dark, with lots of dark wood but there are blinds you can open and plenty of lights. It was very clean and we both found the beds and bedding to be extremely comfortable. The temperature dropped to around freezing during our 4 days but I still didn’t need the radiator on! Nice flat screen tv and free WIFI which my husband used. There wasn’t much noise, apart from one night when I could hear people coming back at around 12.30am and they slammed their doors! This was repeated at around 3.45am in the room next to mine! We also noted that we could smell cigarette smoke in some parts of the corridors, we had asked for a non-smoking floor so maybe the smoke was drifting from other floors (the staircases are open leading to each floor) or we were on the smoking floor. Once inside our rooms we couldn’t smell anything, which was our main priority. There was some street noise in my room but it didn’t bother me, my husband’s room was quieter. We had an excellent meal one evening in the Hotel’s bar, good, friendly, efficient service and a nice menu. We also had breakfast which was ok, but nothing special and the bar in the daytime was rather depressing with so much dark wood and dim lighting. We made use of the complimentary tea/coffee machine which is available in the “reading room”, unfortunately it constantly ran out of coffee and milk and the staff were in no rush to refill it! We also noticed that the hotel was very dusty! Many of the surfaces in the reading room were covered in dust and the computers and desk area were dusty enough to write messages on! We got a hotel car to Newark Airport rather than a yellow taxi. This was very comfortable journey in a SUV with a good driver. Overall, the hotel was fine for 4 nights but I’m not sure if I’d stay there again, despite it’s good location. It’s a shame that the hotel doesn’t offer a small complimentary breakfast like many of the other boutique hotels do.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: traveller05HongKong
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - highlight of my trip to New York. Great location and very stylish. Had an upgrade to a Club Row suite and loved loved loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Pinky88Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield this past weekend and had a lovely time. My husband had organized a surprise trip to NYC for our anniversary and several friends had joined us. When we arrived and told them we were celebrating our anniversary, they upgraded us to a large suite (#1008). Our friends also got upgraded, and they bought us a round of drinks at the bar. Service seemed good most of the time - especially the first night. Sometimes desk staff didn't have answers to simple questions, and the waitress in the bar was kinda cranky both nights we were in there- but generally they were pretty good. Nice Aveda products in the bathroom, flat screen TV's, free wireless internet, free coffee and tea 24/7 in a little lounge in the lobby. Windows that open which was nice. A closet, desk, window seat and couches in the sitting room. VERY comfy bed. Minibar with a good selection of stuff. Our room was lovely, huge (because of the upgrade) - the only things that could use improvement were: 1 - Lighting - it is quite dim 2 - Mirror - all we had was a tiny mirror in the bathroom - like 4 inches diameter - in that whole huge room. A full length or at least half length would be good. 3 - Heat/air - you can't control your heat - we had to have the hotel engineer come up to shut off the radiators completely as we roasted the first night! Our friends however, froze. The bathroom was pretty small but really - not a big deal. Nicely appointed room overall. The location was nice and central and I thought it was a good value - we got 3 nights for the price of 2. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, amenities, and quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this hotel - the location couldn't be more perfect, the rooms are nicely appointed, and did I mention location? Service was great - few hotels in New York do you walk into and feel warmth and sincerity from their staff, but the staff at the Mansfield were all extremely friendly and down-to-earth. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: zed1985
Reviews.Content: Me and my girldfriend stayed at the mansfield for 5 nights at the end of feb 2010. on arrival check in was fast and smooth. Hotel staff very helpful and freindly. Room was very small but we had a petite chambre room and expected this. Never the less the room was well designed and made the most of the small size. The rooms get cleaned every day. We got two complimentary tokens to eat breakfast at the hotel which was very nice. A little pricey though and probably wouldnt of ate here if we didnt have the tokens. the hotel is a 2 minute walk from times square. Perfect location. We didnt spend much time in our room, but after a hectic day sight seeing in manhatten the mansfield is perfect for relaxing in a chic comfortable modern hotel. Would definatle stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, Nice Bar & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rexynyc
Reviews.Content: clean room but small bathrooms and not a fan of the rugs on the floor breakfast great for NYC and cool bar for late cocktail amazing location in midtown

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LittlebobB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield for five nights in Nov 09. On arrival I asked if there were any larger rooms (having read that the Chambre Petite rooms are very small) we were given the option of having a larger room but it was smoking. We took that option and just opened the windows for the first day which was fine. The room was very small and having looked at the website again on out return we realised that we hadn't been given a larger room at all! The bed was very comfortable and the room kept clean although it was a bit tatty and could do with updating. It was noisy even though we were on a high floor but we did expect this being situated just off 5th avenue and as it's an old building. Also the air-conditioning didn't work very well and would've been far too loud to have on at night. If a great location is your main requirement I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was also one of the cheaper hotels to stay in, especially in that area so we weren't too disappointed overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Stroid
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Mansfield. I got a taxi to the hotel which was very easy (just remember that the flat rate of $45 does not include tolls or tip). Check in went smoothly (although the front desk staff seemed very bored to be there and was not overly friendly)-we arrived at 14:30 and were allowed to go to our room straight away. I had booked a Parlour Queen as I had read on tripadvisor that the rooms were tiny. I booked directly on the Mansfield website and got 3 nights for the price of 2. The Parlour Queen was also very small but it was big enough for my boyfriend and I to keep our bags on seperate sides of the bed and not bump into each other when packing. The bathroom was fairly big (no bathtub) with a giant shower which always had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The biggest downside about the room wasn't the size at all but that there was no ceiling light so it was quite difficult to get the room well lit on entering the room at night as we had to turn on all the lights-dim lighting is pretty but not very practical so it would have been nice to have the choice. The bed was very comfortable and the room was impecably clean. The room seemed a bit too warm at times and we weren't quite sure how to sort out the heating but opeing the window for a bit sorted it out fairly quickly considering how cold outside! There was no view-just the back of another building but we really didn't mind at all since we saw so much when we were outside the hotel. There was a flatscreen tv on the wall opposite the bed and I was delighted with the docking station for iPods as I didn't have an adapter for my iPhone charger with me. The free wifi worked very well. The location was fantastic. A mere 2 blocks away from Times Square so it was near the hussle and bussle but within a very nice quiet hotel. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel but the bar where breakfast is served looked very nice altough a bit expensive and there are plenty of places to get food near the hotel. The staff at the hotel lobbey barely even greeted us when going in or out. On one occasion we came back to the hotel having done a lot of shopping and a person came out and asked if we were checking in, when we said no they went away again without helping us with our bags.... On another occasion my boyfriend was having coffee in the reading room and heard the lobbey staff giving out about their employer-loudly enough for him to hear every word without intending to evesdrop, which did not seem very proffesional.... When checking out we got a car from the hotel which was great-$55 plus tip for a very comfortable journey. All in all I would recommend this hotel for the beautiful and comfortable rooms, located very near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setup with great location”
Reviews.Author: Speedtwins
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mansfield based on some of the reviews we read on the site. My wife and I have stayed at a number of hotels in Europoe that would be considered being on the small side, so the comments about the size of the room didn't discourage us. We the room was small, no doubt about it. The bathroom was kind of funny as it was barely big enough to turn around without falling out back into the bedroom. That said, it was still a nice room. The bed was super comfortable and the room was impeccably clean. We would stay here again assuming we could still get the AAA rate that we were able to book the room under. Overall a good stay. I can see taller/bigger people being vary uncomfortable in this room but to my understanding they do have bigger rooms available (i.e. suite).

Reviews.Title: “Mansfield Hotel, New York”
Reviews.Author: BeateS3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a queen chambre which had a nice size for one person. The staff was very helpful and location perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best you'll get in New York considering the price”
Reviews.Author: fcah0218
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in New York for commencement ceremonies this past May and we stayed at the Mansfield. Considering that we were in New York City, and we wanted a nice, quiet hotel, I think we got a pretty good deal. The Mansfield is a whole lot smaller than depicted in the pictures of the website. The rooms are extremely small, and the bathroom is tiny. The staff are extremely friendly, but don't necessarily follow through. For example, I called the front desk asking for a knife, and they said it would come immediately but it never arrived. The location is extremely good. It's close enough to Time Square to explore yet far enough away to get away from the noise. It was a safe walk to the subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravel77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in early December. Hotel is charming. We were upgraded upon arrival. The rooms were small, but we knew they would be. Room was comfortable and updated but I wished the closet would have been larger. We stayed on street side, 5th floor, but heard very little noise. This was the perfect hotel for our first trip to NYC. The location was great and we were able to walk most everywhere we wanted to go. Grand Central Station was a short walk away if we needed the subway. Our breakfast was included and was delicious although at times the service was slow. Bottom line, this hotel was clean, safe and in a good location. I would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel deserving mixed views”
Reviews.Author: renaud21
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we had mixed feelings about staying at the Mansfield. Those feelings were confirmed by our experience. We stayed in a Parlour Queen which was roomy, though there was no dresser. The room was cold (December) so we called the front desk. Within minutes someone was at the door to correct the problem. What great service. However, our request for a rob and a suitcase stand went unanswered for our three day stay. Again, the mixed reviews of the hotel reflect its curious nature. It is wonderful, the rooms are nice and modern but the service can be spotty. We had a room at the front of the hotel. Even on the sixth floor there was some street noise at night. I would recommend starying off the street side or having a room on the 8th floor. Breakfast was included with our rate. The food was excellent. Once again, there were some problems. Every morning there were menu items that were unavailable. The food was very good. If only all the ingredients were available. We definetly recommend the hotel. Don't expect perfection, or some of the other "special" amenities mentioned in other reviews, and you will not be disappointed. It is charming and the staff is friendly and generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, Friendly service, Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: kir-sum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mansfield for 5 days just before Christmas and our stay was great. The staff could not do enough to help us and one lovely member of staff even up graded us to a twin suite on arrival, as the only rooms available at the time of our booking was a petite chambre and I have heard they are very small. The decor was great, the breakfast was really tasty and the wine was lovely (alhough very pricey). The best thing about the Mansfield is it's location, to the left of the hotel 5th Avene can be found (2 min walk) and to the right is Times Square (5 min walk). We couldn't believe how close everything is, we really did feel we had hit jack pot with the Mansfield's location. As for New York, well as a first time visitor I can only hope that I am lucky enough to get the chance to visit this magical city again. If you get the opportunity to go then you won't be sorry and as for the Mansfiled it is a great base to experience the brilliance of the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy a great stay at the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: McKitties
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in April and really enjoyed our time at this hotel. The Mansfield has a touch of class and is small enough to have the personal touch. The room was not as small as we had feared from other reviews although the air conditioner was rather loud and the doors to the bathroom were strange wardrobe doors with a big gap between them - our view was of a brick wall 10 metres away. These were just minor issues and the overwhelming memory was of an excellent stay with a location ideal between Times Square and Fifth Avenue - if this is your first time in New York I would recommend the Mansfield, everything is within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique oasis in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: L_darrell44
Reviews.Content: Outstanding little boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. Wonderful little cocktail bar/restaurant with a very relaxing yet sophisticated literary leather and cigar vibe. Life's too short and NYC is too big a city to stay in the same place twice but, I'm glad we stayed here once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: emmaloumassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Hotel very clean and staff extremely friendly The room we stayed in was REALLY , REALLY SMALL. Had a very small window which did not open, with a large air vent outside. There was an airconditioner in the window which we had to turn on to cool down the room. Very loud during the night. One night was enough in the room, although the hotel itself is really very nice. We asked for an upgrade to be told none were available. If you stay here definately book a suite!!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have a suite”
Reviews.Author: jefk56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night in a Chamber Queen room. The hotel is very old, but well kept and has a definite charm about it. However the room we had was so small, by any standards. I would say under 110 sq. ft. You had to stand sideways at the sink in the bathroom because of the proximity of the toilet. We are not "large" people by any means, but there was absolutely no space in the room other than the bed and about a ft. on the sides and maybe 3 ft. at the foot of it. I did have the opp. to view a suite however which looked very accomodating. Although this was a clean room, nicely appointed and a very politely staffed hotel, do not go for more than a night unless you go Club Suite or better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ronrenee
Reviews.Content: We arrived on October 22 and stayed for 3 nights. There were 4 of us in 2 different rooms. My husband and I were initially booked in a Chambre room but upgraded to a larger room once we saw it. The Chambre rooms really are extremely tiny. We upgraded to a room with a king and that was much better, although there was no bathtub or air conditioner in our new room). In addition, the room faced a busy street so it was noisy. The service at this hotel exceeded my expectations. Everyone was extremely helpful and kind. The location was perfect for us since it was our first time to NY and it was so close to everything! DO NOT take a hotel shuttle from the airport - take a cab or contact the hotel for their private car. I made the awful mistake of taking the GO shuttle and it took me 4 hours to get to Manhatten from the time I landed! Overall, good experience at Mansfield - would recommend it! Also - visit the little pub/restaurant beside it - EXCELLENT service as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: osucable
Reviews.Content: On arrival Hotel was easily found and in a nice location. We had reserved a king room two months in advance but on arrival they stated that we had been upgraded to a suite which we found out only has a queen size bed. We stated that we wanted a king room and did not want the suite. We were told there was not a king available which we did not like to hear that after a two month notice. One of the night managers heard our discussion and that we were not satisfied with the upgrade and amazingly he managed to find us a king room. We were completely satisfied and thanked him and he took us to our room. I had heard all of the small room stories in New York and did not know what to expect since this was my first visit. The room was extremely nice and a very nice size so the photos on line were accurate. We had one of the lights above the bed that was out and no wash cloths but other than that I would relate our stay excellent. The room had been updated and was clean, the sink in the bathroom was a little small but it was updated and clean. Our bed was very comfortable which was nice after a long day. We never had a problem getting an elevator and we were on the 10th floor. The elevators are small but were quick getting to our floor. This is a nice Hotel that when we return to New York we would like to stay at again especially with the location and easy access to the subway. It is nice that they are offering the buy two nights and get the third free which is a nice savings. Don't pass this one up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Akajouhumme
Reviews.Content: + Hotel mansfield is located at the corner of 5th avenue, right where all the shops are, a top location with times square a block away ! + The staff was friendly and helpful + the room was quite clean and stylish, a bit too small though + breakfast was included, not that bad - the room had a window (which you could not open), but no a view at all, just a brick wall - the AC was really loud, while the room was too hot at night without the AC

Reviews.Title: “If travelling with a group or tour give a cash deposit”
Reviews.Author: Chance399
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Mansfield Hotel for 6 nights between August 1-7 and thoroughly enjoyed my time in NYC. Howevr the aftermath of this trip has not been so pleasant. I was travelling with a large group with my daughter's dance troupe. Upon check-in I was asked for an imprint of my credit card for any incidental charges that I may occur. Unfortunately the travel company that organized the tour did not complete the full payment of their contract with the Hotel and the hotel proceded to charge 17 of the guests with the group the outstanding balance for the entire group of 81 people for the tune of $41,000. They would not overturn these charges which were unauthorized and it has become quite a stressful ordeal. I want to ensure this does not happen to anyone else-so be very careful with usage of your credit card if staying at this hotel with a group when you have prepaid for your trip. Leave a cash deposit at the desk for $100 and take it with you when you leave to save yourself an unbelievable stressful encounter!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW What an incredible NYC hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grajam
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful weekend in NYC.. First time here and had an absolute ball...The Mansfield Hotel was more than we had expected... Great location, wonderful staff and a great deal for our three night stay.. Would highly reccommend the Mansfield to family and friends.... We will definetely go back to the Mansfield Hotel on our next trip to the BIG APPLE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay--beautiful classic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Postcards
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend in this beautiful hotel. The location is perfect--just blocks from Times Square and Broadway. Despite the busy location, the hotel was quiet and seemed to be a world away from the busy city blocks. The hotel has character and is nice and comforting to come back to at the end of a busy day. Upon arrival we found ourselves to be surprisingly upgraded to Penthouse Room. Our room was bigger than expected (we had read other reviews for this hotel)--we had plenty of space and it was simply decorated. I loved the dark wood floors and large windows, and the bedding is pretty and comfortable. The room was dark, but did not pose a problem. The room, with the contrast of white bedding and dark walls, was both elegant and romantic. The hotel itself is small, but very charming. I loved the narrow hallways, winding steep staircase, and marble floors. There is a pretty reading room in the front of the hotel with a fireplace and tall wooden bookcases and cozy chairs. The general ambiance of the hotel was both luxurious and comforting. All in all, I am eagerly awaiting a return trip to Mansfield. I could not recommend it more highly to those who enjoy classic, beautiful, timeless hotels.

Reviews.Title: “shabby but great location”
Reviews.Author: judi2
Reviews.Content: this was recommended to me by Magellan Vacations. Great location but very small rooms, floors need work, wooden window shades, knicked up furniture. In US, I have never had a bathroom sink in my bedroom. Amenities were AVeda, but they needed rugs on floor. There was a whole area empty where they could have put a dresser! The lighting was poor all over the room. I had to call for a hair dryer which took forever and when I was leaving, I found one hanging in the dark closet. They could do a lot to make some of these things better. I called the agency and they offered me a smaller room (I was upgraded to a parlour queen before I got there). There was absolutely NO ROOM in the other room. Of course, it looked better because you couldn't see the floor!! The woman behind the desk was very efficient and nice, but I don't think they have any better rooms than I had except the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, rest just standard”
Reviews.Author: Swiftmen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights and originally booked a parlour queen room. Check-in was quick, the staff very friendly but the room on low floor was pretty small, dark and loud (oldest a/c I've ever seen). After 1 night in the parlour queen we we're upgraded to a parlour king on a high floor - for free. The room was a bit bigger and less loud but still dark. Pro: Location, very friendly staff, free coffee Contra: rather small and dark rooms, old and loud a/c, small bath Over all it's just worn standard

Reviews.Title: “The Mansfield Hotel was affordable, clean, comfortable, charming and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiJoe
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay for a leisure trip with my daughter for her birthday and couldn't have stayed at a better place. The staff was accommodating storing luggage before check in and after check out. Rooms were comfortable and the housekeeping staff the best I have ever had. Each night after coming in, the room was tidy, clean and nothing out of place. The best location in the city and we walked to everything. They have a special - buy 2 nights, get one free - amazing bargin and I will be back. Very close to Bryant Park - a great place to take breakfast or lunch food and enjoy the park and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NataleeGary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a stone throw from Timesquare, the theatre district and great restaurants. Small boutique hotel. Rooms are a good size for New York. Bathroom is abit tight but nothing to worry about. Very clean and tidy hotel with great facilities rooms cleaned daily. Bonus being so close to the action is that you don't hear much noise at night so you can easily sleep. Don't bother eating breakfast at the hotel as food is very pricey. A short walk up or down the road are great breakfast places with good service. Hubby and I walked to most places it was easy to get around and there are more Police on the streets than people so you feel very safe at 1pm or 1am. We got a fantastic rate at the hotel and there were no hidden charges. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not a good nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: ClaretAl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. First impressions were good, handy location just off 5th Avenue, marble entrance hall, cosy library/lounge with free coffee, adjoining bar area and a very pleasant and helpful receptionist lady. We had arrived mid morning having first checked that we could store our luggage at the hotel and return after official check in time and no problems there. We returned later in the day to officially check in, were handed our room key and told our luggage would be brought up shortly. The lifts were very small and a bit creaky and dim but we made it to the 7th floor which was equally creaky and dimly lit. When we opened the bedroom door we thought they had actually given us the key to the broom cupboard as it was such a small room but, hey, we only planned to wash and sleep there and they say size is not important! Our cases arrived shortly after and we managed to squeeze them in somehow. The room was clean but again a bit dim even with the light on. The bathroom was 'compact' but functional and came with the added bonus that you could slide the bathroom door back and with only one step you were in bed! The single window faced a brick wall housing one of the largest air conditioning ducts we'd ever seen and it turned out this 'hummed' all night long making for a very disturbed nights sleep. Next morning we debated wether to ask for a change of room as it was only for one more night but decided as were in for a very long day/night and journey home tomorrow a goods night sleep was required. The receptionist agreed to move us without any qualms and said if we left our luggage ready in the room it would be relocated for us. When we returned around 6ish for a wash and brush up we had been moved to a room a couple of floors up at the front of the hotel facing the street-our forlorn looking luggage was waiting for us as promised. This room was similar to the first one but a little bigger and although there was a little traffic noise at least no continuous noise to keep us awake later, erm, well at least that's what we thought........... About 3am that morning it sounded like there was a dust cart convention going on in the street below, lorries backing up with reversing beepers, clanging metal, engine noise. This went on for hours so again sleep was only possible in fits and starts. Maybe we were just unlucky with our room allocations and of course some noise is to be expected in NYC but having said that we had previously stayed at another hotel facing right on to Lexington Avenue and didn't encounter any excessive noise. The hotel does have a certain old world charm about it, the staff members we encountered were all friendly and helpful and it is handily located for getting about and seeing the sights but even if the City never sleeps occasionally it's visitors need to so we probably would not stay here again unless a quiet room was guaranteed! .

Reviews.Title: “layback, in the heart of new york city”
Reviews.Author: milly75uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, everyone friendly and helpful. The room is very dark though - great for slepping but difficult to see to put on make up in the morning. I stayed in a room with a queens sized bed, it was very comfortable. The room is equiped with a mini bar, safe hair dryer, full lenght mirror and wall mounted television. Its only a 5 minute walk for times square. If you are going for leisure i recomend trying out the greyline bus tours $90 for 24hour hop on hop off tours that also gets you into some of the top attractions for free also. They are very well informed and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mpdgb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - just a few minutes walk from Grand Central Station and Times Square. Hotel rooms in most cities tend to be very small (unless you're willing to spend lots of money), and The Mansfield is no exception. We stayed in a petite Queen room. It was stylishly decorated and comfortable, but we could not see the light of day. The tiny window in the room faced a brick wall, and it was tinted, so it really did not serve the purpose of a window, except to house a VERY noisy air conditioner that made it difficult for us to sleep. The bed was comfortable and the TV was a good size. Free internet was a very nice bonus! The bathroom was very modern, though a little cramped. The staff were not particularly friendly but they were helpful enough. Breakfast was included in our rate (which was greatly discounted from the hotel's rack rates), so we took advantage of that. The food was decent but the service was very slow. I wouldn't eat there if it weren't free. The common areas of the hotel have a lot of charm, and the library has an awesome cappuccino, late and tea maker (and it's free). All in all, it was a pleasant enough stay. I would probably stay there again, provided I have my ear plugs with me.

Reviews.Title: “Charming (with some of the "charms" of an older property)”
Reviews.Author: AKAdc
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield was charming - a throw back to an earlier time of paneling, hardwood floors, and marble. The library was a nice place to gradually move into another hectic day in NYC, and a nice place to unwind in the evenings. The location is unbeatable, whether a majority of your activities will be on the East Side or West Side (just blocks to Grand Central or Times Square, with great subway connections), or uptown or downtown. At the same time, the street itself is very quiet, particularly for NYC. The hotel's drawbacks are associated with the age of the building, namely small rooms, tiny bathrooms, narrow halls and inadequent HVAC. The HVAC in particular definitely leaves something to be desired - the air conditioning unit is extremely loud and vibrates, and creates a draft that leaves one either too warm or too cool. The other issues are, I suppose, part of the "charm" and character of an historic property. The staff could not have been nicer - they were helpful, friendly, and genuinely seemed to enjoy being there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_cj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in several hotels in NY but this one is really outstanding and what makes it outstanding is the staff at the first place!! All hotels employees were more than happy to help us. Check-in was quick and we were lucky enough to get upgrade to 2-bedroom suite with a fireplace. Rooms - the suite was clean and very big, too big for me and my husband :) very tasty decor, surprisingly quiet at night (bit no views) Location - the best possible, between 5th and 6th ave, 10 minutes walk to Times Square, Lobby - there is coffee and tea available for guests for free and nice relax room with fireplace if you want to read some newspapers or play chess. Some piece of advice - if you do not have breakfast included it is better to go to any bar outside (there are plenty of them in the neighborhood). We will definately come back to the Mansfield soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mansfield Mood”
Reviews.Author: monicamadison
Reviews.Content: For some time I've been longing to stay here. My mate and I decided to spend date night in the city instead of trekking back home after a late dinner. The room was typical NYC hotel small, the noisy air conditioner didn't help matters. Lovely bathroom. And the fitness center was superb. If you just want the basics a place to rest your head and have drinks in the bar which is superb then its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Iloveholidays1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mansfield for 3 nights. Checked into our room, only had a shower no bath, went to reception & asked if i could have a room with a bath, no problem the receptionist upgraded our room to a mini suite , it was fantastic & no extra charge she said it was a special treat for us . Definately will be going back..We did the open top tour bus go with grey line very good value for money,all prices included 3 top attractions well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: richp4nyc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, helpful staff and all at a great price through RoomsNet. If you're looking for a good value hotel in mid-town Manhattan then this is for you. Located just off 5th Avenue at 44th Street, you can easily walk to all the mid-town attractions from here such as Times Square, Broadway. Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Terminus etc. Like other reviewers have mentioned, there was no complementary breakfast on offer. There is a paying alternative within the hotel but the Red Flame diner just along the road (67 W 44th Street) was a better option for us. All in all we would definitely return to The Mansfield when next in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicehotelseekers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mansfield on a girls trip to New York and found the whole experience thoroughly enjoyable. I was able to negotiate a good rate with the hotel using prices cited on other hotel booking sites. When we arrived we found the hotel easily and were impressed by the central location coupled with a certain understated elegance. the room we were originally given did not have a safe and as we felt uncomfortable with this, we were able to move rooms. We were uncomfortable in the second room and as soon as we reported this to the staff, they upgraded us to a larger room at no additional cost. All our queries and complaints were dealt with in a friendly and professional way. None of the staff could have been more helpful or accommodating. We did not eat at the hotel so can't comment on the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: ramblegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business, liked the updated rooms, good bed, nice TV and toiletries. Breakfast was great - I hadn't even realized it was included in my rate. Staff were very helpful and pleasant, despite being a very crowded, very rainy night. Heat/cooling in room was a little perplexing, radiators were on and windows didn't seem to close all the way, but lucked out - temperature was perfect. I like 44th street, very central, just busy enough at night, but not loud. Plenty of nearby food.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shushush
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel few minutes walk from the Time square and one block from the Grand Central. The room was nice and we find there everything that we need. Staff were very nice and helpful. when we checked in we had a voucher from a reservations website it was a room with 2 king size beds but when we arrived they explained us that the room is not with 2 beds and if we want 2 kings beds we have to upgrade it after long controversy we paid more but not the price that they want.

Reviews.Title: “The Mansfield - Great Value and Terrific Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 3 night stay at The Mansfield. It was a very unique mid-town experience and combined quality/location/value in what was a very strong proposition. More specific thoughts along with grade for each area follow. Staff From the moment I got out of the cab in the rain, to the moment that I got in another cab (my sole cabs btw on the trip; I strongly prefer walking/subway/busses) I could not say enough things positive things about the staff. First, they were professional. They were always very friendly and made The Mansfield feel like a home away from home. If they did not remember me by name, the certainly remembered me as a guest. The great thing was this attitude held true from the front desk staff, waitresses in the restaurant even the housekeeper on my floor. Great general manger. Keep it up. Grade A+. Location I used to stay around the park during trips to New York, but for years have moved toward mid town location. Happy made switch, as don’t think for business traveler, anything beats mid-town if need to get around to multiple locations during the trip due to subway access near both Times Square and Grand Central. The Mansfield and its owners certainly are not alone in enjoying the location, as there are perhaps 7-8 hotels on 44th between 5th and 6th. It worked out great. Location A+. Room I was able to get upgraded at check in to a small suite. I enjoyed it. The good outweighs the bad, but I’ll offer both comments. Good points are the room was nicely paneled, larger than most, had two flat screens TV and generally was quite. The bad was that it was much to dark for my liking as was an interior room on light courtyard and did not have accessible temperature controls without calling the engineer. Grade B- Ammenties I’m still amazed in how hotels create their value proposition. In hotels like The Peninsula and Ritz Carleton and others at the upper end many amenities are extra. It seems like the better the hotel the more they feel confident charging for everything. At the lower end every amenity comes with the room. What was terrific about The Mansfield was that it offered a boutique luxury experience and included all amenities in the price. There is a terrific fitness center, better than lots of much bigger hotels, free Wi-Fi, a 24 hour complimentary espresso bar (terrific), a great lobby/library, a nice lounge off the lobby, I believe complimentary breakfast (was for me). Loved them all and used them all. Grade A+ Value Value is the word of the moment and The Mansfield offered tremendous value. It’s not necessary to elaborate, but it would be easy to spend 2 to three times as much for a room in New York and not have as good an experience. Grade A+++ Summary I completely and thoroughly enjoyed The Mansfield. Would stay there again in a minute and probably will again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Our Great Price”
Reviews.Author: black325
Reviews.Content: We received a rate of $159/night through Travelzoo and thought we got a great hotel for a great deal. As previous reviewers have stated, the location is ideal. Before arriving, I was concerned that we would be able to touch the walls from the bed in our petite chambre, but there was no such problem. The area between the bottom of the bed and the bathroom was tight - only one person could pass through. The bathroom was adequate and nicely tiled. My only complaint with the room was that the lone mirror was in the bathroom - nothing in the sleeping area. Since the weather was in the 60s we did not need either the a/c or heat, so we slept comfortably. We had an inside room, and the only noise we could hear was the ocassional closing of our neighbor's door. When the coffee machine broke down, they put out carafes of coffee, decaf & hot water for tea. I was puzzled by some reviewers mention of a continental breakfast - we didn't see anything like that - only the paid breakfast in the dining room. We opted for the diner right down the street. Concierge gave us a good "moderate for NY" priced Italian restaurant suggestion and arranged for a last minute reservation. For the size of the hotel, we were impressed with the 24 hour fitness center, as well. All in all - for the price we paid we had a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Localtion, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: ktkristine
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the Mansfield, and where suppose to stay 4 nights. We checked out after one. The room were so small I'm pretty impressed that they even could fit a double bed in there. The room was uncomfortably hot, and the aircondition made so much noise it was not possible to sleep with it on. The window faced straight into a dark brick and it was not possible to get any fresh air. BUT, the standard on the furniture and decorations is very good, it's very pretty. Looks very romantic and luxurious. But a nice facade is not enough to make a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I'd hoped for and more.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDD
Reviews.Content: This being my first trip to NYC I expected, small cramped outdated rooms and bathroom and rude or indifferent staff. I'm pleased to report that I found none of the above. We were there during the holiday season and 44th St. in this area had a lot of holiday charm with several other boutique hotels and clubs on the street all done up for Christmas. We booked our stay through travelocity and got a huge discount on the rooms (ordinarily $500+, we got for $300+). The location itself is worth it., just off the corner of 5th Ave. and 44th St. As others have commented it was a very easy walk to all of the main destinations (Eg. 5 mins to Times Square, 10 mins to Central Park) There were always cabs available and the subway was less than 5 mins walk away. We arrived early (9am) and were amazed that we were able to check into our rooms and were invited to partake in the free breakfast. (juice, tea, coffee, fresh fruit, pastries, toast & bagels). Both the desk clerk and doorman were helpful and cheerful. Our room was plenty spacious, considering we only planned to use it to sleep. (who goes to NYC to hang out in their hotel room) It was very modern with comtemporary decor, a flat screen tv, Ipod docking station and newly remodled bathroom. The bed and linens were very comfortable and we had a lovely little window seat. It was also spotless. If someone were to ask me to be critical, I found the room a little dark since there was no overhead lighting. The closet was small and there was no dresser. The floors looked pretty, but as they were hardwood, they were a little chilly in the morning. Also, the bathroom door does not have a lock. The elevators were also on the small side. That being said, none of those things were enought to take away from the overall charm and ambiance of staying in an old-world boutique hotel right in downtown NYC. Perhaps if I had paid full price I would have been less impressed. However, on a weekend, three weeks before Christmas you don't expect to get world for a bargain. In particular, I enjoyed the library. I loved the high ceilings and beautiful crown moldings. I sat in the comphy leather club chairs by the fire and wrote my letters home. We also enjoyed a drink (bit overpriced) at the 'M bar' before heading out to the theater. When asked the staff was happy to recommend a sushi restaurant within walking distance. I'd also like to comment that although I didn't use these services, I was happy to read that they were available. They acknowledge that their gym is basic and offer entrance to local gyms if guests wish. They also over an extrememly impressive number of pet friendly services (including transporting your pet from point A to B without you). In response to another users review, we too did encounter housekeeping staff in the elevators and notice the housekeeping cart in the hall, but there really isn't another option. This isn't a holiday inn by the freeway...it's a classic old building, consider it part of the charm! I loved the Mansfield and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “unfortunately lacking”
Reviews.Author: spectator
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Mansfield, the first was in the fall some time ago. This time I was there in winter. The hotel is in a great location, the staff was friendly, the rooms though small are stylish. The bathrooms are large and up to date. So what is my beef? The heating and air conditioning. The first room we were give was ice cold; the second too warm. The only way to regulate the temperature was to turn on the window air conditioner which was both noisy and blew on us. The only window which opened was in the bathroom. Everything else about the place is great but without an adequate HVAC no matter the price - even if they gave us the room, I would decline

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy&Troels
Reviews.Content: Our room was elegantly designed. We had a very clean and comfortable bed and we were delighted with the extra touches - plasma tv, free wifi, lovely aveda toiletries. We stayed in a 'petite room' but it was still a good size for a room in midtown. The room was quiet but that's only if you kept the air-con off. The communal areas - a reading room and a bar - were very classy and the receptionist was very friendly and professional. The location is perfect for exploring uptown and midtown.

Reviews.Title: “one great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubbalicious515
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel 2 times before and we just love it!!! the rooms are very clean, the staff is super friendly and accommodating. It is in a great location-the heart of manhatten. We love it so much that we have decided to spend Valentines day weekend there this weekend, we are looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and the perfect crew”
Reviews.Author: JulianoBrazil
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Mansfiled las New Year´s Eve. The hotel was crowded, but the attention we got from the crew was amazing, since we arreived. Our check in was scheduled for 3 pm, and we arreived from the airport, after 10 hous flying, at 7 am. Alexia and Robert, in the the front desk, received us with a big smile on their faces, and did not rest until we feel confortable with our room (the bedroom we booked was too small, and we choose - paying the difference - another one, bigger). We were aalso llowed to have the complimentary breakfast before start wallking around the city. This is another important point about the Mansfield: the location, in the center of the island near from the north (Central park) and the south. Our stay at the Mansfiel was perfect. All the crew is very nice and gentle, always ready to help with any issue and information you ask for. A tip? look for Alexia and Robert as soon as you arrive!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in an Excellent Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: Pythagoras_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in September 2008. Check-in & Reception: Staff were welcoming, and check-in was smooth and efficient. I was offered a complimentary bottle of water on arrival. I went up to my room to find that my room keys would not work. I had to travel back down to inform the reception that my card reader was faulty. They subsequently called the engineer who was rather intimidating as he checked that I was "able" to figure out how to use the room key correctly. In actual fact, the battery in the card reader needed replacing, so was told to return an hour later (this was at 23.30, and was already quite tired from my journey!!). I then spent my time in the hotel bar, where I felt the staff should have offered me a complimentary coffee or snack whist I waited for them to fix the defective card reader, but was not. Room: The room was larger than I had expected; I had ordered the small room, and given that rooms in New York tend to be small anyway, I was pleasantly surprised. I was not disappointed with the decor; it was contemporary; with tones of mocha and cream. The bathroom was relatively large and well stocked with Aveda products. Despite the pleasing aesthetics of my room, there were a couple of annoyances. My room faced the rear court-yard, so not a great view, but I had expected that. More troubling however was the constant noise from the air conditioning unit (which continued even when I switched it off) which made it hard to sleep on the first night. I however had got used to it by the next night. Also the main parts of the room were clean, however noticed some traces of dust on the skirting and on the ledge of the wardrobe. Dining: Breakfast at the hotel was fabulous; There was a lovely ambience, with background light jazz music playing. There was a limited range of foods (bagels, muffins, fresh fruit juice, toast, cereals, yoghurt coffee etc) however it certainly hit the spot, and staff were very quick to replenish items. A great place to sit back, people watch or read the newspaper over breakfast.
