If you are a solo traveller, it is really easy to chat to fellow hotel guests as this hotel does not have the feel of the larger hotel chains. Location: Really central location, walkable to Grand Central station and Times Sq. The metro is a short walk away. Concerns: Apart from the initial problem with getting into my room (defective card reader), I had a really pleasant stay. I did not want to stay in a large/chain hotel which is very samey (i.e. you could be in any country in the world and not be able to tell until you stepped outside), but this hotel had a lovely ambience, and being a solo traveller wanted a centrally located hotel. In addition, it is really easy to chat to fellow hotel guests at breakfast due to the nature of the lay out of foods and seating etc. Other: The free WiFi is a bonus. Overall had a very pleasant stay at the Mansfield. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a short break to New York. It is probably better for younger couples or independant travellers rather than for a family break.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, good rates, rooms small, some issues...”
Reviews.Author: TransATL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mansfield at least 6-7 times since the 1990s... Generally speaking it's got good rates - around $300 per night for a very very excellent Manhattan location. I just stayed for 4 nights in Jan 2009. Here's my take: * Room 302 is a 'double double' room. Wow, it was small. The bathroom was tiny as well. The shower did not drain well, which is a bit disgusting. This is also a noisy room, as it faces 44th. * I stayed during a cold spell. Still, the room was freezing. The maid brought me an extra blanket. * Good TV / in room movie system, etc. Good electronics all around. * Included breakfast in the lobby is a perfect way to start the day. * The other side of the lobby always has coffee and newspapers. Excellent. * Location at 44th and 5th is perfect. * Staff are friendly. * Room service is limited, but decent. So, all in all, you won't be thrilled with your room. But if you want a $300 a night place near Bryant Park, near 5th, near Grand Central and near Times Square (along with good breakfast and a nice lobby) -- this is as good as any place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: tuxedo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to the UK from Barbados (always an excuse for shopping!) My partners boss gets a prefered rate and on booking the room some months ago we were told we would be upgraded to a suite for the price of the "petit chambre" $249 a night. On arrival from a delayed flight at 2am we were put into a petit chambre even though I had mentioned to the front desk we were in a suite when checking in. The bell boy then found us a suite however it was not made up, We were too tired to wait so settled in to our small but comfortable room.( Rm1011) it was rather noisy but we were so tired we did not care.The next day I felt like a liar as front desk had no notes on our "upgrade" after much ado and emailing the uk, we eventually found the said email and were upgraded to suite 707.The suite was over looking a light well on the 7th floor, It was very quiet and rather dark. The rooms/suite was recently upgraded with "Farrow & Ball" colours ( taupes and black), Aveda products, 2 plasmas,a very expensive mini bar $4 for a kit kat, not to mention $10 for a bottle of Scottish mineral water ( which stupidly I did not read and drank 2 in the middle of the night, expensive!!) Why do they have to have Scottish water I dont know, dont they have mineral water in the US? The bed was a queen and very comfy with good thread count linens.The bathroom was new,good water pressure but VERY small, not suitable for 2 people trying to get ready at the same time! If you want a clean,well situated hotel, mid town this is good.New York is not cheap so expect to pay out for the most basic of accomodation. Not sure I would want to stay in the Petit chambre room. Rooms were too dark with no central light in the sitting room of the suites,other wise it was OK. Complimentary breakfast was adequate, however we prefer a more American affair! and the tea and coffee facilities were a nice touch.Communal areas were nice and the bar had a quite interesting crowd in the evening, if you cant be bothered to go far. For great American food, try Virgils up the street, huge portions we ordered 4 appertizers between 2 hungry people and could not finish them, but fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and (relatively) cheap.....”
Reviews.Author: kylie82
Reviews.Content: I'm not denying the rooms at the Mansfield are small, but I took the view that I wouldn't be spending much time in my room anyway so it didn't matter. I was right. The hotel also has some lovely 'break out' areas, a lounge area with open fire and a bar/dining area playing jazz, so you can escape from your small room and lounge around in comfort. For me, the one thing that this hotel really has going for it, is the location. Just off 5th Avenue. You really couldn't be more centrally placed. I would say it is a perfect location for exploring by foot. We also received complimentary breakfast (I think this is something the hotel lays on each morning for guests) so even if you are not expecting breakfast, you can tuck in to bagels, pastries, cereal and other breakfast items on a daily basis. I would really beg anyone who reads the reviews about the small room size to put it in context- it's NYC afterall, how much time are you going to spend in your room??!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Midtown Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: MGoBlueGrad
Reviews.Content: We won a contest and as such, our prize included three nights at the Mansfield. We were thrilled with the location; we could easily walk to Times Square, the Theater District, the subway stops, Fifth Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, and more. Location by far is the hotel's biggest plus. We also enjoyed the 'better than continental' breakfast of fresh pastries, croissants, bagels, bread, juice, coffee, cereal, yogurt and fresh fruit. Another big plus--the coffee bar in the library. It's available 24 hours a day and every time we came in or left we helped ourselves to a coffee, cappuccino, latte or espresso. Now for the bad news--our first room had serious bed bugs! Thankfully we discovered them shortly after checking in but they were huge and full of blood. We reported the issue to the front desk and the general manager came up to our room to see for himself. He immediately switched us to a suite that we were happy to report was bug-free. The suite was spacious and although it was hard to regulate the temperature, we enjoyed our room. The bed was comfortable and the sheets soft, the Aveda toiletries were nice and the water was always hot with good pressure in the shower. Others commented on the rooms being dark; this is true. There is not a lot of bright lighting either so don't try to read extensively in the room. But it didn't bother us much. Overall, we would stay here again if the price was right. The location was fantastic and the staff was very helpful, all things we valued while in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Millsy1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel comes accross bigger on it's website than it actually is and the room we had was small and basic (it was the standard room) however I was suprised when we arrived that they called it basic themselves and asked if we wanted to upgrade at an additional price. Surely they should let you decide that but I guess it gave me an idea of what to expect. The continental breakfast was a bonus I didn't expect and was nice enough. You have a choice of pastries (including croissants), small muffins (bit dry) toast with jams/marmalade, differnt cereal, and fruit in additional to english breakfast tea! It was a clean place with some nice character and in a very good location (between Fifth Avenue and Time Square). Its about a 10 minute walk to the Empire State Building in one direction, 5 minutes to Time Square and Broadway and around 10-15 minutes to Central Park. The staff were a bit hit and miss, sometimes they couldn't do enough for you and other times they looked like they didn't want to be there (maybe choosing there time to act nice for a tip!). I thought overall that the value was good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pricey disappointment”
Reviews.Author: tthomson53
Reviews.Content: A very disappointing hotel for the price - $559 per night (plus all the NYC taxes) - and impression of boutiquy luxury conveyed on the web site. My wife and I had a Club Suite room on the 3rd floor across from the elevator that was very dark, as the floors, walls and even the venetian blinds are painted flat black, and the lighting was inadequate to compensate. The windows didn't shut tight and leaked cold air, as did the air conditioning unit in the bedroom. There was a blown bulb over the bed, and we were initially told it would take a couple of weeks to order the replacement bulb, but then it was fixed 24 hours later. The bathroom was tiny and had no independent heat (though it did have one of those leaky windows), and the door to the bedroom didn't shut tight. Room service was the only way to get ice, and the ice buckets don't come with tops. Repeated calls for short cocktail glasses resulted first in wine glasses, then martini glasses, then tall, skinny iced tea glasses - I give up! At least the wireless internet is free and fast, and the desk staff was friendly. The library and bar/breakfast room are inviting and atmospheric (free coffee/capuccino and a fire all the time), but the (free) continental breakfast was only average - we've had much better at a Hampton Inn. Next time we'll try the Algonquin or the Iroquois right across and down the street.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennymiller36
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were small, but big enough for 2 people and very cosy. Very clean,plenty towels ,toiletries. Not a great deal of hanging space for clothes,but we found it fine for 4 days stay. Free breakfast muffins ,bread,juice,teas, coffee,cereals,jams,yoghurts,fruit,cheese. use of toaster. complementory hot drinks 24 hrs daily.Free daily newspaper.Location is fantastic 5 minutes from broadway /times square,5th avenue. we went to celebrate my 40th birthday, i would stay here without a doubt next time i,m in new york. Staff are very friendly and helpful,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Staff”
Reviews.Author: unaireland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to the States. Spent two nights in NY in the Mansfield. Bedrooms, while small are more than adequate, Plasma TV, hairdryer, and toiletries supplied. Thinking the complementary breakfast would consist of coffee and a roll, we were very pleasantly surprised, cereals, fruit, juice etc on offer. The staff were very friendly and more than helpful (Alex on reception couldn’t have been more patient). I will definitely return hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “1st night disaster.... but did improve greatly”
Reviews.Author: MollieEire
Reviews.Content: Two of us travelled over 14 hours to be put in a room like a closet - petite wasn't the word... box room was more like it - when we swtiched the light off it was scary - like a black hole and very claustrophobic. When I went to complain upon seeing the room an abrupt, rude and very bad example of customer service at the check in desk said she was busy and it could be 10 minutes before she could sort us out, she eventually sent us with another member of staff to the EXACT same room on a different floor, even the staff member wondered why she did this, he sent us back to our original room to wait until they found another one, we sat waiting, waiting and waiting until in the end we went down and said we are exhausted and need to eat so move us tomorrow. The next day we found that no note had been made of our complaint so I moved it up another notch to a duty manager who couldn't do enough for us and who was extremely pleasant, apologetic and helpful. We ended up in a room 2.5 times the size of our original room at the front of the building, full of light and with all the excellent facilities described on the website. I have to say after our first night of disaster staying in the closet and feeling really ripped off (it is not cheap to stay at the Mansfield) from day two onwards I have nothing but great things to say about the Mansfield, the location is fabulous - it is in the middle of all the wonderful sights of Manhattan, the rooms are spotless and extra comfy, from the breakfast staff to the chamber maids everybody is extremely courteous. The continental breakfast is really nice but you had to be down early to make the most of it, the free coffees etc are a great idea. I would definitely stay at the Mansfield again but I would be very careful about the type of room I was checking in to. A happy visitor to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Cool find!”
Reviews.Author: rhyannonb
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to NYC but were staying a few days before our cruise. Travelzoo.com put out a promotion for the Mansfield (a queen room for $199/night). We took our chances - and were very happily surprised. The room was a decent size (we'd heard NYC hotel rooms are notoriously small) and very nicely appointed. The shower was much bigger than many hotels we've stayed at. The location was awesome - close to Time Square, but not too close to be bothered by noise or traffic. The hotel itself is very quaint. The elevators are European-hotel small, but not unbearable. The free coffee/hot chocolate in the library was a pleasant surprise. It was a nice way to relax after tiring days of sightseeing. The only negative was the noise that came from rain on our window air conditioning unit. It took a while to figure out what the noise was and I guess we were able to tune it out and get a decent night's sleep. Thank goodness it only rained one night. We would definitely stay at The Mansfield wwhen we visit NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical find.”
Reviews.Author: AusMiss
Reviews.Content: Having never been to New York, I dreamt of the 4 Seasons but expected a cupboard. The Mansfield was recommended by the Princeton Club (around the corner) and was absolutely wonderful. The staff were lovely, the common areas were very comfortable (especially the library with complimentary coffee and the well-equipped gym). My room (petite chambre) was the perfect size for a solo traveller with sophisticated decor, great storage, wonderful iPod dock, and stylish bathroom. The room was a little dark but there's not much room for sunlight in NYC! Breakfast was great - albeit a little crowded at times. The staff were very helpful with hints and tips for a solo traveller. The internet access was invaluable. Surprisingly, given the Mansfield's fantastic position and amenities, it was also great value. A magical find in New York. Will definitely be returning for another stay!!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST!!!! No apology for overbooking.”
Reviews.Author: suishi
Reviews.Content: THE WORST experience I ever had. They (intentionally) overbooked and transferred us to a lesser quality sister hotel which was located more than 40 blocks away! Then, the hotel tried to charge us the full (Manfield's) rate! The hotel did not even apologize for overbooking, but told us not to blame them because it was a computer generated error!!!! Unbelievable....

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of The Mansfield Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LestheMess
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience at the Mansfield. First, I was offered a room on a floor with construction that was so tiny and dark gray and depressing--I called reception immediately and asked to change rooms. They offered me another room at an upgrade of $50 a night that looked fine. The second night though I was awoken by a 5 inch cockroach crawling on my back. I changed again. After a few nights in this room, I started to get very itchy bites on my body, but my husband (sleeping in the same bed) did not. Now that I am home I am still scratching and after seeing my doctor, realize I was bitten by bed bugs! Please advise others not to stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: AussieGoGirl
Reviews.Content: We had booked in at another hotel for four out of five nights of our stay in NYC, but were without accommodation for one night so we chose the Mansfield. The room was a petite so we did not have high expectations for space. It was minuscule, with barely enough room to open our bags but the space was very well utilised. The fittings were very stylish and there was complimentary wifi which was a bonus. The staff were industrious and attentive, and complimentary continental breakfast was a very nice surprise. The room was very dark, and at at the back of the building so you could hear everything going on in the near by buildings, especially the jackhammer which started up at 8am - but that was not the hotel's fault. I experienced an acute allergic reaction overnight (I'm quite sensitive to moulds and dust mites), which did not go away until we checked out the following day. I cannot say for sure that it was a problem with the hotel, but it was much much worse when I was in the room and subsided when I left the room. Overall a good hotel right in the centre of where the action is, albeit more than a bit squashy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpaulmsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield in July and had a fantastic time! The staff was great, and upgraded our room so that we could be near friends. The rooms were very nice, recently remodeled. We were in a suite, which in NYC is hard to come by and definitely not available at the price we paid. Not huge, but there are not a lot of large rooms in NYC. They have a free breakfast in the morning and a free espresso bar that is open all day long. We also loved the library downstairs, which is a great place to sit and have a cup of coffee or water if you are not ready to go up to the room. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here if you want a good nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl24
Reviews.Content: On the face of it, The Mansfield looks lovely. However I found the place to be the noisiest hotel I've stayed in. The air con is just unbelievably loud - I stayed in two different rooms (after having to practically beg to be moved after having zero sleep and a toilet that didn't flush the first night). The rooms provide no insulation from the road noise (I know this is NYC but I don't expect to pay $300 and it sound like i am sleeping in the middle of the road when I need to be in the office at 7am). The beds are very uncomfortable and the place is just cheaply renovated... the doors don't fit properly so they don't shut, you can't fit in the bathroom and close the door. On the plus side, the complimentary breakfast and the gym are very nice and if you caught the right member of staff on duty they were helpful. I'd suggest trying somewhere else if you plan on having any sleep while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “its not the shoreham but it'll do nicely”
Reviews.Author: vernon2005
Reviews.Content: As a NY business traveller we had a long term business contract with the sister hotel the shoreham. However financial needs must, and as a company we decided to try the cheaper option of the mansfield ... and its not bad at all! Obviously I had my reservations courtesy of really feeling swish in the shoreham ... however as a slightly cheaper option this is much better than expected! On check in i decided the room wasnt big enough and they happily moved me to something i prefered within the class of room I booked. The people at reception were really helpful. We also had a power cut when i was there which was handled extremely well, with good humour, and the staff were extremely capable in the face of adversity. The rooms are comfortable and not as noisy as I've stayed in around the area, the bathrooms are tiny, but hey its all clean and functional. To be quite honest the free breakfast was a great plus and realistically the location is actually superb. To surmise this is a really practical hotel in a good location, it aint the shoreham but I've already booked a new stay for september and I'm looking very much forward to it. I'm terribly picky and it works for me - I would take that as a huge handshake!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- will stay again”
Reviews.Author: sevenrules
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay over the 4th of July weekend. Location: Couldn't ask for a better location, as it is a couple blocks from Times Square and just off 5th avenue. It's close enough to the madness but located on a fairly quiet street ensuring peace when trying to sleep. Easily walkable to the touristy places in midtown and a short subway ride to the more interesting places in NYC. Staff: They were great. Anything we asked of them was quickly done and they were very pleasant. The bar staff was great as well. Hotel/Room: Lobby, bar and library were very nice. Felt like a very upscale hotel but the attitude of the service was down to earth and friendly. Stayed in the petite chambre room which was very nice but also very small. This was our first time in NYC so I imagine the tiny rooms are the norm. The room size, although small, wasn't uncomfortable or claustrophobic at all. The bed was pretty good and the pillows were great. There was a clock/radio with ipod hookup which was nice. The TV's were Dell brand with great picture and sound. Small closet and fairly small bathroom, but big enough to fit our needs. We had a view of nothing which was good and bad. we looked into the alleyway and it was fairly dark at all hours of the day. As a result, the room was very dark in the morning (which I like) and it was also very quiet due to the location. Front rooms may not be quite as quiet, nor as dark, but would have a decent view of the street. Bar: The bar was great, but pretty expensive. $15 martinis and $7 beers seemed a bit expensive, but NYC is an expensive city. Overall we were very happy with our stay and when we visit NYC again we plan on staying at the Mansfield. We paid ~170 per night which we felt was a good deal in comparison to other similarly priced NYC hotels we looked at. Had we paid $350, as some others have, I may not have been as pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New York”
Reviews.Author: centralparklover
Reviews.Content: We booked The Mansfield Hotel, Manhattan after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. It was everything that we had hoped for and more. The reception staff were very accommodating, telling us about the free complimentary breakfast every morning, free use of the internet. We also had free bottles of fresh water in our room every day. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and helped us to sort out a car for our return journey back to the airport. The laundry staff were also really nice. We stayed in the Petite Chambre which was more than suitable for our needs as we only used it to sleep in. It was kept clean by the laundry staff every day. The location of the hotel, just down the road from Times Square, was spot on. We were central for everything, to catching The Metro to go Down Town or hopping on the open top bus tour (which is a must to see Down Town and Up Town). Another 'must do' is to go on a helicopter ride. It is an experience well worth doing as you see New York from a totally differnt perspective, which is truly amazing. Central Park was about 20 minutes walk up the road and was brilliant. We could have spent days in there. On our of days there, we heard Sheryl Crow practising in concert for that night, so went back later in the evening and joined in with other people in the Park that hadn't got tickets, but could hear her so clear. It was brilliant and unexpected. We also saw the Naked Cowboy on the last day in Times Square, which made my day. I wouldn't want to take young children to New York as it is a very busy city, nobody seems to sleep and the roads are quite manic (but you do get use to crossing the roads eventually).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pardytours
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5 Night stay in New York after booking on expedia. We flew from Manchester, England direct with Delta who i went online with to change our allotted seats ( for some reason we were,nt sat together but this was ammended instantly on the Delta web site), transfers were also booked via expedia and these workwell and deffinatley worth the money as the traffic is murder and took an hour each way. The hotel was clean and modern with the free breakfeast a nice touch and served till 10am, it is only a continental type breakfeast but will set you up for the day ( could do with investing with a new toaster). The hotel was kept clean at all times with sheets and towels changed daily. The air con was noisey but is,nt it always. The room we stayed in was small but thats what you get in New york unless you pay big bucks, we where very happy with the room as we spent most of the time out and about. The room had a safe but could have benifited from a larger mirror than just the shaving mirror in the bathroom. The location of the hotel was great in walking distance of all the mid town attractions and close to several subway stations. I would deffinatley recommend this hotel to any sight seeing tourist travelling from the UK like myself. Tip. if you go to Macy's or Bloomingdales go to the Visitors desk were upon proof of being tourist you will be given an 11% discount card on all purchases

Reviews.Title: “The perfect NY Experience”
Reviews.Author: matslaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I LOVED this place! From the valet to the front desk personnel, the staff here will do what they can to make your stay comfortable. Yes, the rooms are little more than a bed, and bath. We did have a room at the back of the hotel but we didn't have any problem with sound at all. The complimentary breakfast is 'Continental' but it is good enough to get you going. With the myriad of street carts and cafes around NY City, who in their right mind would waste precious calories on a FREE breakfast anyway? I loved the coffee bar , my wife and I are coffee snobs, but loved the espresso machine in the library. We have stayed at many of the finer (our last stay a few years ago was at The Palace,) and even boutique hotels in NYC and I would put the service at this hotel against any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but very central to all sites ie times square”
Reviews.Author: welshmanWales
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this hotel in november 2007. It's rooms are small,but the hotel is quiet and central to times square and central park. We loved our stay at the mansfield hotel and plan on going back soon! The rooms have flat tv on wall and are all modern decorated,the hotel is clean and nice breakfast area. Also the staff are friendly and helpful. Would highly recommeded this and would rate it a mid/high rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: up_dude
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Mansfield treated my friends and I as if we were royalty. What a way to spend a vacation!!!! The location is awesome, walking distance to just about everything we wanted to do in the city. You need to try the Blueberry Martini!!!! I need to learn how to make this for the upcoming summer patio parties. I look forward to returning and have already recommended it to family and friends. Thanks for everything!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mansfield was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMini_Mom
Reviews.Content: This was my first vacation in NYC and found the Mansfield to be in the perfect location. Within walking distance of so many places we wanted to see. Very beautiful mixture of almost certury old architecture and modern decor! The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful! Loved them all! Enjoyed a wonderful breakfast each morning. And loved our afternoon latte each afternoon in the "library!" Blueberry martini was absolutely wonderful in the evening. Along with delicious dinner! And again the staff was excellent! Would highly recommend this hotel...and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LinusL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Mansfield and really enjoyed everything about it. I was in a king room on the street side. Didn't find the noise to be unlike other NY hotels I've stayed in. The bathroom was small, but modern and the bed was very comfortable (and I have lower back problems, so I'm super picky about hotel beds). The staff was very welcoming and really went out of their way to make my stay as comfortable and easy as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: Allforart
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some charm. No doubt about that. The first floor is sort of tony chic. It's well located near/in the theater district and the star of the show we had gone down to see (Gypsy) was actually having coffee in the bar/breakfast room Saturday morning. BUT the rooms are really awful. Nice Italian bedding does not make up for uncomfortable beds, black and brown trim everywhere does more to depress than upscale. The first room we were sent to was so small we couldn't walk around the bed. The woman at the front desk (overextended-we waited 35 minutes to check in although we were given bottles of water) said it was a king room. It was a king bed in a child size study. Tiny bath windowless closet thing. We tried to change rooms, and called the front desk, but the woman was "very busy" and had no time to see (she was vocally irritated) if she could offer an alternative. An hour and a half and one whole anxiety attack later, she moved us upstairs to a suite-two adjoining rooms with a dark old sofa and black brown decor and a marginally bigger bath (actually had tub). Other folks like concierge and door man were cordial. The library is neat. The bar is fun, but I'd never book a room in this hotel again. Air conditioners in both rooms' windows in our second location controlled for noise from the street. We left after one night and luxuriated (by comparison) on a friend's blow up bed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 204”
Reviews.Author: Kinkorox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located and the decor is really very nice. Indeed the public spaces -- the bar and library -- are wonderful. The room we stayed in -- 204 -- is, however, the worst hotel room we have ever slept in (including a truck stop in Nebraska). Not because of the appointments, which were nice, but because of the unbelievable smells coming from the ventilation system and the genuinely extreme street noise (we thought the police car was in our room). I am not willing to write the hotel off -- but people reserving there should be careful to avoid this particular, truly awful, room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: happycamper078
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at the Mansfield and had a great time. Really good location, small rooms but that was to be expected and seems to be the norm for NYC. We were a bit hesitrant when we arrived and found that our minibar still had the previous guiest's food in it but that was straightened up very quickly and the rest of the week went without any hiccups. The staff were very helpful and doormen always willing to give aqdvice and have a chat. Snug room with free coffee was really nice to sit in after a long day round Manhattan. I thought it was expensive but again that seems to be the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: BlissfulTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room for business and was shocked by the size...at over $350 a night! I could barely squeeze around the bed. Basically this hotel was probably once a flop house...now jazzed up with a modern decor. But some things you just can't hide...Instead of a side table I had a tiny corner sink beside the bed. The bath "room" was so small I couldn't close the door when I was sitting on the toilet because the door would hit my knees...I'm sure it was once a closet. The next night I moved to a twin room, which was much better and a more comfortable size.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: tntcyclist
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at The Mansfield. Just a couple blocks from the action of Times Square, the location is great. This is a small "boutique" hotel, so if you are looking for a grand experience consider a chain. Front desk staff very friendly and professional. Public rooms clean and comfortable. 24 hour self service coffee bar (espresso/cappucino) was a nice plus. The room we stayed in was quite small, but very clean and had everything we needed. (I didn't go to NYC to stay in my hotel room anyway!) Small restaurant and bar on site. Clean, classy and comfortable! I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ZoeWeb
Reviews.Content: We had read some reviews on The Mansfield before our honeymoon and was a little apprehensive about staying there. However, once there these fears subsided as we quickly realised that this was a lovely hotel. Our room wasn't huge but was big enough for 2. It had a lovely bathroom, that again was quite small. However we was in New York what would we need a huge room and bathroom for? It was cleaned on a daily basis with fresh towels and linen. We found the location perfect, a couple of blocks from Times Square and 5th Avenue was at the end of our street. The staff were friendly and helpful, we had complimentary breakfast everyday which we were told about on our arrival. This was lovely and enough to start your busy day on. The hotel had a restaraunt in the evening, the food here was reasonably priced and very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel and I know that on our next trip to New York we wouldn't hesitate in booking this hotel! (One minor problem was it was very hot in our room due to not being able to turn the heating down, once we spoke to the front desk this was promptly sorted.)

Reviews.Title: “what a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: chesh2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 6 days in this fab city, where we stayed at the mansfield. Having read some of the reviews on here we were a bit weary to say the least!! The moment we walked into the foyer we were put at ease, lovely comfy snug with a roaring fire, and free coffee and tea machine. The receptionist was so friendly and upgraded our room straight away, the room or should I say rooms were great and not what we were expecting, the bathroom was a little on the small side but clean and perfectly formed. My only critisism of the room was that there was no reall storage for clothes, a very small closet and no drawer space but apart from that it was great. Breakfast was basic but fresh and tasty, lots of pastrys and fruits aswell as toast and cereals, juice and coffee what more do you want for free!!! The location was excellent, slap bang in the middle of everything located on a lovely street with plenty of bars and restaurants. All in all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: LP2001
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield on 44th is a great NYC hotel. The service was great and it wasn't as crowded as a lot of the other hotels tend to get in NYC. Naturally, the rooms are small, but they are clean and comfortable. We had a parlor king which was still small, but we had a fridge, huge bed and flat screen tv. My husband had pre-arranged for some wine and a basket of goodies to be supplied in the room, which they were and it was a nice assortment. My biggest complaint would be that the sink was VERY small in our bathroom. I couldn't wash my face at night w/o getting water all over the floor. I have never used such a small sink! The shower was ample size with a nice big shower head and Aveda products. The rooms are not carpeted, rather they have the old wood floors and the original heaters. It seems old fashioned, but they have done a nice job making it modern. We would definitely stay here again. Great location, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtravellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Manfield over the Christmas period and were really impressed with this hotel and particularly the service. Having read the TripAdvisor reviews and being aware of the air conditioning noise problem, we requested a move straight away when we were allocated to a noisy room. This was not a problem (although I felt like a very fussy tourist!) and we were actually given an upgraded room which was of a reasonable size! We found the room a bit hot at night but found that this was easily solved by opening the window an inch or so. We were impressed by the small thoughtful touches at the Mansfield - 2 bottles of water supplied in the room every day, the coffee machine in the lovely lounge, breakfast, (good bagels!) free internet access and helpful concierge (with a good supply of bandaids for sore feet!) Thoroughly recommended. Great location. We would certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but beware”
Reviews.Author: pollybuckland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Mansfield but it wasn't without some caution. If you're planning a trip request a room at the front of the hotel or the centre. Rooms at the back overlook noisy aircon that is not really acceptable and will keep you awake. The rooms are small too but this is New York and they are done out nicely so it didn't bother us. There are lots of pluses though. The staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast is basic but good, the lounge and the bar were bonuses and we enjoyed both, room service was good, and generally we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “They make holiday inn look like heaven”
Reviews.Author: yaya878
Reviews.Content: This hotel might look nice but its in bad shape. If you stay in the back be prepared to be up all night because of loud generators. The rooms are old so they have window AC units, which you'll need in winter cuz the heat is at 90. But the AC units are from the 80s and are loud and cheap. The bathrooms are nice, but my gym had better hairdryers available. The free "breakfast" was so sad. Bread and box cereals reminiscent of camping trips again from the 80s. beyond that they charged my card twice 300 for this experience and have yet to refund it. I called two managers and the general managers about it and yet no one seems to think that double charging me 300 is important. Bottom line, theres a comfort in two streets up and its a better deal, better service, better rooms, better breakfast for sure. and half the money. its closer to time square for tourists and its great for business stays smack in the middle of midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Flawed boutique that's a big-hearted home from home”
Reviews.Author: Traveller630
Reviews.Content: Our stay stay didn't start well but it just got better and better and by the time we left we were sorry to go. Our tiny but pricey room had a comedy bathroom whose toilet wouldn't flush and whose bathplug wouldn't... well, plug the bath. This we discovered after a fitful night thanks to the room's noisy airconditioning. Daybreak found me at the hotel's reception - unwashed and upset. But the hotel's Guest Service Agent (Irasel Bueno) showed she cared and immediately transferred us to a better room (after checking it for mechanical failures) at the same price. And when she found out we were returning later in the week for our wedding anniversary we were immediately offered a complimentary upgrade to a suite for our special night. Not only that, but on requesting a late check-out once again the Mansfield showed us its big-heartedness and allowed us to stay for the day for free. Really good things about The Mansfield Hotel: the location is terrific - midtown between the theatres and grand central station the buffet breakfast is an immensely relaxed and casual affair (no need for whispered conversations as in some pricey hotels) and it's lovely sitting by the window reading the paper and eating the hotel's elicious pastries, watching the world go by. There's a really cool 'library' with open log fire where you can relax after the theatre The rooms are clean and the service is excellent - caring but not intrusive. It was at the Mansfield that I learned of the generosity of New Yorkers. Really naff things about The Mansfield Hotel: The smallest rooms are incredibly small and the black and beige decor makes them feel even smaller. Also, I was told that none of the hotel's wardrobes can hold a full length garment. Most don't even have a coat hook. The air-conditioning can be noisy. I would suggest they include complimentary ear-plugs along with free toiletries as a temporary measure until they put this right. It's expensive - but then isn't everywhere in New York?

Reviews.Title: “Choose Another!”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler7
Reviews.Content: Two nights at the Mansfield while on business. This is a hotel which appears to have been converted from an apartment building. VERY small rooms, even for New York. Rooms and hallways are very dark, very old and the housekeeping could use a primer on how to clean a hotel room. Many of the guests raised concern about the lack of heat in the rooms (no dedicated heating systems) and at 20 degrees outside, you can bet those romms got cold!!!! The lounge staff was OK, as were the bellmen. A frequent business travel, I will personally not choose this hotel again. Better accomodations, front desk staff and value can easilly be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent at The Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: bostonteagirl
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for visiting the Big Apple but with the comforts of home. I absolutely love the 24 hour coffee/tea/espresso bar housed in the cozy library - with a working fireplace! Utterly charming and romantic. Staff couldn't have been more helpful or accommodating and the location is right in the heart of everything the city has to offer......and when you need to decompress this hotel offers a great bar and restaurant - on the 1st night I stayed (Tuesday) they had a jazz band and it was packed to the rafters. Rooms were always clean and well heated and the concierge never hesitated to give me directions to a shop or hail a cab for me. Love the added touch of the Italian water at the front desk. Will definitely stay here on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype, its more like Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: CityHopper007
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype, we've just returned from New York. Mansfield hotel is way over priced for what you get, with unhelpful and uninterested staff, poorly maintained rooms and lacklustre facilities. Aging lifts were broken two of the days we visited, phone in room didn't work, shutters on windows (curtains would have been nice) didn't work, and staff wholy uninterested and unproffessional. Business centre is actually 2 pc's in a cubby hole behind reception, the gym is actually a couple of treadmills and some weights, and the rooms are small, pokey and cold. Don't believe the flashy website, there are a couple of night clubs opposite the front of the hotel, so expect to be woken up when they kick out, and the rear of the hotel overlooks air conditioning units from the next door restaurant, so expect noise. Overall, its too overpriced for what you get, the only thing going for it is location - its right at the centre of all the action, Times Square, 5th Avenue etc just 5 min walk away. You're paying top end prices for an average hotel, very disapointing. Stay at Sofitel or Algonquin... they're on the same street and will give you value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice veneer--not worth it”
Reviews.Author: KateOK
Reviews.Content: I've been writing and reading Trip for years. You have always helped me out. I hope I can do the same with this review...and save someone from throwing away their money on this hotel. Ahh...the Mansfield... Great website design. But, please, please...don't believe all the hype. It also looks good when you drive up. The hotel is in a great location, right near Time Square and the theater district. We booked two rooms , and they were $600 per room per night. Here is what we got & didn't get. They 'upgraded' both my husband and I and our two children to suites next to one another. Ok. Nice. Then we get to the rooms. These also looked nice. Small . But, clean, urban, boutique-hotel-ish. Our heat never worked. We called. We called. The engineer came. Still didn't work. The bathroom is stupid in design. You actually cannot wash your face or lean into the sink--we kept hitting our head on the shelf above it. It was like some silly TV sitcom happening over and over again. There was always, trash and dirty towels and maids carts in the halls. Look up at the ceiling in the hall, and there are wires everywhere, just hanging down, or jammed thoughtlessly between plasterboard facades. The paint was roughshod. The water was never hot. The windows were drafty and still had the little A/C units in the windows. No closet.---Actually, the bathroom, that was the size of a closet, with loose french doors that never closed properly. We asked for duvets for the bed..since it was quite chilly with no heat.-- Oh, and these rooms attempt to be so cutting-edge that there are only sheets and a strip of material at the bottom of the bed. We got these ugly pilly, beige blankets that you might hand out in a college dorm or government facility. The breakfast, which was included, was in the bar, very dark. They offered little boxes of cereal, some apples and oranges, instant coffee and tea bags.... I felt as if I had booked a Holiday-Inn Express breakfast. We ate breakfast around the corner . The Mansfield is certainly not a hotel for $600 per night. The flatscreen TV's were nice. The front desk was polite. BUT This is not a four-star hotel. This is a three star that someone bought, slapped a coat of paint on, bought cheap brown and beige furniture and tried to make it look chic. My husband is from Manhattan and we travel here all the time. Although we have stayed at the Mandarin, The Plaza, Athenee.. we weren't expecting a five -star this time. But, this hotel ---one should not be deceived by it's website.. You can find better in NYC for these prices. It's ok as a hotel but it is overpriced for what we got! Look somewhere else for this kind of money. You can find better. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Really great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mercury80h
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. The rooms are pretty small but I doubt you could get much more for your money in this area. They provide everything you need including a seemingly endless supply of free bottled water. Fantastic tv in the room also. The bar has a nice ambience with live jazz most nights but unfortunately the food is slightly underwhelming. To be honest though, if you want to go to New York to eat in your own hotel, you're probably going to the wrong city..

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ciaoife63
Reviews.Content: Extremely dissappointed with our stay in this hotel. This is the first time I have been exercised enough about a hotel stay to go to the bother of writing a review. We were upgraded to a 'suite' which you could not swing a cat in. The room received absolutely no light and was decorated in dark colours so the result was depressing to say the least. The staff were not friendly and the breakfast amounts to a bagel which you toast yourself....not exactly what you expect for the price of the room. This hotel was expensive even by NYC standards and you don't get anything more for your money. Our friends stayed in the New Yorker and got twice the room size for half the price...and they had an a quality diner in the hotel! The Mansfield is a complete rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: annual_tourist
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a long weekend in New York for our wedding anniversary and we stayed at the mansfield for 3 nights. It ticked all the right boxes and is close to all the major sights, Times Square, Grand Central, Empire State and Chrysler. The hotel staff were great and helped us organise a few things, including a helicopter ride and somewhere special to eat on our anniversary. The hotel is an old boutique style hotel which also meant the air conditioning was old and noisy but other than that our room was clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: travellers016
Reviews.Content: We thought that the Mansfield was superb. We've literally just returned on the 17 September. The hotel was undergoing renovations to modernise certain parts, but we certainly didnt experience any problems with this. The rooms are small, but they were perfect for what we wanted - sleeping and dropping off shopping. The rooms were of a high standard and can be seen on the tripadvisor website. The hotel are also very good at keeping the rooms clean and we experienced no problems. Upon arrival we were informed about breakfast, their facilities which included the gym, in fact the one day the gym was out of use, we received a letter to say we could use the gym over the road. Breakfast was simple but just what we required - cereals, bagels, yoghurts, fresh fruit and hot /cold drinks. The hotel is in a great location and less than 10 minutes walk from Times Square. The concierge and porter were always very friendly, and always went out of their way to help us with our first visit. We definitely would recommend this hotel to all and will be revisiting next year and staying at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: windycitygal
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY frequently for business and most often stay at The Dylan, The Morgan's or the Roosevelt -- the latter only if the first two are unavailable. I decided to research something different for this trip because I want to have more small-hotel options. I found The Mansfield online and after checking out reviews on this website, decided to go for it. It was a bit of a risk because I was taking a client in to town as well. I thought it was a delightful hotel and I'll definitely stay there again. Although small (what rooms aren't in NY?), I thought it was nice. Even the narrow bathroom worked for me. I particularly liked the dark wooden floors in my room. Carpet in NY hotel rooms always seems very dirty. I was worried the wooden floors could mean a noisy stay but that wasn't my experience at all. I had a peaceful nights' sleep, but didn't have to worry about street noise because my room faced another building. I particularly liked the workout room. It was larger than I expected, had a nice amount of equipment for the size of the hotel, and it was clean. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Sub-Par”
Reviews.Author: An_Avid_Traveler_72
Reviews.Content: I booked this business stay on Hotwire. Previous to this, I had never had a negative experience using this site. The Mansfield is tired and dirty and is completely misrepresented by its web site. The corners of the dark rooms are lined with dust balls, the hallways, mirrors and walls in the common areas filthy. I can tolerate small rooms, but the darkness is a problem as are the closets. There are no full-length areas to hang suits etc. and no irons or ironing boards to repair the damage done from hanging badly all week. The staff didn't bother to mention to me upon check in that breakfast is included in my stay, nor tell me where the gym was located. There were many other problems with my stay, but you can get the idea. The bottom line: if I hadn't prepaid for this stay, I would have checked out immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!! Great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: flash97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple over Labor Day weekend. It was a wonderful experience. We only paid $199 per night!!! As expected at a boutique hotel, the rooms are very small, but unless you are planning on spending most of your time in the hotel room, no big deal. The room had a very comfortable bed with nice linens, an Ipod dock, flat sceen TV and a pretty little bathroom (with AVEDA products)!!!!! They have bottled water, tea and coffee for their guests any time. We loved the library (working fireplace) where you can read the paper, talk and have coffee. The bar is a nice atmosphere. They offer a free continental breakfast with your stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Our friends had a noisy room b/c of road construction and they quickly moved them the next day. I would definitely stay here again. Great location, very close to Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Fred and Ginger must have stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: ociwoman
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in room 607 on August 30, 2007 for one night in order to attend a concert in Times Square. We booked through Hotel Chatter and got an INCREDIBLE deal : $189 for the Parlour Room! Regular rate is over $300 so we were extremely pleased. The suite was gorgeous with separate parlour area with safa-bed, a bay window with a window seat, hard wood floors, 2 plasma TVs, 2 air conditioners (worked very well but were noisy) with a set of stunning etched glass doors that separated the parlour from the bedroom. The bedding and bathroom amenities (AVEDA!) were lush and plentiful. The bathroom wasn't huge but there was just enough space for us. Water pressure excellent. What else? Free continental breakfast, free 24 hour coffee, free bottled water, free internet, a beautiful library and .... the list goes on. A true boutique hotel. I stay in hotels about 150 nights per year for business and have lots of high end hotels to compare the Manfield to. I have become quite fussy about quality, cleanliness, comfort and service (when you're on the road that much, this becomes important). By far, the Mansfield has impressed me the most in all of my travels. A week-end in NYC must include a stay at this establishment. We loved it and we will be back - often!

Reviews.Title: “Great "Boutique" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ribena001
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Mansfield on 3rd May for 4 nights. First room was not supposed to be allocated to us but we were swiftly moved to the 9th floor. Staff were friendly and a complimentary breakfast was an "added" bonus to a very clean and comfortable hotel. The drinks in the bar were a little pricey. Complimentary coffee machine was a great bonus because I love my coffee and it was free! If you're a tea drinker the Mansfield provided an assortment of tea from herbal to earl grey (but I'm not a tea drinker but it was a plus for my partner). Good location too. We walked 22 blocks to Central Park and took a horse and carriage. In the opposite direction 10 blocks to Empire State building (best time to go is at 10.30 pm - no crowds). This was my 2nd trip to NY and my partners first trip which he enjoyed and thought NY was less crowded than all the advertisements! One of my holiday highlights was whilst sitting in the lounge at the Mansfield having a coffee after walking around little Italy and Chinatown for five hours, then the Night Tour Bus trip and then the Empire State all in one day, I was asked for my autograph! I was mistaken to look like a famous actress but I never thought to ask who and merrily signed "best wishes" on a napkin :-) My partner was trying to see and do it all in four days and its just impossible but it was a great trip. The hotel even arranged for a helicopter tour of the Big Apple which I arranged as a surprise for my partners Birthday and he had no idea where we were going until we reached the helicopter Pad. The Mansfield were very good in meeting our needs. Only downside is we never got to watch any American TV because the reception was awful (but whose on holiday to watch TV) but would have been nice to capture the news. Overall a good hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in Central NYC”
Reviews.Author: 1fizzy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location for Midtown NYC, in a quiet street (for New York) but only 1 minute's walk from 5th Ave. & 5 mins walk from Broadway & theatres. Our Standard room was small but okay - plasma TV on wall, small hanging closet with safe, minibar, etc. Bathroom was v. small (only as long as the bath & wide enough to fit the toilet as well). The wash basin was just next to it & had very little room to put anything. The room was newly refurbished & they could have made better use of the space. However it was very clean & housekeeping staff very pleasant. There is wireless internet available in the rooms, but in our room it was a poor signal & intermittent. There is an internet room near the lobby as well, plus a gym & a reading room with 24hr fresh coffee & tea facilities. The included complimentary continental breakfast was excellent! All staff were friendly, helpful & knowledgeable. We found this hotel a great location to be able to drop in & out of during our sight-seeing activities. It's a little gem in central NYC, & we would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “European without the smokers”
Reviews.Author: TravelNYSF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times on business. The locaton can't be beat, the price is usually very reasonable. Look--if you want a big room, then get ready to spend big bucks, this is New York. With that said--the Mansifeld's rooms are small. Great for one, great for two--who travel well together. These are really rooms for sleeping and watching TV, if youw ant to lounge around the room--go to the HIlton or spend $600 a night. The service is generally good, the bar is a scene (which I'm not in to). Its a little rough aounrd the edges at times--but then again, for the neighborhood and the price, a bargain. REquest rooms that are not across from the elevator. IF you don't like the breakfast, go to Starbucks (two within one block) or the coffee shop at the corner. Rooms have all new HD flat screens, new window ACs for summer. Come, enjoy and for all you whiners...clearly you don't know what costs what in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: walker5658
Reviews.Content: Got here from the UK and was told the room I had pre-booked was no longer available. They sent me to another hotel, 12 blocks north and gave me $7 for a cab fare which cost me $9. Not impressed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcGonagall
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Mansfield about 3 times now, and the greatest thing is the neighborhood, full of restaurants, shops, basically everything I need. Rooms are not really big but I honestly do not spend much time there. Comfy bed, overall clean. Most rooms are a bit aged, and not always very quiet. Personnel all very kind. Bkfst used to be complimentary (still is?) and good. They have a decent price for what you get, I'll return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Buttonsandbows
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 7 night break at this hotel with my daughter. Excellent location between 5th and 6th Street. Round the corner from Times Square. 10 min. walk to bus station. Accommodation excellent, great buffet breakfast - more than we had expected. Complimentary bottled water, tea, coffee going all day/night. Rooms recently refurbished - clean and comfortable. Plasma TV screens, complimentary safe. Fridge with drinks to purchase if one wished. Staff very helpful. For the location and comfort, we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, but small.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is one of those typical New York hotels with rooms so small you have to step into the hallway to change your mind. However, it's also rather charming. The decor is a bit trendy, with a Jayne Manfield theme (no surprise given the name). The bar is nice, though a bit pricey (even for NYC), but the in-lobby library with complimentary coffee is a nice touch. It is convenient to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal, the New York Public Library, one of the Soup Nazi's stores, and other attractions, but there are places I like better for about the same rate, such as the Lucerne on the Upper West Side. But if you want to be close (but not TOO close) to Times Square, the Mansfield could fill the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Charm, Modern Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghCori
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is a sweet, compact boutique hotel. The lobby is simple, yet elegant and its clear measures were taken to maintain the Mansfield’s historic charm while modernizing its facilities. The library, in the front of the lobby, was a warm and cozy place to relax while enjoying the complimentary coffee and cappuccino, provided 24 hours a day. The staff we encountered was attentive, though no one blew me out of the water with their graciousness. The elevators were tight so we often took the back stairs which led almost directly to the teeny hallway to our room on the 2nd floor. The first thing that hit me was the smell of paint. The hallway was being redecorated and it was sanded, taped, and plastered, but never worked on during our stay. Luckily, the paint smell did not emanate our room. The room was a matchbox- but after my first trip to NYC I discovered that space is at a minimum absolutely everywhere. Accommodations were well appointed, if small, and the room had just about everything I would need for a short stay. Don’t intend to unpack much, as there are only 2 drawers and a half dozen hangers in the closet. The light in the room was pretty bad. It made it difficult to get ready in the evening and the hair dryer in the room was palm-sized. The flat-screen tv was wonderful and the bed was super comfy. Full length mirror was a nice touch. And the complimentary bath products were Aveda, which I appreciated. At our request an iron and board were brought to our room. Mini bar was outrageous and I heard someone mention a $7 charge for ice. Needless to say, we drank our drinks at room temperature all weekend. To sum it up – fantastic location, pretty historic hotel. I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this hotel after getting a great rate through Travelzoo.It's in a great location and we liked it a lot.Our room was newly refurbished (some are still in the process), and had a comfy bed and bedding, plasma TV,nice bathroom and shower, complimentary bottled water and free wireless internet. There was an included breakfast from 7-10, as well as a cappuccino/latte/coffee machine available 24/7. If you don't get enough excercise from walking around the city, there is a well equipped gym as well! The only negatives were that there was no bedside table on one side of the bed even though there was room, and the only mirror in the room was the small bathroom mirror, and that one had poor lighting. These were only minor inconveniences, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: HarryRCT
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here with friends from Boston after taking the train in from CT. The location worked out well for us as it is such a short walk from Grand Central terminal. The location was central to Times Square, good dining selections and the subway. While small, the rooms are more than adequate, especially for short stays. There are a couple of things that could be improved, like the lighting in the bathroom and the lack of a nightstand on one side of the bed. There are also nice touches, like the flat screen TV and a new style radio that also had an I-Pod port in it. The front desk staff were very helpful and the included continental breakfast adequate. There is coffee and cappuccino available all day from a machine, but no milk available for the coffee selection. There gym is small but very nice with all new equipment. We were able to do our check-in paperwork early in the morning and check our luggage so as to be able to enjoy the 75* day that awaited us. We didn't actually get back to the hotel until 9:30 or so and our rooms awaited us. After checking out they held our luggage the entire day until we were ready to leave the area for Grand Central and our ride home. I would definitely stay here again if it stays competitively priced.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not staying again.”
Reviews.Author: MNNTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning in room. Not too bad since it was a bit chilly out, but being on the second floor, it was a constant choice between street noise and smell of Indian place across the street or stuffy room with maids/guests banging doors. Service was nice but not very professional. The library is very small and filled the entire time I was there. Had to stay there for business, would not choose it again. No doorman and the doors are heavy. It is a cute little european style hotel (small elevators, cramped hallways) that could be much better if the little details like unpainted plaster repairs on the wall by the elevator were taken care of and the staff better trained.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: JWThornton
Reviews.Content: We were greeted very pleasantly by a nice young lady at the front desk when we arrived. Since we had booked through priceline, we were not sure what the hotel would be like. Boy were we surprised. We were able to negotiate an upgrade at a very reasonable price. This room dwarfed the one that my brother was staying in at another hotel in the same area. All the rooms have been recently renovated, and upgrades include a flat screen TV, hardwood floors, and a very nice bathroom. We were in town for St. Patrick's day, and this location was perfect. It is not right in the middle of the hustle bustle of Times Square, which is nice. All we needed was a place to pass out after hitting up all the Irish Pubs, but what we received far exceeded our expectations, especially for the price we paid. Would come back here in a heartbeat. I am a 24 year male, and I was traveling with my girlfriend and my 21 year old brother. Great place for a romantic getaway (just don't bring your little brother).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Al_D7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in NY a couple of times prior to this visit, and this hotel was better than the previous, and for less money. The rooms are on the small side, compared to UK hotels - but this is NY and space is a premium. That said, the rooms are lovely, with new TV and clean linen everyday. Downstairs the free breakfast and coffee were very welcome. The hotel is ideally situated for 5th Avenue, Times Square, Broadway and great restaurants. If you are looking for a quick get away - then look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous ... fabulous ... fabulous....”
Reviews.Author: zapatamama
Reviews.Content: The rooms were gorgeous, the location perfect, and the service was super fantastic. Everyone we encountered there was super helpful and friendly. The coffee and lattes in the library were fantastic and breakfast and nyt made my stay very comfortable and relaxed. The only issue I had was that there was all sorts of drilling going on late morning with the construction. If you plan to be out and about, it won;t affect you though.,..

Reviews.Title: “has potential”
Reviews.Author: gmgrover
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very charming and quaint, with new modern furnishings. I arrived late in the evening after a long flight from CA to be received by a less than friendly front desk attendant. The room was a deluxe king, more than adequate in size for a business traveler. The furnishings were appealing, however the lighting was very poor. I had to request an additional desk lamp in order to better illuminate the area and that still was not sufficient lighting for a workspace. The other major disappointment was the advertised "free high speed internet" which signal was very poor and unreliable. As for the positive, I found the complimentary continental breakfast very convenient. I also was pleased with the 2 complimentary bottles of Panna water provided each day. The bed was comfortable and the linens were fine, just as advertised. Overall, I would still recommend this property but hope the hotel improves the lighting and internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience even though”
Reviews.Author: EMERENCE
Reviews.Content: Delightful experience even though the room was a bit diminuative. The bathroom we had did not have a tub and if I had gained one more pound the sink would have been not easily accessible. The library/ coffee room is great. And the coffee is really good. This location is quite nice since it is just two blocks from Times Square. We got half price theatre tickets there at the Marriott Hotel location. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: ascubadiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last July and found it to be perfectly located for Times Square and great shopping!! The rooms are small but very clean and pleasant. Everything you need is a stones throw from this hotel great bars and places to eat in abundance! Would reccomend and would return that says it all. Scuba Diva

Reviews.Title: “Best things in small packages!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLou32
Reviews.Content: Small but perfectly formed! The Mansfield is truly a little gem of a hotel. We upgraded (for v reasonable price) as standard room is small! We got a suite which was perfect if a little warm! We stayed for a week hence the upgrade but standard room fine for 3-4 days only. Stayed at Sofitel across road in Oct 06, which is luxury but not as personable as the Mansfield. Reception staff & doormen really friendly and nothing is too much bother. Robert the conceirge was very useful and very knowledgable. He booked us a great dinner for New Years Eve! There is a renovation of rooms going on but this is between 9-5 Mon-Fri only. If you're still sleeping after 9am in NYC then why??! Too much to see and do to be in bed that late!! Go to Red Flame Diner as fab, but avoid eating in the Figaro next door to hotel as food just ok for the price. Jimmy's Bar next block along (towards Time Sq) is a total must - great atmosphere and cheap drinks! Give this hotel a try and be relaxed - you'll love it! Oh & breakfast is good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PAR342
Reviews.Content: We were relocated from the yet to open Hotel Mela and stayed 4 nights at the Mansfield. The first night I was not impressed. The room we had was very small and had no Air Conditioner on an unseasonably warm night. I asked the staff if I could be relocated and the next night they put me in a larger room with an A/C. After I was moved to the new room all of my expectations were met. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. I do not believe that my room had been renovated, but appeared to be in good condition. Unlike a previous review I had no problems with noise. I did notice a soft hum from a neighboring air conditioner, however, I was located in the back of the hotel on a high floor so I may have avoided some of the outside noise. I did not make it to the complimentary breakfast, however, I did see the spread and it appeared adequate. The free cappuccino machine and free wireless internet was a nice bonus. Tip: If you think that your room is small take a look at the floor plan on the back of the door and it will give you prospective on how your room compares to others. In my case I was in the smallest room on the floor and the staff was happy to relocate me when another room opened up.

Reviews.Title: “Not good if you need more than 30 minutes sleep a night”
Reviews.Author: Evie_Peanut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield for 3 nights for a business trip in mid November. In all there were 8 in our party and we were all very unimpressed although our expectations were low as we had read the reviews on this site and unfortunately the more critical comments had stayed in our minds. We had a variety of rooms - renovated and unrenovated but none of the rooms were much to get excited about. The rooms are clean enough but drab, small and dark with inadequate lighting and little home comforts or extras like cushions, throws, pictures, mirrors - a little too basic. From my own personal experience the biggest problem was the noise from the street repairs outside which kept me awake all night until I finally gave in at 5am and got up to go for a walk. The hotel staff did then agree to move me to a "quieter" room for the remaining nights but here I was subjected to the noise from the neighbouring building's air conditioning units as mentioned by the previous reviewer. On our last day one of the two lifts broke down and we waited about 10 - 15 minutes every time we called the remaining lift as the poor cleaning staff were struggling to move their cleaning carts between floors. There didn't seem to be much hurry to fix the lift. The hotel is in a great location and the public rooms are actually quite pleasant but the hotel is not cheap - we were paying $450 per night. If you need any sleep at all then I would not reccommend the Mansfield.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Best Deal”
Reviews.Author: gilbertsays
Reviews.Content: Booked the Mansfield site unseen thru Hotwire the night before and we were really pleased - we showed up early on a Friday and staff let us check into our room, no prob. The hotel has real Manhattan feel with marble entry, wrought iron staircase and tiny corridors. But the room was clean and bed super comfortable. Breakfast was generous and free capuccinos in the library were a nice touch. The staff was great - held our bags all day after checkout, let us linger in the bar after closing, even the housekeeper gave us a history lesson on the place and thanked us for coming! We also found the location convenient, safe and easy to find. I'd definitely recommend this place for a mid-price, mid-town stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much too noisy for the price”
Reviews.Author: tartecerise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield in mid-October. It was the first time my sister-in-law (from Australia) has been to New York. We wanted to be central and all our favourite hotels were booked. We had the 2 bdrm suite (PH5) which I think had been renovated. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the lighting was well-thought out but the renovation was a bit wacky - the hand- held shower was a challenge in the narrow bathroom and there is a huge - at least 6 ft long -TV in the sitting room that is too big for the space. The biggest problem was the squealing and roaring sleep preventing noise from a heating and cooling system on a nearby building. It was constant day & night and was so loud it actually drowned out the sounds of the early morning renovations. It was NOT garbage trucks as one person at the desk tried to tell me. Eventually a longtime employee admitted it was from a nearby building -something about they should ask their neighbours to replace the ballbearings in their system -but nobody really seemed to care. Lots of times when you stay in downtown European cities you can be in an area that is very noisy but the room is quiet due to double or triple glazing on the windows. I suggested to the staff they invest in something like that. Why expect guests to just tolerate it? My husband and I and my sister-in-law all have high pressure jobs and needed some quiet to relax during the night. At $800/night for the suite the owners should take more care. I expect some noise pretty much wherever I stay in New York but this was ridiculous. Also, no one told us upon check-in that breakfast was included so we missed it the first day. It was a great location but I will never forget paying so much to be subjected to that noise for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: VanHan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at The Mansfield Hotel in a 1 BR suite. We booked this through Travelzoo at a rate of $329/night. Here's what makes this hotel worth the stay, even though the 1 BR suites (and other rooms as well) have not yet been renovated: there is a library on the main floor with a chess board, backgammon and coffee/latte/cappucino machine. Also on the main floor is a great bar! We had drinks in the library while playing backgammon on Saturday night after dinner and the theatre. It was a great way to wind down. Even though we had the extra room in our suite, the library was much more pleasant. The gym is fairly new and has 2 elipticals and 2 treadmills, 1 bike and some gym equipment, plasma tv and headphones available at the front desk. The staff was friendly though not overly helpful. There is no valet service. Parking is down the street - ask which lot before you park - one lot offers a small discount for the hotel. Just keep in mind if booking during the fall/winter season that the rooms are in the process of renovation. My guess is that the discounted rooms are "un-renovated" rooms. With the exception of the terrible mattress, our room wasn't that bad. Beware of the small rooms. We looked at one that was being renovated down the hall. It was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Solo Travel Spot”
Reviews.Author: NYLOVAH
Reviews.Content: While I tend to spend the bulk of my NYC time in the LES and UWS nabes, and share the "oh no, midtown!" attitude of many solo single travelers in the arts, I have to rec the Mansfield as an excellent value stay for people who want to hit ALL of NYC in mere days. Subway-close, with an amazing staff at all hours, The Mansfield changed my attitude about midtown and its hotels. The room was cleaned within an inch of its "life" every time I was out seeing the city; bottled water and gratis tasty espresso-based drinks in the club room were always at hand, plus a standard cereal-and-fruit continental breakfast each morning suited budget-constrained me. Room for improvement: don't tell customers the car service to LGA includes tip, because that makes the difference between a cab [$40 including tip] and the car service [$55+ tip]. Not cool. Also, someplace nicer to store clothes, even when staying in single standard room for a WEEK. Next time, I would definitely upgrade to a larger room for the one-week thing, but then again, I spent about 4.5 hours in my hotel room per day, so can hardly justify extra sweater-space in August when I was never "home." Housekeeping dept rocks at this hotel, as does the front desk. A rare find, keep up the awesome work, peeps. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gigi1977
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. We stayed 3 nights and the superior room was spacious and clean. We didn't have any problems. The breakfast was nice and simple. It was a great price at $159. a night, not to bad in New York. It was also a great location. We were 2 blocks from Times Square and 4 blocks from the Rockefeller center. The staff was very friendly. The only complaint there wasn't any good TV stations to watch but it's not like you stayed in the room that much anyway. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: 30yr-old.traveler
