Reviews.Content: We stayed here after getting a great deal ($159/night) on travelzoo. The hotel is in a great location - only a couple blocks from times square. The room was very small, but the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also small and offered Aveda shampoo, which was nice. You get continental breakfast every morning, which easily saved us $15 - we got coffee, orange juice and toasted bagels with cream cheese. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The hotel itself is very old and small, if you're on a budget i'd recommend it, but all in all, its a small hotel that is trying really hard, but isnt succeeding.

Reviews.Title: “Just Above Average”
Reviews.Author: sherrychicago
Reviews.Content: For a mid-priced big city hotel, the Mansfield was a little above average. I had a superior queen room. Unfortunately it was on the 2nd flr. directly over the entrance, so it was rather noisy. The room decor was Zen Modern (black, white & neutrals) & rather gimmicky. The furnishings were sort of goofy "modern" plywood contraptions painted black with peculiar yellow flourecent lighting behind the headboard--sort of like something you might see on "Design on a Dime." (I guess this is supposed to impress young, trendy urbanites.) The bedding & towels were fresh. The tiny bathroom was spotlessly clean with new tile & porcelain fixtures but lacked towel bars & there was very little space around the miniscule basin for personal items. You get a full complement of Aveda toiletries & 2 bottles of water. I asked for a fridge & they brought one up at no charge. The building is over 100 yrs. old & in some spots like the hardwood floor in my room, was very worn out. (I was told they're renovating & was given a tour of some rooms that had been redone. Basically the work appears to be mostly cosmetic, but there were some changes to the bathrooms as well.) In the corridors I noticed dust & paint smells--probably from the renovation work. The location on W. 44th betw. 5th & 6th was excellent with good hotels, restaurants & private clubs. It was easy to catch a taxi at the front door. There are a pharmacy, office suppy & major bookstore on 5th within 2 blocks of the Mansfield. It's about 2-3 blocks from the theater district & fairly close to Rockefellar Center. The free continental breakfast was OK. The coffee was very good. There was OJ, apples, oranges, bagels, cream cheese, croissants & an assortment of mini-sweet rolls. The mostly 20-something staff was friendly & helpful. (As with most NYC hotels it's always handy if you can speak a little Spanish.) The guests were mostly between 30 & 60 yrs. old from the US & Europe. I travel quite a bit, so I wasn't wowed by the Mansfield, but it was above average for a mid-price hotel in NYC. I was able to get a promotional rate, so the price was fair for what I paid. (I hope they don't raise their rates after the renovations are finished.)

Reviews.Title: “In bad shape and over priced”
Reviews.Author: waspqueenII
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is a run down relic and has no business charging $279 per night plus tax - total of $320. I was stunned when I got off at the 2nd floor yesterday. I found narrow hallways jammed with boxes, debris, a maids cart, and bag of garbage. At 5:15 you would think the cleaning service would have at least put away the carts and garbage - but I found out they leave the carts in the hallway all the time - they do not have storage room. Room number 208 had a bathroom that was so narrow, maybe three feet wide - I would have never been able to blow dry my hair with the permanent wall dryer. I could not lift both my arms up without banging into walls. I am not a wide person, a women's size 8. I called down to the front desk and asked for a room with a bathroom where I would be able to dry my hair in the morning. They said they would call me back in 5 minutes. After 10 minutes and no call back, I went back down to lobby - I was thinking I would rather check out. The carpets in the hallways were dirty, the walls dingy and scratched. I agreed to another room on the 5th floor. This larger room was still small with vanity and sink and hair dryer out at one end of room - not in the bathroom with tub and toliet. But I took it because I would be late for a dinner engagement if I had to find another hotel. The tub was cracked and chipped and the small window A/C made noises off and on all night. The room was shabby. I made it through one night but never again. At the continental breakfast the next morning you could see in the brighter lights how dingy the bar is, stained carpet, faded wood floor, but the bar looks charming at night. Don't let the charming wood library bar at night fool you, this place is in need of a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: beachluv2005
Reviews.Content: At $159 a nite (internet special) including complimentary continental breakfast, unlimited free bottled water and a 24 hour coffee machine that makes lattes & cappucinos, this mid-town hotel can't be beat! The single bed rooms are really small, good for one person only. The bathroom is average size and includes Aveda soaps and shampoo/conditioners. The rooms have cd players too. There is no gift shop and I bought newspapers at the Sofitel Hotel down the street. Perfectly located at west 44th & Fifth Ave, walking distance to the theatre district, Museum of Modern Art, Times Square etc. The staff was friendly and the restaurant next door, Figaro's, has good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “An all-around great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Joni06
Reviews.Content: I loved this "boutique" hotel with beautiful architecture and attractive decor. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We always had everything we needed in our room. They gave us a free upgrade to a room with two double beds that I found plenty roomy. I also received a coupon for 2 complimentary drinks due to small error at check-in. Cold bottled water at the front desk was great after a hot afternoon of sight-seeing, and the loaner umbrellas were much appreciated on the rainy days. The bar is converted into a dining area each morning with complimentary coffee, pastries, bagels, fruit, and juice and has several interesting books to enjoy, as well. The library/game room is a nice place to sit and talk or read while enjoying a free cappucino. I didn't use the workout facility but it looked very nice. I appreciated the computers to check my e-mail. The location is perfect and allowed us to squeeze in almost everything on our list! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bed with 4 walls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Imagine a bed with four walls around it... no chair, no desk. Nice gym, library, bar, but at most this is adequate for one guest staying one night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSarita
Reviews.Content: The Mansfield is very clean, cozy and has a lot of very nice finishing touches and details. We were on the eleventh floor with a bay window and did not hear the noise that other posters refer to, however the AC unit was a little noisy. Everything we called the front desk for was taken care of immediately, and the concierge was happy to help us check our bags for the day (we flew in early on a red-eye flight) and point us to different restaurants. The dry cleaner down the street pressed a suit for us in hours, and delivered to the concierge free of charge! Bathroom was very nice and was fully stocked with bottled water and aveda products. The library downstairs was a nice place to rewind/relax, and has free espresso and a fireplace. We really enjoyed mid-town from this hotel: rockefeller center, times square and grand central are within blocks, as well as other subway stations. We also easily walked to shopping (you name it) and central park from here. We paid just over $200 when I called to get them to match hotels.com, but I see other posters have gotten better deals than that. While this was the smallest room we stayed in during our trip the service and atmosphere was light years ahead of the Barclay Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, great location”
Reviews.Author: hhefzy
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY small and cold in appearance. Also, though it was april, it was freezing outside and the heater wasn't working in the room so my husband and I had to sleep with our coats on! The bathroom was also very VERY small. However, the location is WONDERFUL. It's a short walk to times square, fifth avenue shopping, and subway stations. There is a parking garage right next door which is way cheaper then the hotel parking. The morning breakfast buffet was ok, but once the food was gone it took a while for it to be "restocked." Also, though the fitness room was nice, it was "closed" for the whole 4 days that we were there. There were 2 computers with free internet access which was very helpful and the front desk staff were very helpful as far as directions and recommended places to eat. All in all, I would stay there again for less than 150/nt but if I need to pay more than that, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JillE1957
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at The Mansfield for 3 nights last week. The hotel is a charming, small boutique hotel. For New York City, the room was quite spacious, but that was because we had a queen suite, which was of an entirely adequate size for the two of us. I understand their single rooms are quite small. But all you really want in New York is a place to sleep and shower anyway. The bathroom was small, but large enough for one of us at a time. The air conditioning unit was effective in the sitting room area, but not in the bedroom. The bed and the pillows were by far the most comfortable hotel sleeping accomodations I have ever experienced. The staff was very friendly and accomodating and the location was excellent. Any requests made to the desk were dealt with immediately. The bar was small, but was very pleasant to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. The complimentary continental breakfast was also welcome. I also enjoyed having access to the internet and a printer in order to check in for my return flight. Overall an extremely pleasant experience. My brother had arranged an excellent deal on the price, but even for a bit more I would stay there again. I highly recommend The Mansfield.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great deal !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised by this hotel many hotels in new york cost much more than the stars they deserve and awful surprises such as bedbugs can ruin a stay... the mansfield hotel is as expected: ideally located, nice, cosy, comfortable and quiet ! i will always remember that when i came back at night around 10pm i asked the front desk if i could be possible to give me fan as there was no AC in my room and an hour later, the engineer came to install me the AC !! it was incredible !!! the staff is very nice the restaurant with its library is a great place to have breakfast thanks a lot

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was on the small side, but it is to be expected in NYC. All in all, it was a good experience. The location was perfect - just a short walk from the very centre of Times Square. The lobby, library and M Bar were tastefully decorated and inviting. A small but very nice gym was on-site as well. We never used it, but it looked very clean and professional. This is a great place to relax and stay in, and if you wish to do something exciting, all that the city has to offer is only steps away! All in all, we would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would definitely stay there again and in fact are planning to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Cool hotel- enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Monkeypie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Mansfeild Hotel. It is an excellent location and the staff is warm and welcoming. We had a spring special, and enjoyed a deluxe (but tiny) queen room for $199 an night- really great for the location. The first night we had a room on the 2nd floor and the noise was TERRIBLE!! I don't know if it is the dumpsters being emptied, but something would make terrible noise every hour or so. Then, promptly at 6 am, the sound of running water made me think someone was taking a shower in the middle of our room. I tearfully reported this to the staff- reminding them that we had small children at home and very rarely slept in. They apologized and promised to move us to room in the back of the hotel. We were pleased to find we were upgraded to a penthouse suite upon our return that afternoon!!The breakfast was lovely and best of all, free, but we really enjoyed the delicious cappucinos from the machine in the library. The Mansfield was just what I was looking for- small, homey, comfortable beds, clean, great location. I felt as if I was staying at a bed and breakfast. It was so close to time square, the subways, and gorgeous flowers blooming in Bryant park. I would recommend earplugs if you are staying near the street- They really need to invest in a white noise maker or something. I would return to the Mansfield again.

Reviews.Title: “just right for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mansfield for 3 days with my two kids ages 22 and 16 over Easter weekend. We got a decent rate due to an internet offer. I prefer small, European style, unique hotels with a boutique feeling and that describes the Mansfield. Here are the good points: Clean and comfortable room, with simple modern furniture, cool lighting and Aveda bathroom products with plenty of hot water and pressure in the shower. The beds were great, with lots of pillows, high quality sheets and down comforters. Breakfast is included, which works well for us. There was a variety of breads, muffins, bagels, cereals, fresh fruit, coffee and hard boiled eggs. There is also an instant espresso/cappo/latte machine in a nice little library room off to the side of the lobby, which is open and free 24/7. Also hot water and tea selections. The staff was friendly, helpful and offered us free bottled water whenever we came in looking tired and sweaty from a day of NYC. There is also free bottled water in the room. There are two computers for guest use in another room off the lobby, which was great for checking NYC info, as well as printing boarding passes. The location of the hotel is great-- close to many attractions and a metro stop, but also on a fairly quiet side street. The workout room was clean and had a full range of equipment, as well as a loft area for yoga and stretching. We didn't need help navigating the city, but I overheard staff offering helpful, clear directions and suggestions, with free maps, to other guests. One thing that didn't seem to work so well was how breakfast is set up and served. There just wasn't enough staff the weekend we were there to make sure tables were cleared, coffee pots refilled, food replenished as needed and enough tables and chairs for the amount of guests wanting to eat at the same time. If you want to miss the chaos, show up early. Also, I always travel with earplugs, so noise rarely bothers me, but my kids complained that there was some kind of fan or generator (very loud) that kicked on and off throughout the night. We were on the 2nd floor, away from the street, so other than the fan, it was quiet and low key. The bar connected to the hotel lobby (doubles as the breakfast room in the morning) is beautiful and cozy, but drink prices were really steep-- $14.00 for a martini, and $7 for a beer. We decided to hang out in the library and have herbal tea instead. Better to wander down the street and have a nightcap somewhere else than pay those prices. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but only if you can get a better rate than is typical. Spending $200. a night for the three of us with free breakfast and 2 double beds was fine--but I wouldn't pay more. At the lower rate it feels like a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: nules
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mansfield in November2005. The hotel was in a perfect location. The staff went out of their way to help us. Rooms were spotless and cleaned every day. Loved the bar area. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive city very expensive room.”
Reviews.Author: f2s
Reviews.Content: Cold and wet outside, I never did think the heater was working nor did I see air con. There were no in room info notes, or basin plug. The surface was coming off the small American tub. Storage and seating was limited. Two double beds instead!! This was a "delux" fourth floor room. Handy stairs to bypass small lifts. Staff fine except perhaps breakfast room were it pays not to be late. The lobby and library are great, coffee machine made the visit bearable. Maids did a good job. This was too expensive even in expensive NYC

Reviews.Title: “Good Loaction. Good Hotel. Tiny Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ongoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield for 6 nights at an offer price of $159/per night. Our room was tiny, there was about one foot of space on the far side of the double bed with about 3.5 - 4 foot of space on the near side. Plus the bed and a foot of space at the end of it - that was the total space plus ensuite! Lucky we like things cosy!! Despite the intimate size of our standard double - the hotel was great. Rate included a simple breakfast of pastries / cereal / coffee / toast / bagets fruit etc - so it was great not to have to go eat brekkie at the horrible diner nearby. There are two computers for guests to use - which was really handy to have convenient internet access. The staff are helpful without being 'too in your face over-friendly'. The bar however is a bit overpriced and the live music which was arranged while we were there was awful! We preferred to have drink in the Taverna Bar across the road. All in all - If the room had cost more than what we had paid for it - i would have been VERY dissappointed with the size of it. But at $160 - it was ok. I would stay at the Mansfield again - given the price and quality of other hotels in NY - its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another if you're not used to "boutique" hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC every year. This was last year's trip, March 2005, so things may have improved. We saw four stars everywhere we looked for reviews on this place, so we booked it. As for cleanliness, we found the rooms to be run down, stained carpets and covers, and basics like showerheads and heat to be in unacceptable (our opinion) working order. Two tiny elevators. On the A+ side, nice comfortable and cozy bar, LOCATION is great, the design and style of the common areas is excellent, amd the free breakfast is also very nice. Just not our version of a 4 star NYC hotel should be. We won't try the "boutique" eperience again.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful, especially at that price.”
Reviews.Author: Brickton
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute for a business trip to the city. The first room I was assigned got off to bad start when I opened the door and hit the bed. There wasn't enough room to put my gym bag on the floor and still be able to walk around. I asked to switch rooms and recieved a slightly larger but just as dark, dank and miserable room. The 'closet' was a shelf with a curtain around it. The bathroom was grossly outdated, narrow and just dingy. If this were a cheap hotel, all of this would be forgiven, however it maintains that the hotel is 3 stars or some nonsense. Unless you are booking a room for under $150 here, stay somewhere else. I paid +$300 for the 'pleasure' above described and regretted every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have being to New York, many times, stayed at fancy hotels and not so fancy, but finally I found my home away from home. The reception staff, was great, I walked in and mentioned my last name and they knew my first name right away, and while checking in (less than 5 minutes) they offered me coffee, water and told me they were there 24/7 for anything. Although my room was small, it had all I needed, and it was perfect, since you are only there to fall sleep and to wake up. The mattress and the pillows were excellent (housekeeping told me that they change them about every 3 months), the bed sheets and toiltetries were great, and the towels big and absorvent. Every night they will put in my room 3 bottles of Italian water (free). The included breakfast, although limited, was good with a grat variety of breads. The library with fireplace and the coffee machine,open 24/7 was great for a late night capuccino. The concierge staff was great, they got me tickets to a play and got me a reservation with 15 minutes of my request, for DB Moderne, that is across the Hotel (which was packed and excellent). And the location could not be better, almost no noise at night, and walking distance to everything. I only took 2 caps, in my 4 days there, one to the Village and one to Penn Station to take the AirTrain back to Newark Airport. I cant't wait to start planning my next visit to NY, just to stay at The Mansfield.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this fabulous boutique hotel and its incredible staff! When I arrived, I was greeted by a doorman who offered me some bottled water and to take my bag while I stood in a short line to check in. When I walked into the lobby, my first impression was that it was very cheery and light; a truly charming feel. Off to the left is an extraordinary bar and library area. The hotel lobby radiates a simple and elegant disposition. I immediately noticed the staff, all of which could easily have been mistaken for models. One would expect that they might have attitude from this well coiffed group, but this is where the nice surprise comes in: they are as beautiful on the inside as they are on the out. I was told about the complimentary breakfast, and whenever I had a question, I was given a detailed set of directions, including a map. And the staff always offered to call transportation for me. There is complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby area, by the way. I was astounded when I read other reviews that some didn't feel the staff was very warm. I cannot disagree more with that assessment; they were fantastic. The hallways were clean, with terazzo floors with mini one inch tile accents, again in black and neutral taupe tones. The light fixtures were deco. If you chose to use the marbled staircases, they are very convenient, but I had no wait taking one of the elevators. When I arrived in my room, I was again pleasantly amazed! The room was beautiful. The bed was about 6 feet from the doorway, and the foot of the bed was about 4 or 5 feet fromt the opposite wall, and the other side of the bed was a couple feet from the window sill, which had cleverly used this space covering the radiator with an elegant upholstered bench, done in a tasteful, modern jacquard fabric in olive tones. The walls are a light yellow color that my interior decorator friends refer to as "petal". Whatever. It's very easy on the eyes; neutral and not too bright. The ceiling and a 10" trim were a crisp white, and the floors and wood trim were stained and painted a contemporary contrasting black. The hardware was all polished nickel; not that "feel the warmth of India" nonsense with tacky brass. The beds headboard was an artistic scrolled metal grid (backlit) that was mounted to the wall and floor-very smart as it doesn't vibrate (think about it for a minute and you'll understand). The sheets were a complimenting light yellow stripe; crisp and clean they reflected the room's design. The blinds were a thick black wood with an olive herringbone fabric down the middle. These are not cheap, cheesy window treatments, people. The bathroom, albeit smaller, was equally as impressive with a stainless steel basin, coordinating fabric shower curtain, consistant color scheme, and black soapstone tile and countertop. The room was stocked with bottled water and several Aveda accoutrements, as well as a repair kit and shower cap. There was a nice wall mounted hair dryer and a phone in the bathroom as well. I personally like a smaller bathroom; what on earth do people want with a gigantic bathroom in a hotel anyway. My room had a cedar lined closet! Yes! Unbelievable, I know. It was equipped with an iron and accompanying ironing board, serveral thick hangers with trouser clips, and there was a bag for complimentary shoe shine service, of which I did not take advantage this trip. My room was in the front of the hotel. I slept well. I noticed some complaining of street noise. Hello, people! This is NY! You are going to hear noise. The room had a small writing desk and upholstered chair, an alarm clock, and phone as you would expect. It also had a television, and a CD player/Radio system, which was playing a soothing soft jazz when I walked in. It made me laugh a little that they went to this extra trouble to make a good impression. In the bar area, you can order food. I noticed the chicken satay appetizer for $10 right away. To put into perspective how reasonably priced this place is, I had a caesar salad around the corner at TGI Fridays and it was $17 and $5 for iced tea, no refills, and it was served to me by a crass woman that looked like cottage cheese poured into a nylon leotard. Got it. Around the corner to the right on fifth avenue, there is a small deli called European Deli. Very reasonable, and a cafeteria ala carte situation. The NYSC gym is conveniently located across the street, which made me happy. I hope this offers some insight. Don't hesitate to stay at the Mansfield. But do understand, people, that this is a boutique hotel, much like what you might find in nice parts of Europe. If you want a dank, cookie cutter, mauve and tapestry production of bad taste, and the stink of lemon sanitizer and bug spray, then stay at a national chain.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I go to NY quite a bit and there are very few hotels that I care for. I was at the Mansfield for 4 nights The hotel is superior. My room was magnificent and the service is incredible. The front desk cannot do enough for you, especially Irasel, who is terrific. The entire staff really makes you feel welcome. The Mansfield offers these nice little things like coffee or tea when you arrive and buffet breakfast which is included in the price of the room. On my last day there I was waiting outside for my car and a staff member noticed that I was outside a bit too long and asked if I wanted to come in and have a cup of coffee while I waited. That's incredible service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through an online travel site (HW) Standard room for $176 not a bad price for New Year's Eve in the city. Checked in around 1pm and was offered a complimentary upgrade to a queen deluxe on the top floor. The room was very small, so are the elevators. Upon entering the room the door hit the foot of the bed. There was maybe 2 feet between the the end of the bed and the door. If you are looking for an affordable, clean, great area in Manahattan this is definitely the spot to stay. The room had a sleek almost contemporary flair, black blinds and flooring, white bedding, interesting lighting. The bedding...white down comforter, white sheets and comfy down pillows very cozy, I slept like a baby. But really tiny even by NYC standards, so be prepared. Continental breakfast was included but I missed it so can't comment on that. The door/bellman was incredible as well as the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “They don't make hotels like this anymore!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another trip to New York, where I visit every year. This was my first time at The Mansfield and will not be my last. While the room was smaller than other hotels I have stayed at in New York, it was comfortable and immaculately clean. The reception staff was always helpful and cordial. The hotel is a beautiful building with much of the original architecture still in tact. They say they are planning a renovation, I hope they don't cover it all up as they don't build hotels like this anymore. If you're in New York and want a clean, comfortable place to stay with lots of old world charm, definitely check out The Mansfield!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kidder44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansfield for 4 nights, after reading some of the reviews I was expecting a tiny room. The room wasn't huge but it wasn't that small either. WE had booked a standard room, and I take it that's what we got. The bathroom was big, and there was plenty of room. The room was kept very clean and tidy, plenty of clean towels etc etc, and hot water. There was limited hanging space for clothes, which was on a rail behind the full length mirror, for a 4 night stay it was suffice We had a room at the back of the hotel, which was very quiet [no traffic noise] there was no view as such, and the room was very dark, but that wasn't really a problem either. It was just a matter of turning on the light! The staff where friendly and helpful at all times, and fixed us up with an airport shuttle for our return trip to JFK Airport, which was cheaper than a fixed rate taxi. It's a mini bus type transport. 21 dollars each. Beware you could run up a big bill in a taxi if you get stuck in traffic on the way back to JFK. It's fixed rate on arrival, [45 dollars a cab] but not on your return journey. There was a complimentary continental breakfast, which did run a bit low at times. It's unusual to get breakfast thrown in, and it wasn't expected so we couldn't really complain. We ate there every morning, and it was suffice. Maybe getting up a bit earlier is the answer? No tea making facilities in the rooms, but 24 hour complimentary coffee and tea in the reception. Which could be taken up to the room. Complimentary internet access in reception, which was good. The location was excellent, literally 5 mins walk to Times Square, and 10 Mins to the Empire State building or Macy's. Also approx 10-15 mins from the Circle Line boat trips. Myself and my wife would stay here again, it was a very pleasant stay, for a our first trip to New York. As the New Yorkers say, Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay At The Mansfield Again”
Reviews.Author: EEC1968
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Hudson or the Royalton but they were booked. We are here once a month and were excited about finding another boutique hotel option in New York. We had originally booked a room at the Shoreham, a sister hotel to the Mansfield. When we arrived, after a grueling traffic trip - we were told there was a mistake in their computer system and they had overbooked, so they sent us to the Mansfield. They did pay the taxi fare. Once we arrived at the Mansfield, we were grateful to have a room. The hotel has definite charm and is very clean. However, the rooms are small (even by New York standards) and much of the staff needs some serious customer service training. They have a great library area that served me well as a business traveler during the day, and it is a great bar area at night. The hotel is wireless, but the staff kept having to reset the wireless system all day long. It's a great location, but I would not stay here again due to the staff. Many of them are not overly helpful, not overly grateful for having guests and completely non-communicative when it comes to dealing with guest issues. I wanted to write the parent company, Willow Hotels (which I found out by research) but I found no website or no email address for their Director of Operations.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price, great location, front desk staff needs improvement!”
Reviews.Author: duomogal
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, but front desk staff needs improvement. Upon arrival I was shown to my room, which was on the second floor overlooking traffic (noisy!). The light in the bathroom didn't work. I returned to the front desk and asked if I could be changed to a room that perhaps was higher up, or in a quieter part of the building, and noted to the staff that the bathroom lights weren't functioning. I was treated rather rudely by the front desk staffperson, who said tersely "I can do that" and then gave me a new room key. The new room was incrediby tiny -- so small that if I hadn't been traveling alone, there wouldn't have been room for both of us. I felt as if I were being punished for asking for a new room! Otherwise, the accomodations were clean, the location was great, and the comp breakfast was a nice touch. I might stay again, but I'll look elsewhere for comparable rates elsewhere first, where the desk service might be friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSarah
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great location, comp breakfast a plus for a quick start. Nice little extras. The city was sold out for Columbus Day so upgrades were not available. The room was very tight and the bathroom was tiny, but as you are always on the run in NYC it didn't matter. The comfort of the bed was the best!!! Yes, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extras at the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: Marie2347
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I were very impressed with our stay at the Mansfield. Upon arrival I asked if any upgrades from our standard room were available, and we were upgraded to a deluxe room at no charge. (We were also given two large glasses of ice water by the woman at the front desk, who noticed we were sweating from our walk from the subway.) The deluxe room was well appointed, with a spacious closet area, a desk/TV unit that was big enough to hold a laptop computer, and a window seat. The lighting was especially nice: a floor/baseboard light behind the bed created cosy illumination when you wanted just some light, not a lot. The room was spotless and we had good maid service each day. I think that the front-desk staff is rather young and inexperienced -- they had no idea, for example, how a cab ride to LaGuardia airport would take early on the July 4 holiday. But they were pleasant and eager. For the price we got from Expedia.com, we could not have asked for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “That rare combination of style, comfort, and efficiency”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Mansfield for years, and while the decor is beginning to show some wear, it is still one of the most beautifully-appointed hotels anywhere. Dark hard-wood floors with butter-colored rugs, light-colored bedspreads (which I appreciate--they have to be clean), terry bathrobes, Aveda grooming products, stainless steel sinks, granite countertops, and a steel mesh headboard backlit with floor lights. The rooms may be as small or smaller than other NY Hotels, but the interior designer uses the space so efficiently that it doesn't matter. The common areas are lovely (a library-style bar, seating area with a fireplace, marble staircases with ebony railings), and the complimentary continental breakfast is one of the nicest I've been offered in a hotel (I love that they offer hard-boiled eggs along with the usual pastries, fruit, and cereal). A unique NY hotel experience for those who appreciate that NY is about style, not space.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific small hotel in mid-town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was VERY PLEASED with the hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful, including housekeeper. I loved extras such as free cont. breakfast, free 24hr access to 2 high speed computers (so I didn't have to schlep my laptop to NYC), newspaper, coffee in lobby and 2 bottles of free water per day. Room was very nicely appointed. High quality sheets, 4 pillows and quality Aveda toiletries. After getting this hotel I saw some negative feedback on slow elevators, but this was not true. Never had to wait more than a minute. Room size was fine for 1 person and a couple without too much luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - Miserable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby and bar area, and great location. But otherwise way overpriced, snobbish, and unaccommodating. What do you get for $260+ per night? My family of four got the following for a three night stay (almost a thousand dollars -- ouch!): Even though we booked our room expressly for four and specifically requested two double beds, when we arrived we were told that no such rooms were available and that we had to settle for a room with only one double bed. We were informed that we could move to a two double bed room the following night. We were also told that we could be provided with a fold-out cot. When we complained, and asked for a discount because of the inconvenience, the male desk manager refused and then went into an arrogant rant about how other people like us who were inconvenienced chose to upgrade and pay the extra money for the upgrade. We told him that we would put up with the inconvenience for one night (rather than come out of pocket another $75!). The female clerk at the front desk then offered my wife and I a glass of champagne (undrinkable swill!) and a glass of water for my boys, which she said was to accommodate us for our inconvenience. I then noticed that the champagne bottle was already out behind the desk, and I asked the clerk if the champagne was complimentary for everyone who came in, not just us. Sheepishly, she admitted that this was the case. We were then led to what had to be the hotel's worst room: shockingly small with no closet, just a pole with some hangers covered by what looked like a shower curtain; a double bed on wheels (somehwere in NY there is a hospital missing a bed); a bathroom door that wouldn't close because the knob assembly was broken; peeling wall paper; and a window air conditioning unit that buzzed and whistled all night long. A fold up cot eventually appeared that was barely big enough for our 14-year old to sleep on (with his feet hanging over the end). Needless to say, with our 14 year old tossing and turning on his "child's size" cot, my wife and I trying to sleep with our 6-year old between us on a precariously mobile double bed, and the air conditioning whistling the "Colonel Bogie March", we did not enjoy a restful night. Luckily we were moved to a little bit larger (and only slightly more "plush" - Ha! Ha!) room with two double beds for the the next two nights, where, at least, we were able to get some sleep. But no apology was ever forthcoming, and no complimentary anything. The rest of our stay went with no incident until the last day, when we were set to leave. As we entered the lobby, we noticed that the adjoining sunken bar area was serving a continental breakfast. When we asked if this was complimentary, we were told it was. But no one had bothered to tell us when we checked in! Places such as this give New York "hospitality" a bad name. We will never, ever stay in this overrated, overpriced, boutique (read: "antique") hotel again, nor would we recommend it to our family, friends or colleagues, who oftern travel to New York on business and pleasure. Prospective visitors to NYC who read this take heed! Terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a very modern, new, & spotless accommodation you can't beat the price. We stayed at another nearby hotel for $40 less and that by far was a less satisfying stay. The Mansfield is a sleek & hip hotel at a great value. True, the rooms are very small, but you're suppose to be spending most of your time elsewhere. The free continental breakfast was superb! Only thing missing was bacon and eggs! If you can get a weekend room there for less than $200 - take it!

Reviews.Title: “Thought THE MANSFIELD was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i think the mansfield was okay, but the room i stayed in couldve done with some cupboards, had no ironing board. The main telephone was not working properly and i also found the bathroom abit of a tight squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great location, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: swa
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a good NYC value. But beware these are the smallest rooms I've ever seen ( including rooms in Paris!). A nice breakfast is included ( cereals, pasteries, breads, fruit, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee, teas). Hotel is well maintained, very sparce & simple. Overall for the location it is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 3 night 4 day stay in NYC... I will keep it simple and to the point.... Location - Excellent Price - Excellent Service - Excellent Room - Very, very small but very quiet from the outside noise Bell Man - Excellent Bed - Very comfortable Amenities - Excellent Aveda products Room Service - Excellent Cleaniness - Spotless View - None Front Desk- No Problem Breakfast and night Bar - a good assortment of fruits and cereals and very cozy bar (The M Bar) Overall hotel - Small and Cozy Close bars and restaurants - plentiful heading west on 44th and the Red Dragon for breakfast 1/2 block to west Recommended Pub - Kevin St. James on 8th (It's a local bar, but the bartenders offered excellent service and the music is awesome. Overall opinion, when you tour New York City, all you want at the end of the day is a warm shower and a nice bed to rest. In the morning, all you want is a a good breakfast and hot fresh coffee. During your exploration, all you want is a a great location. Budgetwise, all you want is an affortable and nice hotel where you feel safe and is close to everything. The Mansfield provided all! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mansfield for a week in mid-June 2005. We had done a lot of research and knew what to expect. The entire staff was very friendly, helpful, courteous, and competent. The desk was always staffed with knowledgable, efficient, and responsive clerks. The bellman was great, and even the maid was cheerful and genuine. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly and warmly. Without asking, we were given an early check-in, and found ourselves in our room within 5 minutes of walking into the lobby. The room was admittedly very small, but we had expected that, having read other reviews. The bed was comfy, the AC worked great, ( a little noisy but it kept the room at 72 while it was 95 outside) and most notably, the room, including the bath, was immaculately clean. Everything worked and although we were at first concerned that we could find no iron or board, a call to the desk had both at our door in 2 or 3 minutes. Aveda toiletries, and plenty of big, soft towels and pillows were very nice touches. The complimentary continental breakfast was adequate, the bar was very pleasant, and the location on 44th St. between 5th and 6th was perfect. (The Red Flame Diner just down the street is a gem. Great food, fast service, good prices, and friendly help.) Downsides - absolutely no view (an alley and brick wall), very narrow hallways, stairwells, and elevators, and nothing to put your suitcase on except the bed. But then again, we were out touring early every morning, we returned late, and we were asleep within minutes of getting back to our room. We got our room at a discounted rate online, and we would recommend the Mansfield to friends, unless they were claustrophobic. We were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visiting NYC from Toronto, booked the Mansfield because it was a recommended hotel on a travel guide book. Paid $219US/night x 3nights using their internet site. PROS: 1.Location! - Amazing central location!!!!! Literally 30 second walk from Fifth Av. and 4 mins Times Square, 3mins to Grand Central station. The street is quiet and safe. No worries walking from Times Square back to hotel even at midnight. Several other hotels on street making it quite populated by tourists. Probably saved a decent amount of money on not having to take taxis. Subway station at grand central and times square. This is the best part of the hotel! 2.Decor -nice classy small lobby with a bar/breakfast area. The rooms where nicely decorated with brushed steel/black wood type finish. Comfy bed and down duvet. 3.Free bkfast -assortment of cereal, fruit, juice, milk, bagels, croiss, muffins. 4.Decently friendly staff -able to help with questions/recommendations, generally helpful. Needed maid service at night, quick to respond. Stored baggage for us. CONS: 1.Room size -stayed on the Penthouse level - queen size bedroom was small but apparently a regular size room. The room was no bigger than 15x10'. Heard stories about small washrooms, but ours was actually a good size. Hallway in penthouse was very narrow. Apparently the room across from ours was an amazing 2 storey room. I guess for $219/night, I was disappointed with the size of ours. Try Priceline for a better price. 2.Utilities -had to wait ~30 seconds for the tap to flow cold water from the sink. Air conditioner only had one setting (max) and remote couldn't control it. had to shut it off as too cold. 3.Elevators/Anemeties -slow/small elevators. Website stated that they had bathrobes- i didn't see any. No free computer usage, couldn't find the small travel info booth. Renovations started- not sure what they're doing but an area for sitting/computer area would be nice. OVERALL: I guess I would probably stay here again, although I'm not sure i'd be happy paying $219. Try getting it cheaper than that. The location is superb however, and unless you want to be directly in Times Square, the location can't be beat. Other hotels that i would check before making reservations are the Iroquois (2 buildings down) and the Millenium (3 buildings down) -both looked a bit nicer and I'd consider them for a similar price. Other hotels that you might want to check out are DoubleTree Times Square, The Marriott Times Square, and the Hilton Times Square. I wouldn't settle for a peripherally located hotel as you'll end up paying more for taxis or walking longer distances to catch the metro. Times Square is always well populated and being close and having a small walking distance made us feel safe. Finally, I'd recommend not taking the express shuttles to and from the airport/hotels. The price of a taxi is the same and will get you there much quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend travelled to New York for a break in March, neither of has been to the USA before. We booked the hotel on line at a extremley low rate and to be honest didnt have great expectations - as long as it was clean, we would never be there. However when we arrived, we were greeted by friendly door and reception staff. Admititedely, the room was quite small, but comfortable and clean. I think what made it for us was the great location, only a short walk to broadway, Times square and central park! would definately stay there again. Oh! and try the red dragon cafe at the end of the street - the breakfasts are awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love/Dislike Relationship”
Reviews.Author: AmstutzHerndon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed three nights and my husband, who can be a hotel snob, said at the end of our trip that he would stay there again. When we first checked in, I thought he was going to hate it! The room was so small, he had to iron with the board on the bed since there was no place to set it up. No closets, just a rod behind the mirror. The room was dark and there was no atmosphere urging us to break into our mini bar supplies which we brought. Sounds terrible right? But once we saw what a great location the hotel was in, and the lovely continental breakfast set up in the bar, and once I realized that our rate under $200 was pretty good for that area, the hotel began to grow on us. The sheets and bed were very comfortable. The toiletries were nice. But the tub/shower combination was awkward and the toilet was very close to the door. There seemed to be no a/c so we just opened the window. The staff was just okay, didn't really talk to them much. My husband had free internet and they printed out something for him so he was able to do some work. The hotel says they will be renovating some things in the near future. I don't know what they can do with those small baths and rooms, so it would be a good idea to check out your room beforehand. I can't stress the great location enough! The street has a nice coffee shop, beautiful bars and nice restaurants. Walking to Times Square and the broadway theaters is so quick but yet the area around the hotel is quiet (well for NYC). You can get to Rockerfeller Center quickly as well as Bryant Park. The subway lines are also close. So if I can get this hotel at a reasonable rate, we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “At last – an affordable AND good NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filmdocs
Reviews.Content: Each time I visit New York I have vowed never to return to the hotel I've chosen - until now. The Mansfield is quietly stylish and the 'senior' room I had was spacious with a living room and bedroom - two TVs etc. Other reviewers on this site seem to have had tiny rooms, so maybe the secret is to ask for a 'senior' room. For three nights, including a Saturday, I paid an average of $166 per night - including tax and continental breakfast. Staff were pleasantly attitude-free.

Reviews.Title: “A New York gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel has a friendly staff and we recommend it, but before you sign, ask to see the room they propose to give you. Ask them to show you the room on a floor chart - you can tell immediately the difference in room sizes. A few of the rooms are so small there's no room to change your mind, let alone your clothes, even if you're alone. That's no exaggeration, and their tiniest rooms have a sort of half-bathroom that almost requires you to keep one foot inside the tub to get to the mirror. The hotel staff will try to find you a larger room, and after one night in a Postal Commemorative Stamp of a room they first gave us, we got room 807, a suite, which was lovely-with separate bedroom and living area. A free continental breakfast until 10am each day has quality bagels and baked goods, fresh fruit and cereal, and juice - saving you a $10 trip to a nearby eatery, unless you crave ham and eggs. The place was clean AND QUIET - there aren't convention facilities or ice machines just outside youre door, and there's a renovation planned for later in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “-”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked a so-called"superior" room for Sat. nite stay. The lobbly area was nice, but a pretense- the room was 3rd rate-tiny, one chair, one night- stand, no closet-just a bunch of hangers on a bar, with a curtain-, no bureau drawers, no mirror, window facing a brick wall, -this hotel is pretentious and overpriced-should be downgraded to two stars.The "free" continental breakfast was bagels, juice and coffee a la motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: NYorks_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year 2004 and were surprised by how good the reception & bar area looked. The rooms have a nice feel too but are very small. The bathroom has a shower over a half size bath but has lovely complementary Aveda toiletries. The free buffet breakfast consisted of a good selection of cereals, toast, bagels, pastries and fruit with tea, coffee, milk & fruit juice. The hotel advertised a 24 coffee bar but this consists of coffee & hot water being kept warm on a spirit stove. We ordered tea & toast from room service one morning and got a large container of hot water and 8 slices of toast with a selection of jams & cream cheese. The bar has a very laid back atmosphere with a friendly bartender, housekeeping & maintenance staff were also friendly but the reception staff were a little aloof. This is a great spot to stay to see all the sites, walking distance to Macy's and the Empire State.

Reviews.Title: “Would have no problem recommending this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mookie-moomoo
Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful hotel. The staff were attentive and friendly, I needed to send a FedEx package when I arrived and they took care of everything for me. The hotel was clean and the bathroom was lovely with a great power shower. The location is fab and far better than it's three stars would lead you to believe. Every morning the staff would greet me in a friendly manner. I would have no hesitation in recommending this elegant hotel........big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mansfield”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we were bumped to their sister property for the first night of our two night stay, we had a very nice visit at both properties. Our one night at the Mansfield was very nice. The staff was pleasant and accomodated us very nicely (upgraded us to a suite and paid for our taxi rides to and from the other hotel). The Mansield hotel had a lot of charm--very nice place to stay in the winter. We were very comfortable in our suite and we enjoyed the room the complimentary breakfast was served in. We would recommend both properties. It was an adventure to be able to stay at two small midtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Without question, the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I arrived into an undersized room (the door banged against the bed), the toilet hadn't even been cleaned after the last tenant was and there was rotting food (and worse) under the bed. I was moved to a 'suite' which was sightly larger but, I would never stay there again. The staff was accommadating, but I should have never been put in that position in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms but a good value on hotwire/priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you buy this hotel on hotwire or priceline you will get a great value because it is in a primo location--- just off 5th Ave at 44th street-- But the rooms are unbelievably tiny-----If you pay....."full" price you will feel totally ripped off..

Reviews.Title: “A great little find!”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Elaine
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I was not looking forward to staying in this hotel. However, when we arrived I was so pleasantly surprised. The small lobby was decorated with candles creating beautiful soft lighting and a very relaxed feel. The rooms were not as small as I had expected and we had ample room for our two large suitcases. The ensuite was maybe a little small but was adequate - we didn't have to sit sideways on the loo like some other reviewers! Breakfast was great for a quick bite before heading out for a day's sightseeing from the very centrally located hotel. The only reason I did not give this hotel an exellent rating was because our room was overlooking 44th St and from the 4th floor, the noise of the traffic was still pretty loud so I would recommend requesting a room away from the street. The staff were very laid back, almost to the point of being nonchalant but in saying that, we had a problem with the plumbing in the ensuite and it was repaired immediately. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “if you like barren & outdated walmart style hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdf3361
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels in 12 countries and in 30 states in this country. Only one has disappointed as much as did the Mansfield. At a price tag of $400 you do not expect (i)metal TV stand from the Goodwill store (ii)plastic peeling from the bathtub, (iii)marble floors that have not been polished in 20 years and (iv)floors where you debated over whether or not to walk without slippers - there was no carpet, just a very thin strraw "pad". The rooms are small and I can live with that & fully expect it in a city. The hallways on the 10th floor are so narrow that it is difficult to pass by the service cart that the chambermaids use. The hotel has location & a clean & comfortable bar & lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful. Beyond that, you would be better to stay in the suburbs @ a Days Inn & commute in each morning in a limo - and likely save $. With a facelift this could be a relatively nice hotel. At $400 a night the owners should clearly be able to afford renovations unless their occupancy rate is so low that they are struggling.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews on this site, I was a bit skeptical, but I was very pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Our plane arrived at 6am and we checked in at 7am. A room was ready for us and we were allowed to go right up and get ready for our day. While the room was fairly small (but definatley not tiny), as I was walking around the rest of Manhattan, I realized that unless you want to spend a lot of money, ALL rooms are going to be small. It is a very small island packed with millions of people afterall. The hotel was right in the heart of Midtown--2 blocks from Times Square and half a block from 5th Ave. The only complaint I would have to have about the hotel is the lack of ventilation in the bathroom. When taking a hot shower, it became difficult to breathe. The staff was somewhat friendly, but you have to remember that New Yorkers don't have the same level of customer service that you will find in other parts of the country. There was a doorman ready to open our doors and hail our cabs for us during the afternoon hours, which was a great perk for us. The bellmen were curtious and when we asked for an extra towel at 3am, it was at our door in 15 minutes. All in all, I thought this hotel was great and reasonable. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in a hotel central to everything. I booked through Priceline and got a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Price Line it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an interesting experience there. I went there for the 4th of July 2004. I bid on priceline and got the room for $85 per night. It was a great deal and included a continental breakfast for 2. Talked to other people staying there and they paid $260 per night. I would just say USE PRICELINE.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere, a rip off to be sure!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygurl
Reviews.Content: Please stay elsewhere. The sofitel is just across the street. The glitz of the website is positively NOT indicative of this small, run-down, a tad dirty hotel. I paid $250 here through the hotel website and feel like i was really taken. The room was semi-clean, we found trash in the cans and the pillow smelled of perspiration. My daughter got 3 bruises in the bathroom as you couldn't turn around without injuring yourself on the sink, wall, tub, wall phone, etc. amazingly small, would call it teeny or tiny instead. The comp breakfast consisted of no more than dry bagels, muffins and coffee. we had to wait for juice refills. the computers froze upon arrival and we had a 15 minute wait at check in. our room 202 was ON THE STREET and garbage trucks were cruising all night long...no sleep, also the room was just above the entry foyer and at the bar's closing there was very loud laughter that made it impossible to relax...yet another thing, the room straddled the staircase...all this at $250 a night. Please do not waste a night here.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was very, very small. The bathroom did not have a vent. The telephone did not work, the tv did not work very well and the reading lamp did not work. It did have a very nice continental breakfast, but all in all in my opinion, not worth it.
